label: joy
text: When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother's judgement and action on what I had done.

label: joy
text: Got a big fish in fishing.

label: fear
text: Whenever I am alone in a dark room, walk alone on the street, sleep alone in the room at night or see something which is only partly visible.  This emotion was very strong when as an 8 year   old child I saw something horrible.

label: shame
text: I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which was completely inapplicable to the question due to my not having read about the subject matter.

label: disgust
text: I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.

label: joy
text: The day that my boyfriend appeared at home with a pair of rings for our wedding.

label: guilt
text: I went to a pub with a group of friends (not very close) and I was with one girl most of the time, while the other girls in the group wanted to be with me.  They stopped talking to the girl I was with.

label: anger
text: Had an insulting letter from my father.

label: fear
text: I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitress and I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.

label: anger
text: My mother and my sister carried on picking at me all day long for no reason at all and I ended up getting angry.

label: guilt
text: When I see that my mother forces my little brother (15 years) to work very hard for school. I don't agree that she constantly puts him to work, but I don't tell it to her, so nothing changes.

label: joy
text: When we got a young dog.

label: anger
text: I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of them cut up some material I flared up.

label: anger
text: When I saw my brother being attacked and I could not do anything.

label: shame
text: When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discovered things of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I had not mentioned it earlier.

label: guilt
text: After I had cheated my parents that I had lost my textbooks so they had to send me money.

label: disgust
text: When I see rotten meat.

label: joy
text: Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends whom I had known before I moved to a new district five years previously.

label: guilt
text: When my sister had the opportunity to do some modelling work. And I was quite jealous - later on the photographer decided not to take her photograph, and she was very upset - I felt guilty as a result, almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity, by not being genuinely happy for her in the first place.

label: shame
text: When I was a child my parents caught me with a pornographic magazine.

label: shame
text: I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.

label: anger
text: I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment. She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. She expected me to explain it to her.

label: fear
text: Once I had to go home on foot at 5 a.m. I had to pass through a forest and I was going alone.

label: joy
text: After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly I felt peace and joy.

label: shame
text: We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house. The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM. I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.

label: disgust
text: When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at all.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors in communicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts when I only wanted 50 g).

label: fear
text: I was afraid when I met my Uncle because this time I was with my boyfriend I thought I was not going to be given pocket money.

label: fear
text: When I heard that my father had found a letter from my boyfriend and he was calling me to talk about it.

label: anger
text: A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an aggressive manner.

label: fear
text: I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with this person.

label: anger
text: I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, they lost the text-book and gave me no compensation.

label: sadness
text: My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did not care for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack of concern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthur like a brother. He was easy to talk to.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.

label: shame
text: I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an old man when I was in those shoes.

label: joy
text: When I could study at university.

label: joy
text: When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.

label: joy
text: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

label: guilt
text: When my parents quarelled over something I had done and which was wrong.

label: sadness
text: Death of my grandmother.

label: sadness
text: My best friend had a relatively severe illness.  I was sad because she was suffering.

label: shame
text: When inadvertantly I found myself in the ladies room.

label: shame
text: When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second, because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught me napping.

label: shame
text: When I had been angry at my friend without any reason.

label: guilt
text: I've always defended my sister when needed, at the expense of my brother. This has led to feelings of guilt towards him.

label: anger
text: When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.

label: fear
text: I was walking along the passage to my room (very near the anatomy laboratory) and I heard something and felt that there was some thing behind me.  I looked back and there was no one.  I started imagining that maybe it was a corpse.

label: disgust
text: When I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smoking tobacco.

label: joy
text: Finding out that I can go to your English lectures.

label: guilt
text: When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary was taken away from him.

label: fear
text: I was to meet one of my friends (girl) at the library at 8:00 already dark. She would be walking alone. She was 45 minutes late but I kept waiting, calling her room and other places she could have been.

label: guilt
text: Borrowing a car, and then having a minor accident (breaking a headlight).

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the supervisor did not like me.

label: guilt
text: Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.

label: disgust
text: I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do things stupidly and unjustly.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to answer in the presence of the patients.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted to find out that the water isn't filtered or purified before it leaves Latimer Hall from the drains.

label: anger
text: Being treated unfairly.

label: joy
text: When I had my children.

label: shame
text: Recently, I left my bag in the car of someone who picked me up while hitch-hiking. I spent some effort to find out where he lived (I succeeded).

label: fear
text: Continous fear of a nuclear war.

label: shame
text: I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he told me that she was not his girlfriend.  I, to say something, commented that she must be a viscious woman.  He then told me that she was his girl.

label: anger
text: Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by someone close to me.

label: anger
text: I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the girls who did him wrong.

label: fear
text: My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

label: fear
text: When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary school who beat us up.

label: sadness
text: A very close friend left me.

label: joy
text: Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the Asian Olympic.

label: fear
text: My episode of fright happened when I came to study.  I had to stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.

label: joy
text: That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly 9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My joy came after hearing on the radio that I was one of the people selected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at the L.S.H.S.

label: anger
text: When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in public.

label: disgust
text: When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my other friends and me.

label: guilt
text: I escaped from communicating with God for a long time.  I did not read the scriptures and I did not pray.  I felt that I was getting further and further away from God.  I felt guilty as this was because of my laziness.

label: fear
text: I found myself involved in a fight in which a person died and I had to intervene with some risk.

label: guilt
text: When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting the family first.

label: guilt
text: A friend came to visit me and I was not there.

label: anger
text: During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.

label: anger
text: The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that made me angry.

label: disgust
text: I had a class-mate who was rather stupid.  I did not like him but I respected him.  When he tried to talk to someone, they would not listen to him and I could not bear seeing this.

label: guilt
text: Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.

label: disgust
text: Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food, having extremely bad manners.

label: disgust
text: When the summer holiday job was almost over.

label: anger
text: When I was punished in school for no serious mistake of mine.

label: shame
text: My teacher reminded us not to do a Summer job, however I did it for two months.  Yesterday I was chatting with my teacher and when we talked of the Summer job, I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I was about 17 years old and I stole some pens from a stationery store because I didn't have enough money.

label: disgust
text: Whenever I see an alcoholic.

label: guilt
text: I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others. My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.

label: shame
text: I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

label: disgust
text: I once got a phone call stating "one of your friend is in jail, please come and see him".  When I went to the jail and saw him, I was disgusted.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this emotion)

label: shame
text: My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.

label: disgust
text: When I heard the bad news about the death of a close person.

label: disgust
text: After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destination and the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.

label: joy
text: I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the hand of the other person, etc...

label: guilt
text: As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it dying.

label: shame
text: A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.

label: sadness
text: A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised because in front of other people she had always treated him in a friendly way. I am very sad about it.

label: sadness
text: At set-backs.

label: guilt
text: It is some years ago when my mother found me stealing relish in the pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.

label: shame
text: I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect on other people.

label: shame
text: I was angry about 3 months ago and I kicked backwards against the wall. It caved in and so I had to show it to my parents. I had been angry after my mother said something to me about not being able to find clothes in my size - something that I'm sensitive about. (6' 5'' 210)

label: shame
text: I took a girl out once and discovered that she was going around with one of my close friends.

label: fear
text: Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.

label: disgust
text: A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself.  Disgust that turned into sadness-unpleasantness.

label: guilt
text: When I did not give back a text book to a friend in time.

label: shame
text: I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it, but at that time I was not able to remember it.

label: shame
text: Insulted by a teacher in front of the class.

label: shame
text: When my mother looked in my drawer (where I keep my personal things) and she found some porno photos that I have kept from more than a week, and split it.

label: fear
text: It was a week before the higher level results were announced.  I had tried and failed many times and this was the last time that I was taking the exam.  I knew that if i failed again I woulld have to enter the society.  I imagined things during this period - I dreamt that I had entered university and it was a nice experience.  When I thought about the future, an unexplainable fear rose in me.  I feared being a worker and not having a bright prospect, I also feared the criticism of my relatives as my brother had gone to university.  Whenevr I thought of this issue I could not eat or concentrate, and my heart beat increased.

label: shame
text: When I asked my classmate to teach me to do my homework, he asked me to study by myself first but I did not do it.  When he asked me  if I had studied, I felt very ashamed.

label: shame
text: When I dated a close girlfriend's boyfriend a few times. He told me that it was over between them and I accepted it.  When she found out she finished our friendship.

label: fear
text: When I was cycling past a parked car someone opened the door and nearly pushed me off my bike and into the traffic.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.

label: guilt
text: I was at school and afterwards went to work. After work I went to see a friend and stayed out late. when I got home my mother was awake and I felt guilty.

label: sadness
text: At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

label: fear
text: Walking in the dark and thinking about ghost stories.

label: shame
text: After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers of the party, did not drive the intruders away.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the large number of pupils who fail.

label: shame
text: When I was leaving home I decided to leave without saying good-bye to my young brother.  My brother saw me and said,        " Will you not say good-bye to me?"  He is only 31/2 years old.

label: disgust
text: A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.

label: disgust
text: I was returning from the Universtity at night when I was accosted by a boy who molested me, passing his hands on my body.

label: sadness
text: After training for an Australian championship competition for a year and then injuring myself 2 weeks before the competiotion.

label: sadness
text: A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.

label: sadness
text: Lecturers being unfair to me in reports.

label: sadness
text: I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.

label: joy
text: When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.

label: fear
text: I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.

label: anger
text: I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part very well but did not know the second part.

label: joy
text: Renewed contact with an earlier friend.

label: disgust
text: When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a prostitute.

label: anger
text: Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night. Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to church with his parents.

label: sadness
text: I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.

label: fear
text: I was moving in the graveyard at 6.00 pm one day and was griped by fear because I was told that ghosts detain people moving there at night.

label: shame
text: When I fell down.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence   70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.

label: anger
text: When I was left by the person I loved without any reason.

label: shame
text: When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected with copying at a class-work at school.

label: joy
text: This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact a few years ago.

label: disgust
text: An Engineer I know wants war so he can get a job making bombs.

label: fear
text: When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother was out, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.

label: fear
text: Damaged the tap in the residental Hall.

label: anger
text: When my room-mate was making noise deliberately, by playing a flute early in the morning while I was trying to study.

label: disgust
text: My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something he knew was extremely important to me.

label: joy
text: When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a particularly trying period.

label: shame
text: Finding out China is backward in science.

label: anger
text: When a so-called friend let me down, when she promised to tell me when a certain concert was occurring, and that she'd get me tickets. I was really looking forward to it. She did nothing, just told me out of the blue one day what a fantastic concert it was going to be.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine got pregnant anf failed the first year at university.  The boyfriend refused his responsibility and they ended up in court.

label: disgust
text: When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......

label: shame
text: The day my boyfriend saw and touched my breasts when I was without my shirt, only with my pants.

label: guilt
text: When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I thought that I would be found out.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.

label: fear
text: In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed copying.

label: anger
text: At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her, and not being committed to her.

label: guilt
text: When I was young I felt guilty because I thought that I had commited a grave sin.

label: sadness
text: My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic Hospital, then he died.

label: joy
text: It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during an examination of personality while I thought I performed very badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.

label: fear
text: When I was little I lost control of my bike and started to go into a buay intersection but my neighbor stopped me just in time.

label: joy
text: A party I went to last Christmas.

label: sadness
text: The death of a close friend.

label: sadness
text: I did not do as well as I expected on a chemistry exam. I received a score below the average and I thought I had done very well.

label: fear
text: Watching a horror film.

label: sadness
text: I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I had anticipated.

label: anger
text: When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died.  I could not  understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

label: disgust
text: A railways officer, when asked by the ticket checker to produce his tickets, got very aggressive and started abusing and using his authority in a very wrong way.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted as a student in medicine.

label: shame
text: I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and I was defeated.

label: fear
text: When I was just to be divorced.

label: guilt
text: Not finishing homework in time.

label: joy
text: I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people, with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy.

label: shame
text: My grades. When my parents say, "How are you doing at school, getting good grades ?" I say, "Great, just fine !" Actually, I feel ashamed about myself.

label: fear
text: I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and I thought I was lost and was going to panic.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the standard 8 exams for the third time.

label: guilt
text: When I didn't notify someone that he was summoned by a headmaster and as a result he ended being on a heavy punishment.

label: joy
text: Meeting an old friend from high school.

label: shame
text: I received the results of the test paper of my major subject and I found that my result was not as good as a classmate who had recently changed his major subject.    I felt very ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I was trying to have sex with my best friend's girl but she did not agree to it.

label: fear
text: Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in the Polder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: he took over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had something in his hand, we turned until we came across a man, who accompanied us.

label: fear
text: When my friend was involved in a car accident.

label: sadness
text: My best friend suddenly acting strange towards me.

label: fear
text: I woke up in the middle of the night as I had jumped and shouted with fear.  I thought that someone's cold hand or something similar had touched my hand.  I crept down under the covers and went back to sleep.

label: sadness
text: Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years of my life.

label: shame
text: When I failed to answer a simple question.

label: guilt
text: Many years back I quarrelled with my younger brother for a small reason.  I used a pole to beat him and nearly broke his arm.  He recovered after a treatment which lasted several months.  After this our relationship was worse and he would not listen to me.

label: anger
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: anger
text: I was most angry when India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my friend.

label: sadness
text: When my parents got divorced.

label: disgust
text: I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of his mouth while speaking.

label: anger
text: I am one of four directors of a company. We inherited land held by our family - ours is the 5th generation. A "democratic" decision was made to stap-bank an area of mangroves.

label: joy
text: When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something you have striven to.

label: disgust
text: I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me from the inst.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.

label: anger
text: When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arranged to go out together.

label: disgust
text: When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.

label: anger
text: Being put down by the class leaders.

label: joy
text: When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was very happy.

label: fear
text: Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to my parents.

label: guilt
text: I stole a coconut cake from a reception table and when I put in my mouth I realized that the host was watching me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, died after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely person and I did not have the means for his company.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.

label: sadness
text: When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to the hospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up one weekend from CAL to take me home.

label: disgust
text: When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with a rugby tour of South Africa.

label: guilt
text: When I failed an exam for which I knew that I had not studied hard enough.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust after watching a picture on television about torturing political prisoners in India (this happened in the India of Indira Ghandi).

label: shame
text: The first time that I caressed a girl, I was about thirteen and she was eighteen.  I noticed that it did not affect her at all.

label: disgust
text: I saw a man falling on the walkway. He seemed half dead, and was immobile. I felt disgust for the people who passed by without doing anything to help.

label: joy
text: When I passed an important exam.

label: shame
text: When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

label: guilt
text: When my friend ended up pregnant by a gentleman whom I considered to be good and faithful but he ended up neglecting her and not bothering about her.

label: fear
text: Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who it was and why he was there.

label: shame
text: My father died 4 years ago, 18 months after my mother died. I feld my sister was responsible for his death, in that she "hadn't loved him". I felt ashamed for myself, and for my family.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to come here.

label: shame
text: My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.

label: shame
text: Cannot recall the emotion with any force.

label: joy
text: When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned my love.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.

label: joy
text: I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to attend a wedding ceremony.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want to see her anymore.

label: anger
text: In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

label: disgust
text: A lie on the part of a person close to me.

label: disgust
text: When I needed another job and tought that a good and known person (my employer) could help me. He simply said that he couldn't help me.

label: anger
text: When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I was right and she was not.

label: anger
text: My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am, bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and in a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her to really hurt her.

label: anger
text: Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.

label: joy
text: I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long time.

label: shame
text: I was catched when, as a little girl, I played tricks. I was very startled then and wet my pants.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going to separate.

label: guilt
text: Not handing in homework in time.

label: sadness
text: When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

label: anger
text: People having a football match outside the window during the lecture.

label: guilt
text: I failed to complete a working task within the agreed time.

label: joy
text: When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one which I had desired a lot.

label: fear
text: Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to interrupt my studies.

label: anger
text: There was a sofa in my flat which belonged to the old tenants who were acquaintances.  It should have been picked up a year ago but they had postponed it.  Eventually they decided on one date and I stayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do.  They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not got in touch with me.

label: sadness
text: I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at home. As something like that had happened to me several times before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody and I felt very sad.

label: anger
text: One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.

label: disgust
text: When I had to finish those big amounts of homework in time.

label: sadness
text: I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my sadness was so great that until today I remember everything about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people, the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was the greatest sadness I felt.

label: guilt
text: When my parents fight lots of time, when I'm the reason of the fight, I feel guilty.

label: disgust
text: When a friend didn't invite her own parents to her Graduation ceremony.

label: fear
text: When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that we were going to crash.

label: shame
text: When I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I wouldn't have to go to school. I lied to my mother - she realized I had been lying when she got home from work and found that I had been over to a friend's place.

label: fear
text: I had an appointment with a good friend. He came 3 hours later than we agreed upon. During the last hour of waiting I was afraid something might had happened, because usally he is in time.

label: guilt
text: When I don't go to my parents on Sunday and phone them to tell them that I have to study. The truth is that I listened to sports on the radio.

label: anger
text: I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic ordinance. In fact I was innocent.

label: shame
text: Asking someone to give me back the money I once lend him because I needed it myself.

label: anger
text: I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I planned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went to the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my consent.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying colours and that I had made it to the university.

label: disgust
text: A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better than she is.

label: disgust
text: When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young prostitute who was not older than 18.

label: joy
text: Inter-national sports events won by my favourite national team or player brings me joy, e.g when India won the World cup cricket match.

label: fear
text: I was a passenger in a vehicle when suddenly another vehicle came from behind to overtake us.  However another one was coming right in front so the other vehicle changed course and blocked our way and so we crashed against the side of the road.

label: anger
text: I had an accident with damage to the car body.

label: sadness
text: My cat died painfully and slowly.

label: guilt
text: When I deny something to my sister and after a while I feel sorry and try to bypass the situation.

label: shame
text: Not doing well in an examn which was easy.

label: shame
text: When I was caught with someone's daughter.

label: joy
text: A party with friends on New Year's Eve.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could be freed only with big difficulties.

label: joy
text: After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.

label: disgust
text: When my roommate came home at 10 in the morning after sleeping with a guy she did not know because she got drunk. (Se has a boyfriend too).

label: shame
text: I wrote a letter to my father to ventilate my bottled up feelings. Afterwards I thought it was too negative.

label: joy
text: When I passed my B.A exams.

label: anger
text: When some friends betrayed my friendship.

label: guilt
text: When I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where I was (going).

label: fear
text: Anatomy lesson and told we have to do it at night sometimes.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are pregnant illegitimately.

label: joy
text: When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.

label: disgust
text: When I failed my first biochemistry test.

label: fear
text: I was in the dark room, it's insecure and has holes covered with wooden sheets in the roof the establishment had already been assaulted and could be assaulted again.

label: disgust
text: I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was, and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to please God. I could never understand how something that brings you joy could be a sin.

label: anger
text: Argument with roommate over a lock he had put on kitchen cupboard without telling anyone.

label: disgust
text: When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to approach me.

label: joy
text: When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of medicine.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither his fault nor mine.

label: sadness
text: Looking up end-of-semester results, and finding I'd failed three out of seven (subjects).

label: disgust
text: A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

label: shame
text: I told a lie about someone to someone else and they found out   and questioned me about it.

label: joy
text: Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking, picking up shells, laughing, chasing seagulls.

label: fear
text: When there is danger nearby.

label: joy
text: A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go on holiday.

label: disgust
text: A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried to be intimate with me.

label: fear
text: I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I     realized what could have happened.

label: sadness
text: My father's death in January 1983 moved me deeply.  The gloom prevailed for almost two years and I am still to recover from it.

label: anger
text: I was stood up for a date function by someone who I really cared for.

label: guilt
text: I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

label: joy
text: The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when I was with the person I love for the first time.

label: fear
text: I had worries about a certain illness.

label: sadness
text: At an unjust insult or injure.

label: fear
text: Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we would meet.

label: sadness
text: When I left a man in whom I really believed.

label: shame
text: I insulted two of my friends because I thought that had been gossiping about me right under my nose, however I later found out that they were not doing so.

label: guilt
text: I often feel guilty, and it has to do with other people, e.g. if I haven't visited my older relatives for a while.

label: joy
text: When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to have a good time without alcohol.

label: fear
text: I was seven years old and swimming outside the flags at the Gold Coast. I was caught in a rip and taken out about 100 m. I couldn't swim too well, but an older friend (17) swam out and saved me.

label: sadness
text: All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number but I do not think that this was true.

label: shame
text: I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of our national holiday as a servant.

label: disgust
text: In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing with his penis in the middle of the town.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I once went out with another boy and made love with him while I had a close boyfriend.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her and telling nice things to her.

label: shame
text: Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was only "the thing to do", and not really an act of love.

label: shame
text: As a child when I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.

label: shame
text: I remember when I was in Standard 6, I failed one of the terminal tests and I told my parents that I had passed but after they found out from the class teacher that I had failed, I was proved a liar.

label: fear
text: Before an examination.

label: anger
text: Someone messing up the room we share.

label: joy
text: "Boy, you have been admitted to the medicine school and your uncle is coming back fron Canada next week," my father told me and it was a happy moment.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my licence.

label: joy
text: When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.

label: sadness
text: I am always sad when my boyfriend goes away. He lives and studies in an other city. We have gone steady for 2 and 1/2 years and everything is going very well, but sometime this situation makes me feel bad and very lonely.

label: guilt
text: I had stopped talking to a very close friend of mine.  A week later he came over to try and make friends with me  again and from the way he talked I felt that he was a very mean preson.

label: joy
text: At church camp when I accepted Christ into my life and so did my friend.

label: fear
text: After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being robbed in Marocco.

label: shame
text: A mishap suffered on misinterpreting a girl's proposition.

label: shame
text: I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is important to our relationship.

label: anger
text: When a colleague was rude with me because she didn't understand the subject about which I was discussing.

label: disgust
text: When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of mine.

label: shame
text: When I was in the 12th standard, I could not speak English.  One day, while  talking with my relatives I used a wrong word and  my cousin corrected me, believing that I did not know English.  I really felt ashamed then.

label: sadness
text: My fiancT's family was adopting a 5 years old boy. I felt myself close to him as I never felt before. After some time his mother demanded the care of the kid and we were obliged to send him back.

label: guilt
text: When I let a person assume a fault that I committed.

label: joy
text: Once a week I work as a volunteer in a biologic garden. this work in the garden and the contact with other volunteers filled me with joy. They also gave me support after I failed passing my driver's test.

label: anger
text: A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I had to face the situation.

label: sadness
text: I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

label: guilt
text: I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, but actually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was a full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

label: disgust
text: I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of a rat.

label: disgust
text: In ward 2A there was a patient suffering from Syphilitic Paraplegia and had pressure sores. The wounds had offensive smell that only a few people .... the place.

label: guilt
text: When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. However, the next day I said the same thing.

label: guilt
text: Failed to keep an appointment.

label: joy
text: Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in contact again.

label: anger
text: At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me and nobody mentioned anything about that.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the disaster in Bophal (India).

label: shame
text: Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on entering a government building with several people there.

label: anger
text: In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible for his guardian's failure.

label: shame
text: I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.

label: joy
text: When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.

label: shame
text: When I forgot about a meeting at work.

label: anger
text: When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of other persons.

label: anger
text: I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut me off financially and emotionally.

label: disgust
text: If a guy one is not interested in makes advances.

label: disgust
text: When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not democratic.

label: guilt
text: When I took a small boy's share of choclale.  He was our guest and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.

label: sadness
text: General Ye Jianying died.

label: anger
text: During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This led to friction in a lot of situations.

label: disgust
text: While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and felt like crying.

label: joy
text: I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not expected this so I was very happy.

label: sadness
text: As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father.  It was more the ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of my grand-father which made me sad.

label: disgust
text: In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was quite  disappointed and disgusted.

label: fear
text: When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers,  nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.

label: shame
text: I borrowed $ 20.00 from a friend and paid him back much later than I had originally intended.

label: fear
text: To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear delayed me acting to do this.

label: guilt
text: I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use it. She never found out.

label: sadness
text: When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this short time.

label: joy
text: After much trouble getting together in the first place my boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.

label: guilt
text: It happens sometimes in connection with certain persons with whom I have frequent relationships but nothing special.

label: joy
text: I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard from a good friend (from my home town).

label: anger
text: When my dress was stolen.

label: sadness
text: At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothing will ever be the same again.

label: shame
text: Being sexually assulted in public.

label: guilt
text: When in the initial interview for the recruiting, I don't know why, I accepted to do the test for army.

label: sadness
text: A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

label: fear
text: Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road at night - trying to overtake semi-trailer. The truck pulled over onto our side and we hit the wet dirt, swerved back into the truck, back onto the verge, over a guide post and into a ditch.

label: fear
text: When two drug addicts tried to take away my money.

label: anger
text: Realizing that a friend had been talked into signing a certain contract.

label: guilt
text: When the student union leaders were expelled from the university and we continued to study.

label: guilt
text: When my ex-boyfriend didn't want to sleep with me anymore and I insisted. We made love but he felt very badly and I felt guilty.

label: disgust
text: My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and said "the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun was shining on it". Hah Hah.

label: guilt
text: When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother told me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

label: fear
text: I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and ran out of the forest.

label: sadness
text: When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see them as soon as possible.

label: joy
text: When I worked as an "au-pair-girl" in London, I received a call from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and especially when I saw her.

label: joy
text: I felt very happy when I won the football pools.

label: joy
text: I am happpy when I get good results in the field of academics or athletics.

label: shame
text: I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was amused.

label: guilt
text: It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion  picture director, on the radio.  I had planned to go and see his last film.

label: sadness
text: The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed, hitch-hiking to work.

label: sadness
text: My father suddenly fell ill and died.

label: joy
text: Watching the Asian Olympic game (China winning).

label: guilt
text: I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.

label: guilt
text: Once when I was in the cell group (religious activity) I found that almost everyone in the group read the bible daily and I felt guilty in my heart.

label: shame
text: My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out with me only because of my defect.

label: joy
text: Getting into this university to do medicine.

label: sadness
text: Death of paternal grandmother to whom I was very close - died of cancer.

label: guilt
text: I had to undergo an operation in Summer and so my family had to stay at home during the holidays.  I felt guilty, above all because of my brothers.

label: sadness
text: During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she looked miserable.

label: shame
text: I felt the above condition when I was found in a house playing with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was unable to answer.

label: guilt
text: When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.

label: shame
text: Caught cheating on a diet.

label: shame
text: When I did not inform my friends of my forthcoming birthday.

label: fear
text: The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I was very young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was going to crush me.

label: joy
text: I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she had obtained a grant to work in the library.

label: disgust
text: A female friend was violently ill on the return journey from a wedding reception we attended. Getting her out of the car when home took quite a while.

label: fear
text: Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

label: anger
text: Quarreling with classmates.

label: sadness
text: When the thing that made my friends and relatives sad happened to them.

label: guilt
text: Once I quarrelled with my sister and after this I deliberately messed up her belongings.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet frequently anymore.

label: joy
text: Good dinner on the National Day.

label: joy
text: After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for a holiday.  I had never been abroad before and neither had I taken a holiday for a long time.  When finally my parents agreed and we got the airplane tickets I was over joyed.

label: fear
text: When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at home when I was preparing for my MCE examination during the night.

label: fear
text: Before getting back the results of a test in school, when I had worked very hard and was worried about not succeeding.

label: shame
text: While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.

label: joy
text: When I was finally qualified for my profession.

label: shame
text: At a friend's party there were several allusions to my sexual adventures.

label: guilt
text: I couldn't fulfill a promise.

label: shame
text: When I asked a friend to return the money that I had loaned her and then remembered that she had repayed me in several ways.

label: guilt
text: Lack of respect for my parents.

label: disgust
text: When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher" and came from influential families.

label: disgust
text: 4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first episode.

label: fear
text: When I was told to attend an operation in theatre.

label: anger
text: When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional level.

label: anger
text: When a boy tried to fool me so he would be OK trying to show me that he is a gook boy.

label: anger
text: Being mistreated by other people.

label: shame
text: Shame I feel when I am not properly dressed.

label: anger
text: On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.

label: shame
text: At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.

label: guilt
text: Insulting other people.

label: joy
text: When people remember us and shows interest about what we do.

label: joy
text: When a close friend met me at the station in the middle of the night, when I came back from a long and tiring journey.

label: sadness
text: When I was a child I was playing on the upper deck of the bed with my brother.  My parents slept on the lower deck.  My father felt disgusted and beat me up.  I felt very sad as my father had never beaten me or scolded me before.

label: guilt
text: When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved time for it.

label: sadness
text: When I felt lack of aid from close friends.

label: anger
text: Mad at my dad.

label: fear
text: When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied that the ladder was not very stable.

label: shame
text: I had promised to contact a friend about a particular matter by a certain date, then thought no more about it until the friend reminded me after the date had passed.

label: disgust
text: I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother, right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming - probably in pain.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust towards those who are responsible for the death of others.

label: fear
text: I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.

label: guilt
text: When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, so that he was slightly injured.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust as a result of one of my midterms - I thought I had prepared well for it, but the end result wasn't what I had expected.

label: guilt
text: Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.

label: guilt
text: Car accident. I let a 16-year old, incompetent parson take the wheel and I feel very guilty about what happened even though I suffered the worst injuries.

label: sadness
text: When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family and then I learned slowly to understand to life.

label: guilt
text: When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.

label: shame
text: When given responsibility to grade papers in elementary school, I cheated a little and graded my own higher.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I learnt that some of friends found the finished at the Cafeteria because I took food which was more than my share.

label: sadness
text: My sister was impolite to my father when the family was having lunch together at a restaurant.  She thought that our parents had been prejudiced against her, this was an extreme thought.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher.  The notification came by post.

label: disgust
text: When I woke up one morning and went to the kitchen I discovered that our dog had diarrhoea.  There were small "piles" all over the floor and the smell was choking.

label: joy
text: I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my birthday.

label: joy
text: Managed to run 30 Km on skis fairly simply.

label: joy
text: I went to see the entrance examination results at university.  I rejoyced at my success.

label: fear
text: I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively well prepared.

label: joy
text: When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It made me forget all my problems.

label: joy
text: When I received the best actor award at the inter-college drama competition.  It gave me tremendous joy and satisfaction which lasted for several days.

label: sadness
text: During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and other family members crying.

label: sadness
text: My friend was badly hurt.

label: guilt
text: I was caught doing something bad and I bribed the person who caught me.  Later I felt very bad, maybe I should have paid for my bad behaviour.

label: disgust
text: I went to the shopping centre to buy something and saw packets of Kapenta  with maggots in them. Oh !

label: shame
text: A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.

label: joy
text: When I attended the concert of a pop singer.

label: fear
text: When my father was involved in an accident.

label: disgust
text: Saw a mate bribing the leader.

label: joy
text: The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

label: fear
text: Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically beaten - acting as informal bouncer in a gay bar.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I could not feel it at all.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my mother left me alone to live in our house for one month.

label: joy
text: I was accepted by the Chinese university.

label: anger
text: When my father made my mother go through really terrible situations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........

label: shame
text: When my cousin's wife refused him sex and claimed that she was my girllfriend.  I think that there is something wrong with the woman as I have never even thought of having sex with her.

label: sadness
text: Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend went to Greece for a holiday for a month.

label: sadness
text: When I failed an exam last Summer.  I had worked very hard for it and I was very disappointed thinking that it was hopeless to continue at college.  I did overreact.

label: guilt
text: When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.

label: shame
text: Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

label: sadness
text: When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.

label: disgust
text: Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering, over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

label: fear
text: Talking about snakes.

label: anger
text: Sometimes when I go to work my crazy boss (a hyper Jewish lawyer) insists I do things his way (filing, typing, etc.). He sometimes blames me for things I didn't do, and I can't yell back at him.

label: disgust
text: My roommate's lack of consideration of me.

label: guilt
text: When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.

label: guilt
text: I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I haven't done it.

label: shame
text: After taking a difficult midterm for one of my classes, I felt shame for not studying as much as I should have. I was ashamed of the results of the midterm.

label: shame
text: I made a comment and it was interpreted completely differently from what I had meant.  When I said it I realized how my mother had understood it.

label: guilt
text: I was caught sneaking sweets.

label: sadness
text: When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.

label: anger
text: When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.

label: joy
text: When the result of the certificate exam was announced.  I was surprised and happy as the result was better than I had expected.

label: disgust
text: I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me off I was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded him with no excuse to do so.

label: shame
text: I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to leave their home.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successful in my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and was selected for Secondary School.

label: anger
text: I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.  I had booked a seat one month back and I had also got a telegram confirming this.  However, in the train my name had been omitted from the reservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant was alloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for the seat.  I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment when I paid money.

label: sadness
text: When I received my results and found out that I could not go to a school of my choice.

label: anger
text: Yesterday I read in the newspaper that a 30 year old woman had abused her 2 month old son and had caused his death.  I was very angry after reading this as this is not a human act and to abuse so fragile a life is not a forgivable sin.

label: sadness
text: It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for two years for a reason I don't know up to now.

label: shame
text: When I did something naughty and it lead to the embarrassment of my parents.

label: disgust
text: At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.

label: disgust
text: I met a girl (22 years old), married. I liked her. I asked her for a date and I kissed her. I discovered that she lived nearby where I passed every day. I got amused thinking that her husband would be ... or me . I didn't talked to her anymore.

label: sadness
text: When I learnt that I had failed an exam,  This not only influenced my emotions but also other important tasks, it also made my record imperfect.

label: joy
text: A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once she had a child she had a better relationship with them.

label: guilt
text: When my niece was 3 years old she was in the living room while we were fixing the table for a birthday party and, as every child, she couldn't stay calm. She burst a balloon. When I told her to be quiet her father pinched her. I believe if I hadn't said anything this wouldn't have happened.

label: shame
text: I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.

label: guilt
text: During an argument with my brother, I behaved rather intransigently, even cruelly, wishing to morally hurt the "person" opposed to me.

label: joy
text: My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it was really good - though really insane conversation.

label: guilt
text: I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely, for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me that she had been waiting for some news from us.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the Free University in Driebergen.

label: shame
text: When I met a friend of mine after several months.

label: shame
text: When I tried to steal a book from the bookshop and was caught.

label: joy
text: When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long time, would come and see me.

label: fear
text: I should have given a test lesson to get a job. I had no courage. I didn't make the test.

label: shame
text: When caught shoplifting and the police were called in parents also informed.

label: shame
text: Felt it after I spoke terribly (got mad at) the person who is the most important in my life.

label: joy
text: When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.

label: sadness
text: I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knocked down by a car.

label: disgust
text: My friends aren't working for the same common goal we all need to accomplish.

label: fear
text: When my sister was very ill and was admitted to the hospital.

label: disgust
text: When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people killing each other.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I had wanted to.

label: shame
text: When I failed the M.S.C exam.

label: shame
text: One day in class, the professor asked me a question concerning something he had been explaining.  He was very close to me (beside me) and I had no idea what to answer.

label: shame
text: When I inadvertantly entered the ladies room and met some girls on my way out.

label: disgust
text: I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.

label: sadness
text: Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.

label: fear
text: Car accident nearly occurred between us and drunk driver coming in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided (after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.

label: anger
text: When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological investigation and then I got really angry.

label: disgust
text: When a close friend of mine maintained a relationship with me till she needed me and broke it off when she did not need me.  She behaved life a really selfish person.

label: fear
text: When I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool that I use to go almost not excaping.

label: anger
text: Made mistakes in exam.

label: guilt
text: Being disloyal with persons I loved.

label: joy
text: Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood first in my class.  Thus I got the first prize from the college.  I was most happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.

label: sadness
text: It happened when I lost two very intimate friends in a car accident.

label: fear
text: In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.

label: shame
text: Being criticized by teacher in public.

label: guilt
text: When I was responsible for getting my friend run-out in a vital cricket match.

label: shame
text: I had a short lasting sexual relationship with someone I didn't love.

label: disgust
text: I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a bad language but was a very smart looking lady.

label: sadness
text: When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact with my parents.

label: anger
text: When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have my point of view and they monopolise a conversation.

label: fear
text: Could not find my way out in the college building at night.

label: fear
text: When I was going home for my holiday, I almost drowned in the Zambezi river.

label: fear
text: When I thought that I had failed the examination.

label: guilt
text: When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is aware that I know that they are wrong.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.

label: anger
text: I was very angry when my friend lost my practical's journal, which I needed to study for the exams.

label: guilt
text: After an argument with a friend of mine.

label: fear
text: Taking a chemistry midterm.

label: sadness
text: When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him understand I felt miserable.

label: disgust
text: Getting a low grade on my physics midterm.

label: fear
text: My mom called early in the morning (On a Monday) and I had just seen her that weekend. I couldn't understand what could be so important as to make her call at such a strange hour. I missed the call and had to call her back that afternoon.

label: sadness
text: The second time I went to the entrance exam to V.S.P. and didn't get approved.

label: shame
text: At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.

label: fear
text: My roommate refused to walk with me to the English lectures. I have to walk alone in the dark. Lectures are in the biology building.

label: shame
text: I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court. I went to see what would happen to him.

label: disgust
text: One day my colleague misbehaved with me.  I felt disgusted and thought to myself that he could only do this because I was a woman.

label: sadness
text: I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.

label: shame
text: I did badly in the mid term examination.

label: anger
text: When my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room after I had told her that I was  only in the bathroom having a shower.  She left and I had to do without supper.

label: sadness
text: To fight with a sister and to know that she doesn't care.

label: shame
text: In school I was very bad in running long distances and my class-mates laughed at me for this reason.

label: fear
text: I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having injured it badly.

label: joy
text: When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and went well.

label: joy
text: Emotional reassurances by spouse.

label: shame
text: A man asked me: "May I sleep in your stairway?"  and I answered "No".

label: shame
text: I was in a very small class and the professor said something about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.

label: fear
text: I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as a failure.

label: fear
text: Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.

label: shame
text: When I failed the S.S.C examination I felt very ashamed.

label: joy
text: Birth of children.

label: joy
text: I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

label: joy
text: Going to Chico to visit a friend.

label: disgust
text: When I had to plunge in a swamp of fetid and stagnant water.

label: disgust
text: Doesn't apply.

label: joy
text: I had a friend who I didn't see for a long time. We had a relationship from much union and interaction. It was more that one year that I didn't see her. She appeared in my home and we talked.

label: disgust
text: When I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.

label: shame
text: When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his parents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.

label: shame
text: Participating in a theft several years ago.

label: sadness
text: Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told the group around us of advances I had made.

label: fear
text: Introducing myself at a first tutorial this year at University.

label: disgust
text: I was supposed to be studying for my math midterm a few days ago, however, I fooled around with my roommate, and didn't start studying until 12:00 am. I was disgusted with myself.

label: sadness
text: When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was the first time that I lost a brother.

label: shame
text: A friend started to insult another person without reason and I felt ashamed of her behavior.

label: joy
text: Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They were special people to me.

label: sadness
text: The loss of my father as he died of a massive and sudden heart attack.

label: shame
text: Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not understand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.

label: disgust
text: A person whom I thought to be honest took and spend the little money that I had and I had no way of getting any money in the few following months.

label: joy
text: I spent a lovely relaxing evening with my boyfriend. We played games and talked all evening.

label: disgust
text: At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with a guy she knows I really like.

label: fear
text: I was very scared when I went to the examination hall for my M.Sc examination as I had studied a limited partion of the course thoroughly and I was in great doubt whether that would be asked.

label: disgust
text: When I saw President Reagan get elected.

label: sadness
text: My nephew's mother just left one day (my brother and she were not married). My nephew, Anthony, was shaken. I was sad for him because a similar situation happened to me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died after a long illness.

label: shame
text: The day my fiancee told me that it was bad that I could not write my mother tongue.

label: guilt
text: When a patient in the ward died (one who had been under my care). I felt as if I didn't give the appropriate care to the patient.

label: shame
text: When we received  our academic result I learnt that my  results were bad as I had not done my best.  The results of my accquaintances were good and when they asked me about my results I really did not want to answer.

label: disgust
text: After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.

label: anger
text: I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent words.

label: anger
text: When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in the U.E.F.A cup.

label: shame
text: I woke up at the house of someone I knew, not remembering very much about what had been said or done during the party on the previous night.

label: shame
text: When I made acquaintance with the parents of my boyfriend for the first time. They spoke Limburgian (a dutch dialect) and one of my first remarks was that I disliked Limburgian dialect.

label: shame
text: China not winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympics.

label: shame
