text: When parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry their daughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl accepted everything and later she followed what her parents insisted and she told me never to talk to her again.

label: disgust
text: I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefs who were all fighting and going against what they would say was good.

label: guilt
text: I once felt guilty when a certain passenger in the same (ship, plane ?) which I boarded when coming from home lost his 10t which in fact fell into my pocket unknowingly.

label: anger
text: Being hooted at when I was learning to drive.

label: fear
text: When I was walking along a road alone on my way to go shopping.

label: sadness
text: This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutely heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was "TRUE LOVE" !!

label: guilt
text: When I wished secretly and lied to a friend of mine because I didn't want her to stay in my house on the beach (as she always does), and wouldn't stick on me.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, my closest friends were here at Berkeley pithched in a lot of money each and bought me ten records to replace some of my records that were stolen. They threw a small surprise party for me too.

label: disgust
text: When I was a young teenager (14)  my brother-in-law to be had made heavy advances to me.  I did not understand very well what it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are still there.

label: disgust
text: Does not apply.

label: guilt
text: Stealing money from a milk token jar from a close friend of the family when visiting.

label: anger
text: When someone chased me from his house.

label: shame
text: I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also a friend of mine.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: sadness
text: Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland for a year as an exchange student.

label: guilt
text: This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.

label: shame
text: Once as a school girl I was copying at a class work and my teacher spotted me.

label: fear
text: Someone attacked me with a knife.

label: sadness
text: When my sister left to go home, in Sweden, after the Christmas Holidays.

label: anger
text: When the person I am going out with let me down in a situation that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.

label: disgust
text: Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.

label: anger
text: Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of my friends.

label: shame
text: I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.

label: anger
text: Someone played a trick on me.

label: sadness
text: When I knew that a person that I liked very much didn't react the way I would like to, even that I knew about his feelings for me.

label: sadness
text: The saddest moment in my life was when I lost my younger sister a few years back.

label: guilt
text: Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.

label: disgust
text: My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I could not but detest him.

label: shame
text: When I broke-down while seeing off my friend.

label: shame
text: While shopping, a person close to us created an uncomfortable situation for those who were with her.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in Nijmegen where I study.

label: anger
text: When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother in confindence.

label: fear
text: I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at a distance of about four metres.

label: disgust
text: Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the refectory of our institute.

label: disgust
text: I saw part of a Prince video with him crawling out of a bath tub.

label: anger
text: I had been in love with a certain young man who pretended to love me but one day I found out that he had another girlfriend who was also a friend of mine.

label: guilt
text: A certain colleague of mine sent me to buy a bag of flour for him, he gave me K20. Unfortunately I lost it.

label: fear
text: When I was travelling home by bus and suddenly the bus hit and the bus leaned against a wall.

label: anger
text: In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from my juice pot (one litre) so that I only got one glass out of the whole pot.

label: disgust
text: In Punjab, when in the name of religion people killed each other during the agitation.

label: joy
text: Had a letter from my father (usually he does not write to me).

label: fear
text: Fear came towards the end of May when the P.T.S. results were out after hearing the failure of my fellow three friends.

label: shame
text: In an important situation for me, my father behaved inadequately.

label: guilt
text: When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

label: sadness
text: When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4 weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I had a job there.

label: sadness
text: I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I failed and so I felt very sad.

label: sadness
text: My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

label: guilt
text: When I provoked a fight with my mother, hurting her feelings very much.

label: sadness
text: The death of a friend.

label: joy
text: I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our "11-months jubilee", I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red rose.

label: fear
text: Staying in the room alone at night.

label: joy
text: When I saw the certificate results, I did not feel very happy as I did not realize that I had got all the credits until my classmates pointed it out to me.  My parents and my relatives praised me and I realized that my results were good i.e 2A, 5B, 2C.  I felt satisfied with the results and was happy.

label: disgust
text: When a boy whom I refused to be my lover told all his friends that I was his girl he has refused me because I was not faithful to him.

label: shame
text: I fell down in the bus when it braked suddenly and everybody started looking at me.

label: guilt
text: I thought that I could have avoided the above situation (the one in fear) if I had concentrated more on my work, which I hate.

label: guilt
text: Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the association).

label: sadness
text: A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: Because I had not studied.

label: sadness
text: When I received the news that my beloved grandmother had died.  I was at the boarding school and was only 13 years old.

label: sadness
text: Getting separated from my girlfriend.

label: fear
text: When I had my first oral examination after a long time; especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up for it.

label: joy
text: Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in our fate.

label: anger
text: A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected his call impatiently but in vain.

label: anger
text: When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew nothing about this.

label: fear
text: I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to me, of the unknown.

label: disgust
text: When I was molested by an old drunk man.

label: disgust
text: When my parents behave very "witty" towards me, they make insipid jokes about which they laugh. Or my mother who treats me like a little child.

label: sadness
text: Insulted by my mother.

label: anger
text: I'm crazy about football. When my team lost a goal in the Paulist championship, and so it lost the classifications.

label: fear
text: I needed a recommendation for something. I decided that the best person to get one from was a professor who I had never talked to before. I felt a lot of fear going up after class to ask him to recommend me considering he had never heard my name before. But I did.

label: fear
text: When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through a wood.

label: fear
text: It was the time when I was in no position to secure a Ist class in the M.Sc exam and this was likely to affect my career.

label: anger
text: When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

label: anger
text: I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay program on TV.  In my opinion, the topic was important and the program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.

label: sadness
text: I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.

label: shame
text: When I am angry at someone without a good reason. Later on it proves that he didn't do anything wrong.

label: disgust
text: I attended a ceremony in Denmark which is comparable to our Halloween. They build a large bonfire and place a life size dummy of a witch. The crowd cheered when the dummy burst into flames.

label: shame
text: I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them down.

label: guilt
text: My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get her on my back, she slipped and fell.

label: anger
text: My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and ridiculous point of view made us angry.

label: sadness
text: Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the         biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.

label: fear
text: When there was a bomb threat in Tolman Hall. This was the first time that I felt my life could be in danger.

label: joy
text: When I met friends I had not seen for the last 2-4 years.

label: joy
text: Winning Queensland Chess Championship.

label: guilt
text: I call my mother at least once a week. However last week I completely forgot. This morning she called me, she thought I felt ill.

label: guilt
text: Attending to a demand made by a client (I work in a bank) I suggested her an application of money in a week ahead, but I informed her wrongly. The client arrived a week after and the application wasn't made and she lost with this a lot of time and money.

label: guilt
text: The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being right dominated.

label: anger
text: When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raised criticisms all the time.

label: anger
text: I experience this emotion quite often but the day I was most angry was the day I got pulled up for something I had not done.  It happened during my school days, I had not spoken a word in class but the monitor had written my name on the board.  So I had a remark in my callender which I had to get signed by my parents.  This remark resulted in me being spanked.

label: anger
text: When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more money to carry on studying.

label: anger
text: I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well and someone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.

label: shame
text: I was learning judo and my instructor wanted me to assist him in teaching girls judo at a suburban college.  I was just a beginer, and he made me a green belt so that I would be able to command respect.  This was against my principles, and yet I allowed myself to listen to him.  I gave it up soon after, however I felt very ashamed at not sticking to my principles and at not having put my foot down earlier.

label: fear
text: Climbing a mountain, I got stuck and realized I could get neither up nor down.

label: shame
text: My article not chosen by the college newspaper

label: fear
text: You may find out that I am stupid and not to let me do your experiment.

label: joy
text: When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a kindergarten.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed when I am praised.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a big spider from very close.

label: fear
text: When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.

label: anger
text: Seeing this badly made questionnaire.

label: disgust
text: For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

label: shame
text: My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

label: shame
text: When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I respect.

label: anger
text: I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful message.

label: guilt
text: I told my elder brother that he was irresponsible and that I did not care for what he did because he was teasing me.

label: shame
text: I fell on the ground while crossing the street.  My cap covered my eyes and I felt quite "difficult".

label: fear
text: Listening to horrot stories at night.

label: fear
text: I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.

label: disgust
text: This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman (prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered by the guardian.

label: fear
text: Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.

label: joy
text: When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my lover and future wife.

label: guilt
text: Guilt conscious struck me when I failed my Standard Two Examinations in 1972. I knew that I would suffer the consequences of what I had been doing during class hours: thus playing with friends and sometimes not even going to school.

label: fear
text: One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I was interested.  On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I had not expected) and went back home without seeing the film.

label: joy
text: After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in 1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the Examination when the results were out.

label: fear
text: I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I almost didn't enter University.

label: fear
text: Fear of sexual overtures from a close relative in the family.

label: fear
text: Suddenly met someone in the biology building at night.

label: guilt
text: When I do not put in the needed amount of hours of work or study for the day, I feel guilty and try to make up for the lost time.

label: sadness
text: For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief when you are away from home, too.

label: disgust
text: When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.

label: disgust
text: This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and found him screwing my girlfriend.

label: fear
text: This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

label: guilt
text: When I spoke ill of a fellow worker in the absence of this person.

label: joy
text: A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to the university.

label: disgust
text: When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.

label: anger
text: One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed by without stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengers inside.  I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and  conductor.

label: shame
text: NO RESPONSE

label: shame
text: My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she is right.

label: joy
text: When my son was born.

label: guilt
text: I do not help out enough at home.

label: shame
text: Not being able to answer question in a seminar.

label: fear
text: When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the spot.

label: joy
text: When I had a good result in the certificate examination.

label: joy
text: Last year my freshman yr. It was a day in March I did well on some tests. I seemed to finally adjust to college, it was hot and sunny. I was walking in front of a frat. when I heard Beach Boys "Surfin'USA". I had this overwhelming feeling that to be at CAL was good. I still have it somewhat.

label: disgust
text: When one of my friends started misbehaving.

label: sadness
text: Failing examn.

label: shame
text: That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men with priviledge. Not using it positively.

label: sadness
text: When one of my cat died of a disease.

label: sadness
text: When I found that my coldness had hurt somebody's sincerity.

label: joy
text: My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

label: joy
text: Being asked to go out by someone I care.

label: guilt
text: Not being able to help my friend.

label: anger
text: An argument among several friends because of the irrational behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and said that we were to blame.

label: disgust
text: The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual crimes generally) a couple of years ago.

label: sadness
text: When I was in primary 6, my father died.  I was very young then and did not know what had happened.  The weeping of my relatives and my tears made me sad.

label: anger
text: When I quarelled with my parents.

label: anger
text: I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my father, however he misused the money.

label: sadness
text: Finding out my best friend cannot go to the English lectures.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers - no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be sitting in the "lliving" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't.

label: shame
text: I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen.  I was with a friend and did not know that she was related to this man.  My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.

label: shame
text: I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend disliked it when I played majong (a game of gambling).  I expressed my regrets and when I went to see her she neglected my existance.  I was very angry and left in displeasure.

label: anger
text: When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with certain other friends which they thought was improper.

label: joy
text: When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.

label: guilt
text: Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.

label: joy
text: Finding out my grades at the end of my freshman year.

label: anger
text: While I was away for the weekend some friends went into my room and played my very expensive stereo without asking me or my roommate.

label: sadness
text: Not being accepted by classmates in university.

label: sadness
text: My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of the irritation.

label: fear
text: I was inside the car with my husband and we were assaulted with a gun at 10 o'clock in the evening.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I was pregnant.  I thought about what my relatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot of self pity.

label: joy
text: I had gone camping with my old classmates and there was a storm.  We were in a flurry but at that time I felt the love and concern of my friends.

label: shame
text: Sincerely I'm a very timid guy and so even in very simple situations sometimes I am ashamed.

label: fear
text: I and my cousin went to a filmshow at night. We went without making it known to my mother. While we were there at interval, I came across my mother just close to where we sat.

label: guilt
text: A friend wanted to give me a surprise into my room and I thought she was stealing from the room.

label: anger
text: In certain occasion I have a fight with my boyfriend. During the fight I closed the door at his face. He went away but came back next day.

label: shame
text: When I was little - Mum caught me telling a lie about who broke the cup.

label: fear
text: Climbing a mountain to see a view, towards the top we suddenly came across a ledge with a nearly sheer drop on either side, which I had to cross.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when once I was asleep and dreamed that I was dying asfixiated by a cardiac attack, I was afraid and woke up desperate. Altough I wasn't afraid of death I was afraid.

label: sadness
text: When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).

label: disgust
text: Seeing persons spending money in a shopping center with completely indifference to the misery reigning in our country.

label: disgust
text: When I got to know the details if the famine in East Africa.

label: disgust
text: I was dancing Malipenga (traditional dance). I exaggerated the steps I was supposed to make in the negative way. This happened in front of spectators. It was bad for our Boma (group) because I was on the front line where ability is displayed and it is this ability that counts when choosing the winning side.

label: disgust
text: I was working in a classmate's house with a group. A girl began to graze her foot against mine under the table.

label: anger
text: When my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived and "different" from other children at school.

label: shame
text: When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place, though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with my pals.

label: anger
text: I can't remember being truly angry. Usually it's just disappointment that I feel. One situation would be with my brother. He and I used to be close but now he seems to be avoiding me.

label: guilt
text: Being rude to someone I do not like.

label: shame
text: For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.

label: joy
text: When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously met.

label: shame
text: My aunt phoned me to ask me why I had refused the her invitation to dinner at her home on the New Year's Eve.

label: fear
text: My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to "be free".  He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed.

label: joy
text: On meeting an old friend of mine.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the University.

label: shame
text: I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the first time with a girl.

label: disgust
text: When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in front of a group of my friends.

label: joy
text: When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.

label: guilt
text: I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little too much with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly and she started crying.

label: anger
text: When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be examined by good experts and she deceived me.

label: joy
text: Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I could have embraced everybody.

label: guilt
text: I told my pesent boyfriend that I was an Australian as are my parents. As the relationship developed I found it harder and harder to confess and became sure it would end our relationship. He eventually found out when told in front of me by my mother.

label: guilt
text: I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our relationship.  I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to be free.  I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained firm and did not change my mind.

label: shame
text: When coming up for trial because of shop lifting.

label: sadness
text: A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had once regarded as great and significant.

label: sadness
text: When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill and probably would die. We had not expected this because he was always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn, gave him medicines during the night.

label: shame
text: This was when I was discovered stealing a piece of bread at home, I was very hungry a few hours before supper.

label: shame
text: When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work expected of me was not going to be in.

label: shame
text: At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.

label: shame
text: When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it, by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own urine from the wet soil, I did it.

label: anger
text: I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was half an hour late.

label: joy
text: Talkiing about the past happy hours with two friends at night in a camp a few months ago.  We shared our feelings, notions and every hidden anxiety.  I thought that they cared for me and I was very happy and satified.

label: guilt
text: I "snapped" very abruptly at my mother when she said something silly and stupid, (in front of other people) she looked so defenceless & hurt & told them that I'm always doing that.

label: shame
text: My companion admired me when I did some work voluntarily.

label: fear
text: Practicing wind-surf my body was caught under the sail. On trying to get out my leg was caught in the lashing. I was afraid of dying by asphixia.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me about it before.

label: shame
text: When a group of friends began to make critics about me.

label: disgust
text: At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.

label: shame
text: When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.

label: anger
text: I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, the pedology lecturer was the cause.

label: fear
text: I was alone at home, a man forced the front door which was locked, forced and tried to open a window.

label: anger
text: When I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be a stranger.

label: anger
text: Someone borrowed my textbook and deliberately did not return it.

label: fear
text: A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the central underground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockers who were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.

label: guilt
text: Not thanking relatives for a favor done.

label: sadness
text: My roommate's sister committed suicide.

label: guilt
text: When I talked to another student about the notes she got last semester, not knowing that she got a lot of bad grades.

label: guilt
text: When I got associated with a boy one year ago, I neglected my best friend. When the relation with this boy finished she behaved very easy-going towards me. I felt guilty then.

label: guilt
text: I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, I realized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop - and I then needed the money.

label: anger
text: Somebody was blaming me of a story which was not real and not true.

label: guilt
text: Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has happened many times.

label: anger
text: I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered me greatly.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text and didn't stop stuttering.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a person panhandling money on Telegraph.

label: disgust
text: When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.

label: anger
text: When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and looking down on me.

label: anger
text: I am currently taking CS 50P. I had to finish a couple of assignments but I was hindered because I could not get a passing score on my program.

label: joy
text: When I found out that I can travel with my best friend.

label: fear
text: When I got in jungle where there was a great number of snakes.

label: fear
text: Canoeing across harbour in winds - 20 knots and rising seas.

label: fear
text: I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day, my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could influence my parents to take it easy.

label: anger
text: My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was terribly angry with my sister.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a wino by some cans with Food Stamps and use the change to buy wine.

label: guilt
text: When a mistake occurred at work which I was not responsible for.  This was disclosed later.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by her friends.

label: shame
text: I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.  I had raised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.

label: anger
text: When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to do this.

label: disgust
text: When my cat vomited and a worm came out which was still alive.  I was forced to wipe it up.

label: joy
text: When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people and close friends.

label: anger
text: Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.

label: joy
text: Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much. Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their group, although it was late in the evening.

label: disgust
text: Someone ruining someone's property just for the fun of it.

label: anger
text: When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a very good friend.

label: anger
text: When I came back to my hostel, my bed was full of newspapers and dirty clothes.  My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for him as he had no time (this was his responsibility).  The food we shared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).

label: anger
text: In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between my group and the graduation commission (two students of my classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about them.

label: sadness
text: I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep going because it was late and I would be back in the next few days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

label: shame
text: I was made a very sharp remark at a rehearsal.

label: fear
text: When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would accidentally go off.

label: fear
text: My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

label: fear
text: When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was forced to.

label: shame
text: When I have a plain appearance.

label: guilt
text: I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.

label: anger
text: I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend which was not true because the girl was just a friend of mine.

label: shame
text: During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he didn't deserve it.

label: anger
text: I missed the train and had to wait for the next for two hours. For this reason I missed an appointment which had been very important for me.

label: guilt
text: I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that there was no reason for that.

label: disgust
text: Now that the 49ers are winners, the fans are coming out of the woodwork and jumping on the bandwagon and that disgusts me.

label: joy
text: Passed the last exam.

label: joy
text: I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve the pains of a patient.

label: sadness
text: I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better appearance.

label: anger
text: A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.

label: sadness
text: Hearing about developments of sience in the West a lot better than China.

label: fear
text: I had gone to the hospital for my research and got late in reaching home.  I feared that when I reached home there would be a quarrel because of my being late.

label: fear
text: Beaten up by a classmate in school.

label: disgust
text: At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my elder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack of understanding.

label: fear
text: The first time that I saw a dead person.  This was when I started my gross anatomy practicals.

label: fear
text: When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at night, and two men started closely following me. There was nobody around that I could run to.

label: disgust
text: I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.

label: anger
text: Korean judges cheating.

label: shame
text: When I was in lower six I joined an interview group to interview the general public.  One of my friends in the group lost her purse and she was very nervous.  Five of us had to go another place so we left her, and planned to see her later.  Then I heard her describing how her purse looked.  I realized that I had seen her purse on the floor and had not wanted to do any thing about it.

label: fear
text: A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had certainly happened to her.

label: disgust
text: Saw someone spitting in public.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died.

label: disgust
text: I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read about a woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.

label: anger
text: In form three we were taking our mock exams and someone else (a friend) was making noise when the examinateur picked on me and said that he would tear up my answer sheet.  I got very angry with the girls involved.

label: guilt
text: Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

label: anger
text: Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.

label: guilt
text: While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and someone elses in a minor way.

label: joy
text: When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment "myself" i.e on my own initiative.

label: fear
text: It was last week on Saturday night when I was at Mchesi. I feared to cross the Lilongwe River Bridge to come back to School due to darkness - until somebody had to escort me.

label: sadness
text: I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences, after having spend two weeks there with my friends.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.

label: shame
text: One night a friend found out that I dumped one girl for another and he proceded to lecture me.

label: shame
text: Adultery with the girlfriend of a friend of mine, of which he learned.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.

label: sadness
text: When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three years.

label: disgust
text: The day I was forced to use a public convenience place in town.  It was so filthy that it really made me sick.

label: joy
text: I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months.  I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we went there because we knew we would meet there.

label: shame
text: When I overslept for the second time on the day I had an examination.

label: joy
text: I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for College education.

label: sadness
text: I finished the relationship with my boyfriend, after having felt myself very unhappy for a long time.

label: anger
text: I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

label: sadness
text: I did not quite succeed in breast feeding my baby.

label: fear
text: Facing a mad dog.

label: joy
text: At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging that fact to members of family and friends.

label: sadness
text: During the Physics experiment session I did not understand the content of the experiment and did not know how to do it.

label: sadness
text: Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

label: disgust
text: Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

label: shame
text: When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle of the class and I had to gesticulate.

label: fear
text: A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals - they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2 nights.

label: shame
text: An exam where questions about very specific knowledge were asked.

label: disgust
text: A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.

label: anger
text: Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.

label: anger
text: After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

label: shame
text: Failing university entrance examn.

label: guilt
text: The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because my attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.

label: guilt
text: My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still haven't had time to see her.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love in an abominable way.

label: guilt
text: I blew up at someone for being confused and because of his irresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had no right.

label: disgust
text: With my mouth full of bun, I drank directly from a packet of milk which turned out to be weeks old (completely separated).  It took a while for the milk to seep through the bun.

label: joy
text: My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.

label: guilt
text: I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some time later I apologized for that.

label: fear
text: Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraid to be left alone and that I could not manage it.

label: sadness
text: I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).

label: fear
text: I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright till I got hold of her.

label: disgust
text: I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to know each other. I was found by Mercy red-haded when I was with Maria.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt when my friends were punished to slash grass at the gound because of making noise in class. I was in the group of noise-makers but I denied having done any noise.

label: guilt
text: I was drunk one night and I insulted three ladies.  The following morning they approached me and asked me the reason behind my bahaviour, I apologized for my unruly behaviour.

label: anger
text: When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when somebody told me that my previous boyfriend was her boyfriend.

label: sadness
text: At the death of a close relative.

label: guilt
text: Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.

label: anger
text: When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry. I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does  badly at school, my family members blame me as well.

label: fear
text: When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.

label: guilt
text: When I have to take exams I am very excited and have not much time for the housekeeping. Then my friend has to do everything.

label: anger
text: In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.  There was a fight.

label: disgust
text: When I was travelling to school by bus, I went past a place where a sewer had been repaired.  There was a bad strong smell which suffocated me and I wanted to leave the place immediately.

label: fear
text: One time I set up my journey at night going to a certain bar. On the way I met my friends and they told me that two people had died because of heavy fighting. I proceeded on but with fear.

label: guilt
text: When I was face to face with my deceived friend after sleeping with his wife.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former secondary school.

label: sadness
text: Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a few days before and then one morning it was gone.

label: fear
text: My friend will find out that I am in love with her.

label: anger
text: A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was very angry about that.

label: disgust
text: When I see someone vomitting.

label: guilt
text: Made a misjudgement in a football match.

label: disgust
text: When I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked had been sold to somebody else.

label: fear
text: Before going to the dentist.

label: fear
text: I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of the foxtail.

label: shame
text: When I met a friend whom I had not seen for a long time and heard all about her troubles, I thought that I should have got in touch with her earlier.

label: joy
text: I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher seemed satisfied.

label: joy
text: Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately happy until a year or so ago.

label: anger
text: I was really pissed when the Russians boycotted the '84 Olympics. I had anger towards them and Jimmy Crter. I was very anxious to see it.

label: guilt
text: When I moved away from home.

label: anger
text: When my girlfriend left me to go out with another guy, even though she knew that she was wrong.

label: fear
text: When going to the exam.

label: joy
text: When I met an old schhol friend (school love) who works in Sk+vde.

label: guilt
text: When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guilt is a part of my feelings.

label: anger
text: The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away after he showed had his meals.

label: disgust
text: Very intoxicated men who incite each other to fight.   I met a vile smelling man on the tram who got closer and closer to me till I got up, then he got angry.

label: shame
text: When my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.

label: joy
text: When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought the cloth after months of hindrances.

label: sadness
text: A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumn night. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved in another man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, it is painful for me to remember about it.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could not make it to the second year.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant that a close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.

label: shame
text: A month ago I turned in an English paper in late after I had already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it again.

label: disgust
text: Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I found roaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came over and checked.

label: joy
text: When my last year's second semester results came through - I was ecstatic.

label: anger
text: When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.

label: fear
text: I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how to swim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.

label: guilt
text: When I shouted at my mother when she was nervous and depressed.

label: anger
text: My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had done nothing.

label: joy
text: The way this particular girl spoke, behaved, and reacted the first time I was introduced to her, I felt certain that something between us would materialize.

label: fear
text: When I was going to take the practical exams.

label: shame
text: When I failed the grade seven exams.

label: anger
text: I was on a farm with a few friends and during the talk I discovered that a friend of mine, was being betrayed by her boyfriend and a 3rd friend of ours.

label: fear
text: I was in about Grade 7, I came home from school one day and was told that my mother had skin cancer and would have to go to the hospital straight away.

label: shame
text: When I was hungry, I tried to take the money that my mother had saved up for something else.

label: sadness
text: When I came back from my holidays.

label: fear
text: The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what my parents would further do to distroy my relationship.

label: fear
text: In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring to a question I posed. I felt very unsure and I was afraid to fail.

label: joy
text: When my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.

label: anger
text: When I found out that my good friend and roommate did not pay the phone bill and electric bill like he promised and let me down.

label: fear
text: Staying alone in a dark place.

label: guilt
text: When I laughed at a lame man walking down the road, it looked funny at the time but later I felt lousy.  It was the same day that I had stolen some coins from my mother in the shop.

label: anger
text: When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in the presence of my boyfriend.

label: sadness
text: After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

label: sadness
text: It was shocking news to me when I received a telegram from home telling me that my grandmother had passed away. I had to go home to attend the funeral but unfortunately I found that the burial had already taken place.

label: sadness
text: Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.

label: shame
text: I ate very fattening food in front of my boyfriend who would like me to lose weight. I am supposedly pursuing a modelling career but first I must lose weight. I had been trying to diet.

label: disgust
text: When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.

label: shame
text: When my friend had a child out of wedlock.

label: fear
text: I have done the teachers training course (B.Ed).  During our training I was asked to handle the ninth standard class in a boys school.  I was scared to face the class the first day.

label: anger
text: A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning because we had business on the following day. The instructor tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite of everything, all the time he made me angry.

label: fear
text: After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

label: anger
text: I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her, however she had not understood the situation the same way so she did not turn up.

label: shame
text: Insulted by somebody.

label: sadness
text: One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we stayed indoors.

label: disgust
text: In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position to advance his own interests.

label: sadness
text: Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and I still do not want to believe that it is true.

label: disgust
text: When programmes on violence or pornography are shown on T.V.

label: joy
text: When I met again a great friend and talked a little while with him. When I see again another I miss.

label: guilt
text: I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway the other teachers thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to observe was not well liked. The teacher was in fact really nice to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had given me.

label: guilt
text: Once, my friend and I went to the Tai 60 to cycle.  My mother had told me not to go.  Unfortunately I broke my pectoral girdle and had to go to hospital.  When my mother  came to see me I felt guilty as I had not listened to her and I had to soon sit for a public examination.

label: disgust
text: When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.

label: disgust
text: Bad temper of the serving lady in the students' dining hall.

label: anger
text: When my sister broke my china tea set.

label: disgust
text: At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home and personally.

label: joy
text: When I got the loan for my studies.

label: joy
text: Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.

label: anger
text: Being refused to attend the neuropsychology lecture in the medical university.

label: fear
text: When my mother threatened me with thrushing me of the stairs, when I once more should make a comment.

label: shame
text: When I was 12 years old I was caught by the Ticket Collector when travelling without a ticket.

label: disgust
text: When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned military base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want to be caught.

label: joy
text: The high school entrance exam.

label: disgust
text: To go through the underground way at suburb station of LAPA. Poor people and the ambulants badly dressed up in a passage badly kept.

label: joy
text: I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for a long period, my father came back home.

label: disgust
text: I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my unwillingness to challenge him about these attitudes in order to keep the peace.

label: sadness
text: At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in great esteem.

label: guilt
text: When I fought with my friends.

label: guilt
text: By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed to be loaned out.

label: fear
text: When we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was moving very fast, so I feared we might crash since the road was too rough.

label: disgust
text: When my brother promised me money but he failed to fulfill the promise.

label: shame
text: Finding out that I was deceived by my friend.

label: guilt
text: A friend asked for help and I was not able to help.

label: joy
text: When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing after several months absence (I was not needed during this time).

label: shame
text: Making bloopers: e.g. telling something negative about a certain person, while that person is standing besides you and hears everything.

label: guilt
text: When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of yours and you are at the bottom of it.

label: anger
text: Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritated because at night the music didn't stop in time. And at breakfast my boyfriend ran away because we didn't agree with him. I felt angry.

label: disgust
text: Grandfather lives in a home for the elderly. He always looks forward to visits. On his birthday (by coincidence it was on "Mummy's day") however, nobody went to see him. Is the own family more important than grandfather ?

label: guilt
text: Forced to fill in a questionnaire.

label: joy
text: Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the "paper work" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming through the customs gate.

label: joy
text: Had a nice letter from my close friend.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence when  a train was coming.

label: shame
text: I bacame involved with a boy for a very brief moment not because I liked him but because I needed some sort of company. The consequences weren't as I expected and caused me much shame.

label: sadness
text: When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship made clear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choose his girlfriend (also a friend of mine).

label: shame
text: Sitting on the bus seats supposed for disabled people, children and old people (by mistake)

label: guilt
text: When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important family occasion that I should not have missed.

label: joy
text: When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeks overtime.

label: anger
text: I was at the corner shop, which I patronise regularly I had only a $ 50 note and I purchased about $ 3 worth of goods that I really needed - the keeper made sarcastic remarks to others about people using him to cash notes.

label: fear
text: The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.

label: sadness
text: When my father was imprisoned for burning the house of his younger brother.

label: shame
text: I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to my norms of behaviour.

label: fear
text: At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined creepy men sneaking into our house.

label: fear
text: Before the first examn.

label: guilt
text: I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediately put on a kilo.

label: sadness
text: My sister bkoke her leg.

label: disgust
text: I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted. Perhaps once, when I saw a big spider.

label: fear
text: When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house with violence. I was alone at home that moment.

label: joy
text: I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents and through them from the pupils.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping alone in the house at night. A boy putting on a short only knocked at the window whispering that I should open for him.

label: joy
text: When I received a letter of acceptance to CAL.

label: sadness
text: A close friend travelled to another country. When I knew that he would only come back after many years, I felt very sad.

label: fear
text: In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the dark.

label: guilt
text: My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad about that.

label: disgust
text: Some people not cueing in the dining hall.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust at my neighbour, because she comes to our house with her child, who spoils our furniture.

label: sadness
text: The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

label: disgust
text: When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.

label: shame
text: When I failed one of the tests because I had not worked hard enough.

label: anger
text: I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.

label: sadness
text: My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, but it was hopeless, he had to be shot.

label: shame
text: When a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant, unexpectedly by a man of a caliber I never expected.

label: joy
text: During my Summer vacations I planned a carnival for the community youth center with a few other volunteers.  I was the head of the organizors and we spent over a month planning it.  During this period we got to know and understood each other.  We discovered each others potential and we planned many interesting things for the carnival.  The day of the carnival everything was bright, the programmes went well and the attendants enjoyed it.  I felt extremely excited about it.

label: guilt
text: I know that a certain person feels very lonely, and that she always looks forward to seeing me. However, often I am too busy to visit her, then I feel guilty.

label: shame
text: In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.

label: disgust
text: My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he fainted and so I called the first aid.

label: guilt
text: While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.

label: fear
text: One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

label: anger
text: When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was forced to hide this for a while.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gone for a walk.

label: fear
text: At primary school the teacher caught me cheating during a dictation.

label: joy
text: Winning the local soccer championships this year was a great joy.

label: guilt
text: My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in the sand.

label: anger
text: When I failed my S.S.C exam.

label: joy
text: When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail, but it appeard that we both had passed.

label: shame
text: I forgot to zip up my trousers, this was not noticed by anyone.

label: anger
text: I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital) as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed money from my purse.

label: guilt
text: When I got low marks in the final year B.Sc exams, I felt guilty as I had not worked hard because I had been roaming around with my  friends.

label: disgust
text: The smell of garlic in rush-hour bus.

label: joy
text: Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

label: sadness
text: I had been caught red-handed having stolen some paw-paw. I was then taken the elders owning the paw-paws.

label: anger
text: I was scolded by my mother for no reason.

label: anger
text: A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that particular time and I felt I couldn't do  anything about it anyway (i.e. being late).

label: anger
text: When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due at 1400 hours.

label: disgust
text: When I discovered that my mother had been involved in adultery.

label: joy
text: The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my boyfriend.  My parents place was getting a little crowded with my growing bother wanting a room to himself.  I first felt doubt, then joy, but also sadness.  The feeling of joy was the strongest.

label: fear
text: One fears many things, for example one fears going to the dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected with the examination session.

label: disgust
text: When people manipulate others through appearing better than what they really are.

label: shame
text: I guess I have often been ashamed after having talked badly of other people.

label: anger
text: When my father talks about our relatives and favours them, I feel angry.

label: joy
text: When I passed the grade 7 exam.

label: sadness
text: When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away after having had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.

label: joy
text: Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

label: disgust
text: Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose and glass-eye, rattling breath.

label: joy
text: When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often happenes.

label: shame
text: When my new jeans split while I was with the youth group.

label: shame
text: When I contacted a sexually transmitted disease and the lecturer came to know about it as it was he who treated me for it.

label: shame
text: When somebody I knew greeted me and started to talk with me and I didn't know, I couldn't remember who he was.

label: anger
text: Being a spokesman for the union, I got into a quarrel with a colleague who had been acting disloyally over a sustained period of time.

label: joy
text: When my girl and I decided to get back together after our separation.

label: fear
text: Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw another one, as if out of control of the driver.

label: sadness
text: When on Christmas day my grandmother died. I received the news when I was coming back from a party on the 24th at 5 am.

label: disgust
text: I was looking at a one-man show on television. He told very disgusting things so that I started to be disgusted with it. (Later on it proved that this was his intention).

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it impossible that had driven the car.

label: anger
text: The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

label: guilt
text: When a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep the child away from the fire.

label: sadness
text: Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a few days.

label: fear
text: Having my luggage checked at Customs.

label: anger
text: When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of medical uniform.

label: shame
text: I gave a wrong answer at school.

label: shame
text: When my co-resident opened the bathroom door while I was bathing inside.

label: fear
text: Once, before I had learnt to swim, I stepped on a slippery slope where there was a lot of moss and I slipped into the water.  The water was very deep and I could not stand on my feet.  I sank and had to use a lot of energy.

label: shame
text: I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time, I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.

label: fear
text: When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she would die.

label: guilt
text: When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We were with a marriage counsellor then.

label: disgust
text: Saw a scene in a movie implying incest as humorous.

label: anger
text: An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.

label: shame
text: When I was young I was playing football near my parent's house and while playing I fell on the ground. At first I thought I was not seen by anybody, but when my mother laughed I felt very ashamed.

label: fear
text: My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guy upstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.

label: fear
text: As a child (i.e. 5-7) hiking in reasonably rugged bush and becoming lost for a duration of 5-7 hours.

label: sadness
text: I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.

label: anger
text: My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I couldn't play them again.

label: anger
text: Can't remember exact example.

label: fear
text: When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad would happen to me as he would play magic on me.

label: joy
text: Joining in a research group studying consumer's behaviour and helping the people in the shop with the sales.

label: guilt
text: Inventing a fictitious series of events, as a result of which I ended up in a conflict with my two closest friends.

label: sadness
text: After studying a lot for my H.S.C exams, I could not make it to the medical stream and I felt sad about this.

label: disgust
text: In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation was disgusting in itself.

label: fear
text: I was studying in class at night. I was in Form II by then. There were rumours about an earthquake. That night dogs were chasing one another and passed through the window outside the classroom. Those who saw the dogs thought it was a lion and were terrified. Trying to run away the desks were dragged and there was a shaking movement. I thought it was an earthquake and jumped out of the window.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when I was being introduced to the church congregation.

label: disgust
text: I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was that I was practically obliged to eat.

label: shame
text: Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of interest in knowing personal details and then they started talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little interest in those activities so I talked to another student sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me questions on those activities.

label: fear
text: Got ill.

label: joy
text: It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and I had not seen him for 10 years.

label: guilt
text: I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.

label: shame
text: I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a foreign language.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

label: joy
text: My friend told me he really likes me.

label: joy
text: When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid look stupid.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped through the window and saw a thief  trying to enter my neighbour's house.

label: guilt
text: I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting. After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell him that.

label: guilt
text: When some housemen told me a young girl like you should not be allowed to lecture to consultants, I was too shy to argue against them.

label: sadness
text: I felt sadness when I notice that I'm not important for a determinate person. We do many things for a friend, and we see soon after, that he doesn't do anything for us, nor thinks of us.

label: fear
text: When I slipped on a glazed frost road and a car almost ran into me.

label: joy
text: When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

label: shame
text: I had a misunderstanding with my father and after some time I found that I had been wrong.

label: anger
text: When I was in F4 I played a basket-ball match against another school's team.  One of their team members kicked a team-mate of mine so I kicked him back and we had a fight with each other.

label: disgust
text: When I see pornographic films.

label: anger
text: Quarrel in the family.

label: joy
text: I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.

label: anger
text: My friend often played a joke on me and sometimes I thought that he was a nonsensical person. Once when we went to a friend's house he walked in first and shut the door firmly behind him.  I felt that he did not respect me and moreover I was his friend so he should not have behaved like that.  I was very angry (as it is I was in a bad mood then).

label: guilt
text: When I failed an exam I thought I could pass easily.

label: fear
text: DO NOT REMEMBER.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

label: guilt
text: While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it, though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.

label: shame
text: I had a test in the class and I had not adequately prepared myself. I didn't fare so well on the exam and I felt bad about it.

label: shame
text: I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything - although I knew how he felt.

label: disgust
text: My friends and I were sitting at a restaurant. We were talking and a few of them said awful things about women. I became disgusted by their narrow-mindedness.

label: anger
text: When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.

label: disgust
text: When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.

label: anger
text: Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking only about himself.

label: shame
text: Soiled my short trousers with faeces.

label: shame
text: At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in a bag spread all around while I was going through the metal detector.

label: shame
text: It was a shameful moment when I heard that I had failed my Primary School leaving Certificate Exam in 1978. My girlfriend was there when the news was released.

label: fear
text: Motor failure on a boat outside Gottenburg when we were in heavy  seas and the wind was strong.  As we could not steer the boat we drifted towards the rocks.  We did not succeed in attracting the attention of any passerby until 4 hours had elapsed.

label: fear
text: I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range, and was shot at.

label: shame
text: Being caught by parents in a compromising situation with girlfriend.

label: joy
text: When I saw my name in the newspaper and I knew that I entered at the University.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I was in Form three to notice that my friend Barley Jumbe, had lost very expensive new sports short trousers.

label: shame
text: I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into another dress.

label: shame
text: When I made an end on a relationship after three years.

label: joy
text: I felt happy when my mother borrowed me the car in order to let me go out alone for the first time.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a pornographic movie in which animals were used.

label: anger
text: When I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who  was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was really angry with him then.

label: shame
text: Making an unexpected talk with a professor in the canteen. This made me shy.

label: sadness
text: I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great the distance between us was.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that life span in China is shorter than in the West.

label: disgust
text: On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt disgusted.

label: joy
text: My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and received the presents.

label: disgust
text: When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pm however she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we had to go out that evening).

label: sadness
text: We had to take our cat to the vet for mercy killing (an injection).

label: shame
text: When the brother-in-law of a girlfriend of mine found us in a bedroom with clothes and panties spread all over the place.

label: fear
text: Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a "cold" film). I do not know the reason.

label: joy
