text: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor said that the ear was completely all right.

label: sadness
text: Watching a football game. This remindes me of the time when my father was still alive and when we watched football games on TV together.

label: guilt
text: Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.

label: anger
text: I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my colleagues.

label: disgust
text:
Finding out some people had been talking about me at my back.
fear,"When I got to know that the friend I am closest to got engaged, and she was going away.  I was overjoyed for her, but also felt frightened as I was very emotionally dependent on her.  I did not know what I would do without her.

label: shame
text: On Christmas eve I went to a classmate's home with other classmates.  The next morning when I came out of the toilet she said something and I did not understand what she was saying.  When she pointed at my trousers I discovered that I had forgotten to zip them up.  I rushed back to the toilet but by the time the others had guessed what had happened.

label: sadness
text: My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months in hospital.

label: joy
text: I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

label: disgust
text: Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.  It was in a friend's country house and there was nobody there to help me.

label: sadness
text: I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid, telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged everythiing for them.

label: guilt
text: My sister forgot to bring presents for my birthday, I was rude to her.

label: guilt
text: I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some unnecessary work.

label: sadness
text: When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.

label: sadness
text: When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.

label: disgust
text: A few days back, I walked on a heap of faeces while walking on the road.  I got goose flesh because of this.

label: guilt
text: Missing lectures and avoiding university work for no reason when it had to be done.

label: fear
text: Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When we realized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a long climb ahead.

label: joy
text: When the bank let me borrow some money this winter, after my grant was spent.

label: joy
text: I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt glad.

label: disgust
text: During a movie in which I saw the effect of white settlers in Africa.

label: disgust
text: At my father, when he yelled and accused my sister's friend (over the phone) of doing something he didn't do, or know anything about.

label: fear
text: I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water it seemed like no one would care or remember.

label: joy
text: I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

label: anger
text: My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was not guilty. He was misled by his wife.

label: joy
text: When I won the first prize in a cross country race.

label: joy
text: When I entered at the University.

label: guilt
text: I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years, when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a bit guilty for what had happened.

label: sadness
text: When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and up to this moment my sadness is still on.

label: guilt
text: At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of guilt.

label: guilt
text: I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because I couldn't organize myself.

label: anger
text: I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with whom I had previously discussed the assignment.

label: shame
text: When I do not succeed in making myself clear to other people. When they do not understand what I say.

label: shame
text: Failing in the English language exam.

label: anger
text: Listening to long speech of the party leaders wasting my time.

label: disgust
text: When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited economically.

label: disgust
text: When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speaking with food in their mouth, etc.).

label: shame
text: When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an extremely positive word).

label: disgust
text: When I saw several people washing their car with water from a drain.

label: sadness
text: My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his soporification.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when I heard that my cousin had passed away just suddenly.

label: joy
text: I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.

label: shame
text: Once my presentation was the worst among my classmates as I had not prepared it well and had not seen it as important.  My presentation was so confused that it clearly showed my poor preparation.

label: fear
text: The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves from the flying bullets.  This incident occured on our way to Feira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.

label: joy
text: I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stone houses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not have much furniture.  He took me to see his fields (I had never seen them before) and there were several inches of clear water on which the sunshine was reflected.  I wanted to sit among the short green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading the plants to death.  My friend said "They will not die" and I sat down happily and my trousers did not get wet.

label: fear
text: Going out alone in the dark.

label: joy
text: Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking "the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and encounter.

label: guilt
text: Once I bought my sister a pair of sports shoes as she was going to join an athletic meet.  However the shoes were a little big and had a few flaws.  She muttered all the way and blamed me for having wasted her money anf I felt guilty.

label: sadness
text: When my best friend died, at the age of 16.

label: guilt
text: I had shouted at my younger brother and he was always afraid when I called out loudly.

label: sadness
text: I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it in time so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sad about it and couldn't talk to anyone.

label: anger
text: When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the letter.

label: sadness
text: My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers having walks with their children.

label: joy
text: When I was at school, no one thought I could pass my MCE so at the end of the year my name was announced on the radio that I had passed. I was the happiest person.

label: joy
text: In summer when I was sailing with friends in Greece I felt joy.

label: fear
text: I was sitting on an electric swing, suddenly the machine went out of order while I was still in the upward position.

label: joy
text: The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of economics.

label: fear
text: When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.

label: sadness
text: When a friend of mine died in a hiking accident.  I was not present there and only got the news later.

label: disgust
text: To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.

label: joy
text: I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England.  We had said that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (we were not going to the same town in England).  As soon as I walked in he called from England as he could not wait till he came home.

label: joy
text: When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.

label: shame
text: When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt ashamed.

label: shame
text: Once I had torn a few pages off a library book and I felt ashamed at this.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

label: shame
text: Not chosen for all English classes.

label: guilt
text: During a holiday in East-Germany I got aquainted with a boy who lived there. We started writing, but I only wrote once. I felt ashamed because I probably was one of his sparse contacts with western Europe.

label: sadness
text: A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few months old.

label: anger
text: I felt unfairly treated at an airport, being told to use a different counter (for domestic traffic only).

label: anger
text: My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.  Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to defend my friend.

label: guilt
text: I had to decline an appointment which had been very important for the other person. For this reason we even got into trouble.

label: anger
text: I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving me any thing - money to come back to school.

label: anger
text: I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept      on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.

label: sadness
text: We are several friends but our characters are very different and we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties" because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

label: guilt
text: Made a mistake at work.

label: shame
text: When I got 1/2 out of 15 in Abnormal Psychology I felt ashamed.

label: fear
text: This was when I was being followed home every day from the campus, by a stranger.  He would follow me to the campus and then sit outside my class.  If I was not there he would ask my friends as to where I was.  He was a dark, ominous looking person and I was terrified of him as I did not know his intentions.  I reported him to the security officer, who turned him over to the police.  I was even more petrified then.

label: fear
text: Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to that class.

label: anger
text: I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to pose twelve times, over  a period of four weeks, before I could get a snap of mine.  Every time the film was processed my snap did not come out although the others did.

label: joy
text: Passed an exam by 2 points.

label: shame
text: I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to myself.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

label: fear
text: On Christmas eve,1984, I had just finished the exams and was afraid as the results of one of my major subjects had been very unsatisfactory.  I thought that I had only a 50% chance of passing.  Even if I failed this subject I would not need to repeat.  However I liked this subject very much and my results were bad because of my lazyness.  If I was forced to change to a minor in this subject I would be very unwilling.

label: joy
text: To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps because it has been one of the good things that I learned with this friend.

label: guilt
text: We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up the idea.

label: joy
text: When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.

label: joy
text: Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he told me that although he told me he was going to take me to the concert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayed overnight and I said "well, when he leaves me I will be ruined for awhile, but for now we're together." I woke up in his arms and it was the happiest moment of my life.

label: anger
text: When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness and dirtyness.

label: fear
text: Movement in bush late at night while camping.

label: fear
text: I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on the terrace of the flat.

label: joy
text: You told me psychology can help people to be happier.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that a good friend was seriously ill.

label: joy
text: One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring a motorcycle through my own efforts.

label: joy
text: I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it was nearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began to remember our courting and gave me a long kiss.

label: guilt
text: As the only person in my family into academics, I ought to have looked after my younger (and only) sister better, with respect to her education and life experiences.

label: disgust
text: One night I saw a man being knocked down by two other men. The victim was kicked against his head.

label: guilt
text: I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.

label: shame
text: I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of the fright and because I was nervous.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class with her in our first year.

label: disgust
text: Finding out that my best friend was deceiving me.

label: sadness
text: At the funeral of a friend about 20 years old, who was killed in a hit-and-run motorcycle accident.

label: anger
text: When I got a low grade in an administration course.

label: sadness
text: Saw poverty in the countryside.

label: shame
text: One day in the intimity with my girlfriend I had an ejaculation.

label: disgust
text: Some students talking when other people are having a nap.

label: fear
text: I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved when she said to me that she didn't love me.

label: disgust
text: From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I am in a restaurant.

label: joy
text: This happened a year when I was having a hard time, I got admission to do research despite obstacles in the procedure of admission.

label: fear
text: I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house.  A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this alley.

label: fear
text: I was on a trip to Phillipines during Summer and I was staying in a hotel.  The room I was staying in was very silent and had very dim lights.  The last night I felt frightened and lay awake - I could hear some sounds around me and dared not open my eyes - I waited for dawn.

label: guilt
text: My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.

label: guilt
text: I was talking to my mom on the phone and she told me that she had just gotten an award that day in front of all these people and she asked me if I wanted her to send me the article in the temple newsletter to me. I said no very quickly and felt guilty for not being more interested and hurting her feelings.

label: joy
text: Finished a difficult midterm.

label: disgust
text: When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and there was no water to clean up.

label: disgust
text: When I red a report in the magazine VESA about an Iranian telling what she had lived in the prisons in Iran. I felt disgust about that people.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.

label: guilt
text: When I was in the puberty I smashed the favourite toy of my little brother because of a fit of rage.

label: fear
text: I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end to our relation.

label: disgust
text: When a close friend wilfully cheated me.

label: fear
text: Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being alone.

label: disgust
text: Saw an arrogant girl walking pass by.

label: sadness
text: The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.

label: joy
text: When I received the acceptance form for the second year at university.

label: disgust
text: One of my best friends was found lying flat on the road because he was drunk and was taken by the police and put in a cell. I went to see him the following morning, the place was really a mess and was smelling badly. I didn't like it.

label: shame
text: Having finally to admit I was wrong, after having denied it for a long time.

label: anger
text: A murder.

label: guilt
text: I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without permission and I was found guilty.

label: fear
text: Suddenly found out that I was the lasr one to leave the anatomy room.

label: anger
text: I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the Headmaster.

label: anger
text: During the short period of my unemployment about six years back.

label: disgust
text: A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

label: shame
text: I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.

label: fear
text: I wanted to get in contact with a girl I loved, but I was afraid she would refuse me.

label: fear
text: Car accident in the middle of the night.

label: anger
text: While at school I had to write an essay for doing something wrong that I didn't do. I wrote the essay about how I was mistreated and got Saturday morning detention along with a few other kids, but they didn't show up.

label: sadness
text: When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.

label: sadness
text: When my dog died.  I had reared it for nearly three years.  It had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.  One morning I found it dead.

label: fear
text: I got a very nasty electrical shock when I was tampering with some electrical applainces.

label: sadness
text: To buy a car and didn't like the business and the car.

label: disgust
text: They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed when asking and doing certain forbidden things.

label: guilt
text: Accidentally dropped a friends camera flash, so that it was broken.

label: guilt
text: When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity better but I had not done it because of reluctance or carelessness.

label: disgust
text: The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying that there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafe disgusted without taking the tea.

label: anger
text: When they changed my office to another room without my agreement.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time. She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the relationship without going out with other people. I was her first boyfriend.

label: sadness
text: We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.

label: guilt
text: Telling my parents that I did not get into a good university.

label: shame
text: When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I had soiled.  It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to want to see the blood stains.

label: joy
text: When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16 months ago.

label: anger
text: When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked, because there where persons that didn't have problems, and wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

label: disgust
text: When I was a child, one day while playing, I fell up to my waist in mud.

label: anger
text: I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning the plates and there was no food for me, and the blue birds  (security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to be for me.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a pornographic film when looking for a place to live.

label: anger
text: Towards wife's laziness in not performing her usual duties because of television watching.

label: sadness
text: I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my friend.  That day I was really sad.

label: joy
text: Always when I meet the person I love.

label: disgust
text: Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e snakes on T.V.

label: fear
text: I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

label: disgust
text: When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his grovelling and the manner in which he had treated others.

label: guilt
text: When I lied to my mum, who later came to know that what I had been teling her was false.

label: anger
text: Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry. She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the workshift to me so I did not sign up.

label: disgust
text: A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat it. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out of the bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leave the room.

label: shame
text: I am troubled by hair growing in my neck. I was troubled by this for a long time and was much ashamed when someone brought his/her hands close to my face.

label: guilt
text: I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in love with another man.

label: anger
text: Insulted for no reason.

label: shame
text: On own reading book. Recall came to mind of slight sexual exploitation of a female (years ago) i.e. had her on even for sexual motives.

label: shame
text: A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got to learn about this from another friend of mine and when she arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later ashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was at my place.

label: shame
text: When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat out of the bag.

label: sadness
text: When I missed my train this morning, I felt sad for some time.

label: shame
text: My inability to assert myself positively in a group.

label: guilt
text: I lost a conference because I hadn't got in touch with a certain person to inform her that I would go with her. I thought she knew what I wanted.

label: shame
text: Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a nonsense.

label: anger
text: In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these marks.

label: disgust
text: When a skunk invaded camp.

label: disgust
text: Doing this pointless questionnaire.

label: shame
text: Failing an examn.

label: joy
text: The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be selected.

label: fear
text: Before the examn.

label: disgust
text: I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).

label: joy
text: When I get a hug from someone I love.

label: anger
text: When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing at secondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.

label: guilt
text: In a playground I was playing at the seesaw with a little niece. I wanted to stop but nobody came to help me. When I got off, all alone the seesaw fell down with a big smash. My niece got hurt above her eye. Now there is a scar.

label: anger
text: Insulted by some stupid people.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whose problems I had always shown deep understanding.

label: disgust
text: The repression of rioting and non-rioting "Blacks" in South Africa by the police of that "Democracy".

label: anger
text: I felt anger at my roommate due to his habit of leaving dirty dishes in the sink and generally not cleaning after himself.

label: disgust
text: Someone, who was sitting very close to me, was smoknig in the compartment of an air conditioned mini-bus.

label: disgust
text: There is a girl at my work that doesn't take care much of her hygiene she comes always with her hair oiled, a not very agreable smell, and a bad appearance. Beside this she tries to be nice.

label: shame
text: When I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on the varnish, this pulled it all off and I didn't admit my guilt.

label: guilt
text: Once I was not able to give a relative, who was in a critical period, a helping hand.  Whenever I think about it I feel guilty  for letting down the person who trusted me to give him a helping hand.

label: guilt
text: Before going to school I usually take something to eat right at school and this time I took Father's money without him knowing it. I felt guilty and I returned the money.

label: joy
text: When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later accepted.

label: guilt
text: When I think that I do not study enough.  After the weekend I think that I should have been able to have accomplished something during that time.

label: disgust
text: I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave, threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away from home.

label: anger
text: Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very angry.

label: fear
text: When I left a carnaval ball at 4 o'clock a.m. I was alone in a foreign city and I had to go back home, when a guy appeared and tried to "catch me".

label: disgust
text: I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into a little cup. There was a thick white "wad" in it. I tried to take it out and throw it in the sink.

label: anger
text: It was quite recently, at the football match between the national teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish referee who ran the match quite partially.

label: fear
text: Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180¦ turn we followed and ended up in a gully.

label: disgust
text: When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like the windows, glasses etc.

label: shame
text: There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her from entering the room.

label: anger
text: I came out of the house at 7:20 am Monday morning getting ready t go to school and fight for a parking when I saw my car had a flat tire.

label: disgust
text: With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South Africa.

label: sadness
text: When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a boyfriend.

label: joy
text: When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a long time.

label: sadness
text: I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

label: joy
text: New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the first time.

label: sadness
text: At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sad as I had to leave many friends and family members behind.

label: disgust
text: I saw a septic, smelling wound.

label: joy
text: A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We became reconciled.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when my brother was arrested because of stealing money.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when I got the lowest result (mark) in class. All the same I didn't worry too much because I knew I would have got much better if I had read enough.

label: sadness
text: The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each other.

label: anger
text: There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I accused him of several things.

label: disgust
text: On a trip to Santander a child sitting beside me fell ill and started to vomit, seeing this made me feel very bad.

label: joy
text: Yesterday when I received a B on a history midterm. I felt overjoyed after having received C's previously.

label: sadness
text: Finding out about the university does not have enough foreign currency to buy the yournals in your reference list.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did not even think about me when she did not need me.

label: guilt
text: When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a man. But it remained undone.

label: sadness
text: After my father's death.

label: joy
text: When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night out in 20 years.

label: disgust
text: Cueing in the students dining hall.

label: anger
text: The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.

label: shame
text: I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed about what I had said.

label: anger
text: When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part with a few coins for their drinks.

label: guilt
text: When I broke something and a friend of mine was blamed.

label: shame
text: Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that the person was listening.

label: anger
text: My younger brother and I had been fighting over the TV/Video. He kept on turning it on and off every 2 seconds and was not listening to my authority and was being cheeky. We fought and I ended up in tears - he'd won.

label: anger
text: I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular job was not done, it was not my job to do it.

label: anger
text: Being sexually assulted on a bus.

label: anger
text: I wanted to borrow lecture notes from a friend and he did not lend me them.

label: guilt
text: As I could not be home before midnight I called home at 11.30 and asked them to leave the door open so that I could get in.  I actually woke up the whole family by calling them so late.  My mother could not go back to sleep, besides she had a conference   the next day and really needed to sleep.

label: shame
text: I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress.  I sold my friend, I was despicable.

label: sadness
text: I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this message he was already dead.

label: fear
text: When I was ten I got shut in the school with a friend.  I had to jump out of a window and cross a beam 10 metres high.

label: anger
text: My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that my mother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn't tell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.

label: fear
text: When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

label: joy
text: When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very long time.

label: sadness
text: When a class-mate died.

label: fear
text: I was afraid that I would fail an examination.

label: sadness
text: When my dog died.

label: guilt
text: We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquors left the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending to prepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rum down my throat.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.

label: anger
text: I received a poor grade on a midterm even though I got all the right answers and knew the material. I went to the TA to try to raise my grade and he wouldn't do it.

label: guilt
text: When I told my uncle a false story - that people had stolen the books from my room and I demanded money from him.  When he found out the truth I was in trouble.

label: joy
text: My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.

label: fear
text: I confronted a bigger person than I and almost got into a fight.

label: fear
text: I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.

label: fear
text: The day I was nearly stabbed to death by ruffians who wanted to take my money.  I refused to give them any money and they started running after me, I ran into somebody else's house to save myself.

label: guilt
text: Telling white lies.

label: guilt
text: I always feel guilty when I see my mother sad or fed up with life. I really dont know the reason.

label: joy
text: Made a wonderful driend who understands me.

label: shame
text: At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (she asked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharp remark.

label: disgust
text: I thought that the guy I had been associating with for over a year went out 2 or 3 times with a high school girl whom he claimed not to like.

label: guilt
text: My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days later he stole it from my father.

label: sadness
text: I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was very different from what I expected.

label: joy
text: At a success of mine, at a real achievement.

label: disgust
text: One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and asked me to cure him myself.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend left me.

label: shame
text: When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an acquaintance in the car with me.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had been planned by taking people's comfort into account.

label: disgust
text: The time I went to see one of my girlfriends at Area 18 I found that she was not there but in the room she was sleeping, in the same room there were some women visitors with children so the room was smelling very badly with some faeces and urine in it so I didn't stay any longer.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I was in a helpless position at the loss of my fiancee.

label: shame
text: I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had it for so long I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed at myself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.

label: joy
text: Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.

label: anger
text: When my friend promised that she would come to my place, and did not turn up - I was annoyed at her.

label: joy
text: When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.

label: disgust
text: Saw my brother-in-law insulting my sister.

label: disgust
text: I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.

label: disgust
text: Our boarder burping after meals !

label: anger
text: An unjust calumny concerning me.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I was asked by my cousin that I promised to buy her a birthday present but I didn't buy it for her in front of friends.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my uncle had passed away.

label: shame
text: My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

label: anger
text: I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I  had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.

label: disgust
text: When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it looked underneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).

label: guilt
text: When I stole something.

label: joy
text: Getting the top price in the football pools.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed at myself when I saw that the other boys and girls   of my age earn a lot of money by doing very good and hard work.

label: guilt
text: During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.

label: guilt
text: I went to a friend's baptism as she became a Christian after me and I realized that she was more enthusiastic about her spiritual life than I was.  When I was with my brothers and sisters of Christ I had a guilty feeling which could not be dismissed easily.  When pepole asked me as to when I would be baptised my guilt feeling deepened.

label: joy
text: A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy too because fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So I feel joy for her mainly.

label: sadness
text: After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.

label: fear
text: Reading a horror story alone.

label: fear
text: A few weeks back my daughter had very high fever and I was scared that it might lead to brain damage or convulsions.

label: disgust
text: When I learned that a relative had been spreading rumours about me.

label: shame
text: China cannot buy your reference.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust when I kissed a guy that I know. I was on the outs with my boyfriend and this person appeared but he has nothing to do with me.

label: guilt
text: Leaving a friend of mine alone at a dance - I felt I should have kept her company.

label: fear
text: I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed that they would come for me any time.

label: guilt
text: When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.  Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person I love most on earth.

label: guilt
text: I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of a yield.

label: disgust
text: Being in a Malaysian city with my girlfriend coming out of a picture theatre - seeing her rush up to a taxi that a very old sick man was trying to get to. Seeing her take over the taxi.

label: guilt
text: When a patient had died soon after I had told the guardian to wait outside the ward.

label: sadness
text: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

label: disgust
text: A woman picked her nose and spit right next to me.

label: joy
text: Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby my financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will be well catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for the last five years of my life.

label: joy
text: I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

label: shame
text: A serious drug error while nursing that I knew I was responsible for (patient lived, no complications fortunately).

label: joy
text: When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.

label: anger
text: I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my ability or my knowledge of the subject.

label: shame
text: When my best friend foud out I'd been lying about something I'd been doing behind her back.

label: anger
text: Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work and take the blame for any mistakes.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident and that I had a scleral tear in my left eye.

label: guilt
text: I was once called in court in Zemba Traditional court to answer a charge of impregnanting a young lady, I felt guilty for she had some letters which I used to write her as an exhibit in court.

label: joy
text: Discussing psychology with my friends before the lecture.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother, my second mother died.

label: fear
text: One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strange people near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and then came close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters. After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.

label: anger
text: Being insulted in public.

label: anger
text: When I found out that my sister had been playing with my confidential things which she had taken from my hand-bag.

label: guilt
text: Two days after the above incident, I was thinking about my morally shameful act and I felt sorry for that incident, but it was too late, however I did realize this.

label: disgust
text: A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.

label: disgust
text: In a certain occasion I saw a dog in the street eating something so strange gooey that I wasn't able to eat lunch because I remembered the scene all the time.

label: guilt
text: When I realized that not all my friends like the comments that I pass in their presence.

label: shame
text: When I told my sister I had slept with my boyfriend, and she at first was mad at me I then felt shame for this act, but not guilt.

label: fear
text: I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to do.

label: fear
text: When I had to walk along a dark road alone.

label: anger
text: My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the conditions they imposed on me.

label: fear
text: One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty bottle with me.

label: sadness
text: When a girl did not answer a question, concerning my love for her, put forward to her.

label: sadness
text: My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry for that and something like sadness.

label: fear
text: Afraid of getting alone without friends, without anybody.

label: fear
text: The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog which lives in my street.

label: disgust
text: Some students trying to please the lecturer.

label: fear
text: My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid that he would do us a harm.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.

label: joy
text: When I was with the girl I love very much, for the graduatiion ball.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as a student.

label: sadness
text: When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had  seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been waiting to see us.

label: guilt
text: I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in getting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, I felt I had lied to them.

label: shame
text: Once when I said bad things concerning a friend.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a spider.

label: fear
text: I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was being followed.

label: anger
text: The government's announcement of the withdrawal of the student allowances in 1984.

label: sadness
text: When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.

label: shame
text: I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took from the library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.

label: joy
text: I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.

label: disgust
text: When I read racist slogans on the walls.

label: joy
text: Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous when my school's team won the conference championship last year.

label: shame
text: Saw a beggar on the street (China still so poor).

label: fear
text: When I saw the movie "Poltergist".

label: sadness
text: When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

label: joy
text: It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this Institution to study as a Medical Assistant.

label: joy
text: When I was informed that a short story I had written had been accepted for publication.

label: disgust
text: When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.

label: disgust
text: When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different directions.

label: anger
text: My roommate being unconsiderate.

label: fear
text: Ran into a parking car on a bicycle.

label: shame
text: The fact that I was pregnant. I was always considered level headed and did not have sex until 18 and out of high school.

label: fear
text: I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.

label: joy
text: When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and soul.

label: guilt
text: I was so excited once that I told my classmate that she was old, this hurt her and I felt guilty.

label: shame
text: In a party of friends I got completely drunk.

label: guilt
text: I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I just behaved aggressively towards my sister.

label: fear
text: Crossing a street of several ways the cars began to move and I thought that I was going to be trampled.

label: joy
text: When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in the family after 19 years of baby boys.

label: fear
text: I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date  with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend last told me he loved me after I gave him an impulsive kiss.

label: fear
text: I was in form five at the boarding school and my friends and I had gone drinknig beer in the nearby village.  And we were caught red handed there by a form master.

label: anger
text: When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time student at UNZA.

label: joy
text: After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.

label: anger
text: A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

label: sadness
text: When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.

label: guilt
text: When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied having touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.

label: sadness
text: I was not chosen for the All English class.

label: guilt
text: When I offended my parents without wanting it.

label: sadness
text: When my elder brother died.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty days.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to this university despite my having studyied in difficulty throughout my secondary school days.

label: anger
text: I typed up a letter for this physician at work. She didn't care for my style, even though she was not using correct English. I told her it was her letter and we would do it her way.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the  morning for manual work.

label: shame
text: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents attention by talking to them.

label: disgust
text: When somebody made me touch human faeces.

label: sadness
text: When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal feelings and then days later changed her mind.

label: joy
text: I am not especially good at English, and after the high school graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My family was at home.

label: sadness
text: I didn't get the job I wanted.

label: fear
text: When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.

label: shame
text: The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help blushing.

label: fear
text: I was driving and stopped at a stop light. I was planning to make a right turn as soon as it was clear. It was clear on the left so I started but a man was just in front of the car.

label: sadness
text: Disappointed by a friend.

label: disgust
text: A few days after I had finished the relationship with my boyfriend, we had a quarrel. Then he hit me. At that moment I found him disgusting.

label: joy
text: Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV dealer.

label: shame
text: I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I rarely become ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Some boys told me your nickname is "Little Girl Doctor", I did not tell them off and laughed with them.

label: sadness
text: A break-up with someone I really liked.

label: joy
text: The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

label: anger
text: Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am to free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays the night.

label: joy
text: Receiving a letter form a girl that means a lot to me emotionally.

label: joy
text: I realized that a fellow member had grown spiritually.  I was the leader of a spiritual group and had prayed for him.  He did not want to burn the incense but his mother forced him to do it.  Finally his mother told him that he could discontinue if he got good results at school.

label: fear
text: Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of darkness when going home.

label: joy
text: Accepted by the college football team.

label: shame
text: When I am in an auditorium with people and I ask a silly question so that everyone starts to laugh.

label: fear
text: I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

label: shame
text: I am chosen for the English lectures instead of my good friend and people told me that girls are more likely to be chosen.

label: sadness
text: Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I went into the role of a performing clown.

label: anger
text: When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future daughter-in-law.

label: disgust
text: When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which there was a rotten human skull.

label: shame
text: Parents finding out I smoked.

label: anger
text: One night I could not practise my violin as my family was watching T.V with the lights off, so I wanted to listen to some tapes.  It was dark so I asked my brother to bring me a torch, however he scolded me.  I was so angry that I slammed my violin on the floor.

label: shame
text: When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not act very responsibly and one of them was injured.

label: anger
text: I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on it. I tried to fix it but could not.

label: fear
text: Walking in the dark I saw something strange.

label: fear
text: I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money.  I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

label: fear
text: When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come to the surface and inhale.

label: fear
text: Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across an exhibitionist.

label: sadness
text: Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.

label: fear
text: A "near-accident" in a car, driving too fast on an icy road.

label: disgust
text: My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to me a feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at my parent's place I will remember it for long time.

label: anger
text: My class leader told me I am not chosen for your English lectures.

label: disgust
text: Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the food or when watching the way some people eat.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that my best friend could not go to university.

label: anger
text: My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell me if they were visiting me or not.

label: sadness
text: I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.

label: sadness
text: When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) on a close relative of mine.

label: disgust
text: In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at me.

label: fear
text: Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire vehicle.

label: joy
text: When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after may weeks.

label: disgust
text: Overeating a traditional type of food - blood pudding.

label: fear
text: While paddling in the river during a storm.  I feared drowning.

label: guilt
text: When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about why I was home late.

label: sadness
text: When I came to know that my grandmother had died.  She was very close to me.

label: fear
text: We were in the country and I walked away from the others one night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was not able to see what it was.

label: fear
text: When they threatened me with a knife to take my money.

label: disgust
text: On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of her behaviour and paranoia.

label: sadness
text: Failed an examn.

label: fear
text: My illness a few years back.  I was sevely down with malaria and asthma, I had lost my health, charm and cheerfulness completely.

label: joy
text: My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along too.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled the wrong number.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I was within the row of students who were making noise.

label: shame
text: My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.

label: fear
text: Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the house and came back very late.

label: joy
text: When I got a letter from home.

label: disgust
text: A brother from one of the Christian fellowship often phoned me and talked to me for half an hour or more.  However there was nothing important in the conversation and I found the person very disgusting.

label: joy
text: Finding out that I am not ill (not seriously).

label: shame
text: When I sat in the wrong discussion section in the beginning of the semester. I insisted on being in the right section and the TA's list should have included my name. When I found out that I was in the wrong, I apologized, turned red and left.

label: joy
text: When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.

label: fear
text: When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were shouting something at the same time.

label: anger
text: Discussing with a certain person about a job I was getting and that perosn was negative and pessimistic.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that the girl I like does not like me.

label: guilt
text: Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my mother's presence.

label: disgust
text: My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.

label: joy
text: Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.

label: disgust
text: When I was touring Asia with my present football team, I saw old Europeans with young asiatic prostitutes.

label: shame
text: First weekend back home after one week at Uni I scolded one of my sister's best friends for using our telephone. Very silly, but I was annoyed because she was there at a time when I needed to be with my family.

label: fear
text: One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men molesting my girlfriend and me.

label: guilt
text: The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had left open.

label: joy
text: My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to the music of the International singer Sam Mangwana. I had no hope of going there since I had no money so he gave me the money for admission.

label: sadness
text: My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.

label: anger
text: When my dad told me about something he had done against my mother.

label: joy
text: Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.

label: sadness
text: I feel sad about an event I can not influence.

label: guilt
text: My younger sister was almost run over by a lorry.

label: sadness
text: My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the information that she had died.

label: anger
text: When I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.

label: shame
text: Fooling around with this guy I did not know.

label: guilt
text: I told my parents (or more realistically) would not do what they wanted me to do anymore. I guess I sort of betrayed them after all they had done for me.

label: disgust
text: I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I had done was wrong and it disgusted me.

label: disgust
text: I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told me that a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because of an infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many people about my applying for this institute and I decided to prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

label: joy
text: Scoared a goal in a football match.

label: disgust
text: We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to stop using it.

label: fear
text: I was with a friend in a stationed car when, suddenly a man appeared on my side and an other with a gun on his side the hold-up lasted a few minutes but it was terrible. I had never seen a gun so close.

label: guilt
text: Going out with another girl besides my girlfriend and not telling her.

label: joy
text: The day the results of the university entrance exam was published, I found my canditate number and I was very excited.

label: sadness
text: I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and my name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who were sent to Kenya for Training.

label: anger
text: When friends try to put me down or hurt me.

label: joy
text: When my girlfriend became pregnant.

label: sadness
text: In a social situation I became interested in a woman. We talked, we laughed, we enjoyed each other. She desappeared for a few minutes, and a little after appeared with an other man.

label: shame
text: When I broke a tea saucer. I felt ashamed. This was during the birthday of my girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: I found out accidentaly that while my uncle was away in Canada, my aunt had been bedding a young man on a regular basis.

label: disgust
text: Some students whose English is worse than mine can go to your lectures (English lectures).

label: joy
text: I asked someone to go out and she accepted right away.

label: fear
text: The emotion came when I misbehaved at school and the Principal threatened me that I was going to be expelled.

label: guilt
text: When I committed the sin of immorality mentioned before.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I was told that I had not been selected to go to the University.

label: guilt
text: When I had an argument with my grandfather the day my younger brother was born.

label: sadness
text: My father left us for another woman.

label: joy
text: Got in touch with earlier friends after a long absence.

label: sadness
text: Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noone gave them money.

label: anger
text: I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.  We do have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I take out my anger on him.

label: anger
text: While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

label: fear
text: Not applicable to myself.

label: fear
text: When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, it wasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I woke because of a certain end.

label: joy
text: When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend started singing (she cannot sing) and did not stop despite my asking her to do so.

label: fear
text: I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

label: disgust
text: Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person responsible.

label: joy
text: When I pass an exam.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen for many years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that I wouldn't know what to say.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the way the bus conductor threw out an old woman oiut of the mini-bus simply because she could not pay the fare for her luggage.

label: joy
text: When I entered University.

label: fear
text: When I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabid hyena just near the path in the forest.

label: sadness
text: Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard about it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself to it.

label: sadness
text: I couldn't sleep, and began to remind of my childhood. We are many sisters and at that time we were spanked a lot and I don't know why I started to remind of the spanks they and I had had, their shouts when this happened.

label: shame
text: After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of difficult personal circumstances.

label: joy
text: My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he loved me.

label: shame
text: When a certain girl I believed to be my life partner refused an engagement.

label: shame
text: I made a comment that at the moment didn't fit.

label: sadness
text: My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

label: sadness
text: When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his friends and that he was dead.

label: sadness
text: My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.

label: guilt
text: I wasn't able to see my girlfriend on her birthday and because I was late arriving home from uni, I didn't phone her as arranged at a certain time (she rang in the meantime).

label: anger
text: One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of my close friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymore because he was jealous.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow students during my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-maker and caused great conflicts with the teachers.

label: anger
text: When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feels superior to me.

label: disgust
text: Saw Chinese people flattering foreigners.

label: guilt
text: Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour, commonly not accepted, and making the child cry.

label: sadness
text: In the 12/83 my boyfriend asked me to forget him, as it would be easy.

label: anger
text: My bicycle was demolished.

label: sadness
text: I was told by a good friend that we couldn't be friends any more because of his relationship with another girl.

label: fear
text: As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might get tetanus.

label: joy
text: On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody had passed the test.

label: fear
text: A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on a great bald field.

label: guilt
text: A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.

label: sadness
text: The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back to University and to the exams.

label: anger
text: When someone took my pen away.

label: joy
text: After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I passed my last exam.

label: disgust
text: I saw a film where snakes were crawling everywhere. I felt them crawling over all my body with that ... skins. The noise that they did disturbed me very much.

label: shame
text: I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as I am.

label: sadness
text: I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a flood of the same emotion.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made to my friends, who did not approve of them.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.

label: joy
text: When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to learn that it was me who was delaying things.

label: fear
text: When I broke my leg I felt fear.

label: sadness
text: When summer is over and I have to leave the town where I spend my holidays.

label: joy
text: When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that I judged very difficult.

label: anger
text: When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

label: anger
text: " I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing people in your room," he said.  This sentence really shot my heart.  I failed to find the right words, instead I walked away without uttering a word.

label: sadness
text: One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that some of my relatives had died in an accident.

label: joy
text: On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just with my boyfriend - not really talking but just feeling overwhelmed.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust when I saw a dead animal on the roadway.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when I was despised by another person.

label: guilt
text: When one lets friends down

label: joy
text: Receiving a nice present from my parents.

label: sadness
text: When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the hospital.

label: guilt
text: My mom told me not to gamble, but I did anyway. Sometimes I would even take some money from my parents and brother. She found out and yelled at me.

label: anger
text: When my brother was held up and robbed.

label: sadness
text: Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20 others.

label: sadness
text: This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.

label: anger
text: The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.

label: shame
text: Not doing my share of the work for the house job.

label: anger
text: I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that sloppiness and impudence.

label: joy
text: Selling my used car.

label: sadness
text: My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - no one else there to do it.

label: guilt
text: When I didn't bring my girlfriend home one night. Later she told me that a cardriver solicited her.

label: fear
text: Walking home in the dark from college.

label: joy
text: When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a moment.

label: disgust
text: When a close relative got quite drunk. It was a relative that I had respected for a long time and looked up to as a child.

label: guilt
text: I am not good enough to join any team to play sport for the class.

label: disgust
text: In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load on the tractor trailer.

label: fear
text: First time in anatomy.

label: guilt
text: When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.  Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.

label: disgust
text: The time when I cleaned the house and everything was tidy, then my cousin, who is 4 years old, came with a muddy pot and made a mess of the whole thing.

label: anger
text: This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my trousers without my consent.

label: joy
text: I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.

label: disgust
text: When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister, Indira Gandhi.

label: guilt
text: When I had promised to do some washing for my mother and I did not do it.  She did it herself despite her being ill.  I felt very guilty.

label: shame
text: A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a "street walker" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was falsely trying to impress with my family.

label: anger
text: Mr C took my drawing pens, without having asked for my permission first, and lost them.  He did not tell me about it till I asked him and then did not try to find them.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help a friend, although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing was revealed but I haven't called up this person since then.

label: sadness
text: A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancer and has only a year to live.  I  heard about it 6 weeks ago.

label: joy
text: When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.

label: fear
text: A friend and I were going to have a study session together in which we quiz ourselves in biology material. Because I believed I didn't study enough. I feared I would fail.

label: guilt
text: When I realized that I was not working hard enough and was not being useful as an individual to the society or the family, guilt at spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wasting my life.

label: guilt
text: I offended my mother.

label: disgust
text: After learning on the news about this man who killed more than 300 women and habitually copulated into their inert bodies.

label: fear
text: English papers are due on Friday. They are returned on Tuesday. This Tuesday I was afraid to go to class and get my paper because I knew it was bad.

label: anger
text: Had an argument with my classmate for borrowed books.

label: shame
text: When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man    sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously.  I did not know  what was wrong.  When I reached the  centre I started strolling around  as I still had a little time.  Suddenly a man came and whispered "You  have forgotten to zip up your trousers."  I was at a loss to say anything  and I felt very embarrassed.  When I thought of the bus incident I felt  even more ashamed.

label: anger
text: At a school dance when my supposed "best friend" kept walking away from me whenever I came near her.

label: anger
text: My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.

label: sadness
text: Not being chosen for the English lectures (my girl-friend chosen).

label: joy
text: When I was a student at the Institute doing my M.Phil degree, one of my professors called me before the convocation and told me "You have got the gold-medal (first rank) in the university and tomorrow you will be on T.V".

label: fear
text: When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie "Deer hunter")

label: joy
text: When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for hours. She was in a good mood.

label: anger
text: When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he had just repaired.

label: shame
text: The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of the window.  They saw me.

label: shame
text: I arrived late at a seminar concerning my major subject at university, although I had been appointed to formally oppose the paper which was being presented.

label: sadness
text: Thinking about friends overseas.

label: joy
text: When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film marathon I wanted to see.

label: joy
text: When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

label: anger
text: At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.

label: fear
text: When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to be hospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong. Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.

label: joy
text: It was about a fortnight ago, I was declared successful in the U.G.C exam this year (only four in Bombay succeeded).  My joy knew no bounds.

label: shame
text: Failing an examn because I did not work hard enough.

label: fear
text: When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my     own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there were ghosts in that area.

label: shame
text: I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of the student's association did not blame me, they helped me do the work.

label: disgust
