text: Finding out that the class leader can go to your lectures, and his English is worse than mine.

label: fear
text: When I was left alone at home one night by my brother.

label: joy
text: When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I had taken this test.

label: sadness
text: When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really became conscious of her death at that moment.

label: fear
text: I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the part II exam.

label: sadness
text: When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.

label: guilt
text: I have cut loose from my father a few years ago. I know he is very sad about this.

label: fear
text: When I was attending an authorized demonstrationand the police rushed brutally at the demonstrators, without any warning.

label: guilt
text: I called off a relationship with one girl so I could see another.

label: disgust
text: We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)    staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the  guy.

label: sadness
text: For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when I don't see her even for two or three days.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we had to get separated again.

label: shame
text: Going out for dinner, or during one ice-cream and four spoons.

label: anger
text: Before the department meeting my friend ate a dish that I had prepared for this meeting.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend said he did not want to see me anymore (which turned out to be untrue).

label: joy
text: I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home I was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and I was rejoycing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.

label: anger
text: This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which I kept in the cupboard.

label: shame
text: I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a little.  When my friend remarked about it, I understood that it was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.

label: sadness
text: When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.

label: shame
text: When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig happened I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was with her just to go to bed with her.

label: shame
text: A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of confidentiality.

label: fear
text: It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have never seen anything like that before.

label: sadness
text: Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas Years ago.

label: guilt
text: When I complained about a colleague to the manager and he told her that someone had complained; this colleague came to me believing that I liked her.

label: joy
text: Receiving close friends form abroad, whom I hadn't seen for years.

label: joy
text: When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.

label: fear
text: When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the night.

label: joy
text: I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long time.

label: joy
text: When a girl I wanted very much, said "yes" and fell in love with  me.

label: sadness
text: My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.

label: guilt
text: I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for me.

label: joy
text: When I got engaged to a boy of my choice.

label: disgust
text: Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.

label: anger
text: Too many people in TV room, I was not able to get a seat to watch TV.

label: fear
text: When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a friend of mine.

label: anger
text: I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

label: guilt
text: When I noticed the negative changes in a friend's behaviour.

label: joy
text: When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had thought.

label: guilt
text: During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he finally arrived but after a very long time).

label: disgust
text: It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.  An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.

label: disgust
text: I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.

label: joy
text: On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for the dress-rehearsal of "Aida". It was a different world for us full of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantastic pizza in a restaurant near the "Arena".

label: disgust
text: Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work - harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker - disgusted by his implications.

label: anger
text: A person walking his dog allowed it to defecate on the footpath outside my house. Although it had happened before, this was the first time I had witnessed it. All the skills I had learnt from PY 263 were thrown out the window when his indifference to my protestation was obvious to me.

label: fear
text: Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the minority.

label: disgust
text: Close friends talking badly of other friends.

label: shame
text: I recently became sexually involved with my sister's lover. I care for him very much, but I am ashamed of the hurt I may cause her.

label: shame
text: The same for guilt would apply.

label: fear
text: Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

label: fear
text: When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed -rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.

label: guilt
text: To force someone to do something that suits me.

label: anger
text: Once my father slapped my mother for a small quarrel.

label: joy
text: When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to study  for six years, came back home safe and in good health.

label: anger
text: Told by some people the class leader only choose his friends (not true).

label: guilt
text: When I answered to my mother with rudeness.

label: disgust
text: When I failed an exam.

label: guilt
text: Ignoring my parents'wishes.

label: joy
text: I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for me, I was very glad.

label: shame
text: I told my primary teacher I hadn't done my homework as my mother was in a car accident. My teacher rang that night to see how my mother was - she was fine i.e. no accident !

label: fear
text: When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

label: anger
text: When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class during a turn.

label: shame
text: My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual level to a sexual relationship that had a large physical content. Born out of inconsistency with my personal beliefs and value shame at largely using this sexual partner.

label: joy
text: When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacial burden of the family was reduced.

label: disgust
text: I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.

label: guilt
text: Broken a friend's cup.

label: shame
text: I tried to date a girl, but she refused.

label: guilt
text: When I finished a love affair where I was responsible of the sad end.

label: joy
text: The time I qualified to enter secondary school.

label: shame
text: Breaking an implicit promise.

label: guilt
text: I kicked the chair in the classroom to express my anger.

label: guilt
text: When my parents work very hard and get tired - while I go to school and study instead of helping them. I feel that I'm letting them down, disappointing them.

label: shame
text: Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.

label: guilt
text: I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.

label: guilt
text: I was late meeting someone for an appointment.

label: anger
text: Being stopped by the police for a traffic offence which I don't think I committed.

label: guilt
text: I beat up a female friend after I heard the defamatory stories that she had been telling.  I was later called to explain my behaviour.

label: joy
text: I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend suffered form ill health for some months, this week the physician told him that he was restored to health.

label: shame
text: When I saw my father coming out of the bathroom. He thought that he was alone at home and came out without his clothes.

label: sadness
text: We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.

label: fear
text: I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I expected it to be very active with people, gangs, fast cars etc, thought it was actually quite quiet, though also oppressive. I walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

label: sadness
text: Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a few days. There was nothing I liked in that period.

label: sadness
text: I am a Christian but I cannot find any meaning in life . It seems that I am deceiving myself but I cannot find the way out.

label: shame
text: Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been necessary.

label: guilt
text: When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.

label: anger
text: A classmate damaged ma iron and tried to hide the damage.

label: shame
text: When I went to a disco with a friend I started behaving badly embarrassing him without reason.

label: fear
text: When I met an elephant in the bush.

label: shame
text: During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted her parents by having had sex in their house which they overheard.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have made a nice walk together.

label: shame
text: Nearly caught masturbating.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I thought that I was still not standing on my own feet.

label: sadness
text: Death of grandfather (unexpected).

label: joy
text: When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and when I finished I knew I had passed it.

label: guilt
text: I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I would not report for work as I was not feeling well and that the   doctor had refused to give me sick leave.  My intention was actually to go out of Lusaka for a week-end.  I left the same day and the following morning my boss found me in Mongu.  I felt guilty when asked to explain things on my return.

A day before the seminar I realized that I had inadvertantly burdened certain       derivations and I had failed to correct it.  I feared that this    would reflect very badly on my performance.  Fortunately none of  the panel members detected it and I felt relieved.

label: guilt
text: I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effet on someone's problem.

label: disgust
text: When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the washing.

label: anger
text: My cousins were playing at home and one of them broke a decorative object which was very precious to me.

label: fear
text: I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.  I was rather afraid because I was alone.

label: shame
text: Defying my parents and staying out all night when I wasn't supposed to.

label: anger
text: Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she thought I was still interested in the boy.

label: disgust
text: When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them financially.

label: fear
text: On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few seconds.

label: guilt
text: I was 4-5 years old when I hid the bicycle keys of a not very good friend.  After a few hours I pretended that I had found it.

label: sadness
text: My got my mathematics test's marks and could not believe that it was true.  In the past I would have at least 80% marks.  Was I getting weaker at studies ?  This made me feel that I should not expect too much from going to the university.

label: fear
text: When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.

label: shame
text: When some of my close friends and colleagues talk about me and my work and say that I am the brightest student of the college.

label: anger
text: A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, I felt hurt and disgusted.

label: guilt
text: I was driving a friend's car, and I got close to the pavement to ask my way and I struck a parked car.

label: fear
text: When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards me.

label: guilt
text: I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left, I did not try to prevent her from leaving.

label: fear
text: I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.

label: fear
text: I was coming home from a relative's place and it was about 9.30/10 P.M.  I felt slightly apprehensive when I got off the bus and started walking towards my place.  I was confident that nothing would happen to me, yet there was this slight feeling of fear.

label: anger
text: I was enjoying the company of bird life while I was eating lunch in a park when a group of people began throwing sticks at some of the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing them being scared away.

label: joy
text: Talking with a nice girl.

label: shame
text: At Christmas night there was a good movie on television which I wanted to see for years. I was whining about it till someone told me it was very childish. Then I felt shame.

label: joy
text: I unexpectedly got a present from my father.

label: fear
text: When I was young I had gone to an old lift and played with the antique lift.  The guy discovered me and warned me, I was very frightened.

label: guilt
text: I was to prepare relish for the family. I overcooked it and no one liked the meal that day.

label: fear
text: Finding out about people can go mad for social reasons.

label: anger
text: My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something which was serious and a real burden to me.

label: sadness
text: When I was trying for a girl who I really liked and cared for and thought she felt the same way too. But she didn't like the idea and just wanted to stay friends.

label: shame
text: Forgetting an important appointment.

label: shame
text: When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.

label: disgust
text: The serving lady in the students' dining hall shouting at studennts.

label: joy
text: Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process which have been going on for centuries.

label: fear
text: I was at home and we were sleeping when we heard some robbers breaking into our house.

label: sadness
text: When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - loneliness drains me.

label: disgust
text: Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age will go to your English lectures and they do not understand English.

label: sadness
text: When my father was ill.

label: shame
text: As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and I vomitted in the basin of the classroom.

label: joy
text: When my parents complimented me very nicely on something.

label: guilt
text: I used to have two boyfriends in the past. Then one of them wanted to get engaged to me. I agreed but was guilt-conscious for disappointing the other one.

label: fear
text: Sitting alone in a quiet room, concetrating on things happening around you. Thoughts come into my mind which make me afraid.

label: shame
text: I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object of pleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in a classroom at P.V.C.

label: guilt
text: A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to      see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.

label: shame
text: When my natural parents name would show up on papers and not my, what I call real name.

label: sadness
text: When I was ditched by my girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: I got angry at my mother for something trivial.  We were in a bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother really needed support.  I had reacted wrongly.

label: guilt
text: I could have passed the last exam of the public competition, but I failed as I had not studied.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to my place. She saw me and ran after me. I didn't know that she had come. I couldn't see her. She held my shoulders standing behind me.

label: shame
text: During a meeting.

label: shame
text: In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and invalids.

label: anger
text: At home when they lost three pieces of my puzzle.

label: guilt
text: Telling a lie to wife over phone about what I had been working at.

label: fear
text: On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.

label: joy
text: Coming to this lecture and listen to you talking about feelings, I am so happy that foreigners have the same feelings as Chinese.

label: fear
text: When armed robbers broke into our house at night.

label: anger
text: When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close woman friend of mine in public.

label: joy
text: I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

label: guilt
text: About not helping my sister when she asked me to help her on her chemistry class. I pretended to be busy.

label: guilt
text: When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.

label: anger
text: When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister, close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.

label: fear
text: Getting ill.

label: disgust
text: When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.

label: fear
text: When a good friend of me told me one evening that she didn't want to live anymore.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted on seeing my boyfriend after our separation.  One day he was begging at the mass transit railway station and at that moment I hated him.

label: fear
text: When I was working in Delhi, I had gone alone to see the hostel where I would be residing.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend, residing in the hostel, lost his father I really pittied him and the situation made me feel sad.

label: joy
text: Got a present from my friend for my birthday.

label: disgust
text: When a "friend" woke me up in the middle of a blessful sleep by knocking on the door.  Then he started calling me names and saying that he had heard that I had been talking behind his back, this was a lie and the guy was drunk to the core.

label: joy
text: I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a NH Competition and I was the first.

label: sadness
text: In 1983, my results at the university entrance exam were very poor - far from what I had expected.   I thought that I would not be accepted at the university.

label: joy
text: To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination, I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I had the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come to be able to be with me.

label: shame
text: Failing in an examn because of lazyness.

label: shame
text: I was talking badly about a person to some friends, and discovered that his daughter was listening.

label: sadness
text: When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we decided to be legally separated.

label: guilt
text: Little contact with my father before he died.

label: shame
text: Finding out from this lecture that China is backward in psychology.

label: fear
text: I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood. During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. The fact of being alone in that house frightened me.

label: fear
text: This last August when my parents dropped me off and moved me into college I didn't know anybody here; I was 17 and Berkeley really scared me.

label: anger
text: When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.

label: anger
text: When I was told that a boy did not want to be my friend without any apparent reason.

label: fear
text: Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.  Naturally this is during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results.  However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear.  This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of student lectures.  I was one of the participants and my lecture happened to be the opening lecture.  I had been confident all morning, about twenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failing me.  I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was really paralyzed.  This incident of fear is still fresh.

label: anger
text: My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had an abortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued to do so.

label: guilt
text: I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were the only ones he had.

label: shame
text: My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.

label: joy
text: When I received the result slip of the higher level examination (an university entrance exam) and saw that I had a very good possibility of being accepted into the university, I felt very excited.

label: joy
text: A recurrent lovesickness.

label: fear
text: When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to call a girl but I did not do it.

label: joy
text: My old friend visited me in the university.

label: guilt
text: When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my mother I did not admit that it was my fault.

label: fear
text: A relative died.

label: sadness
text: In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with several employers, after several years of dedication I was dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

label: shame
text: When I had to act alone a character for a public (40 people).

label: disgust
text: When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.

label: guilt
text: When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.

label: disgust
text: When a very dirty class-mate farted in my  presence.  There was a terrible smell.

label: guilt
text: I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She however was fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.

label: anger
text: We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact plans to paint my room without consulting me.

label: disgust
text: When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed only helplessness and indecision.

label: sadness
text: I had asked the teacher to write a recommendation letter for me, but I had not provided enough information and had run short of time.

label: sadness
text: Leaving Melbourne to move interstate - leaving relatives and friends behind.

label: shame
text: When my mother found a leaf of my diary where I had written about my mother's lack of education, especially her poor arithmetical insight.

label: guilt
text: When my grandfather was in a nursing home when I was young I never wanted to go and sometimes didn't have to and later I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: When finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predicting changes in my life, and I became happy.

label: disgust
text: With an alcoholic.

label: joy
text: When the contract about my shop was signed.

label: shame
text: During an informal discussion I contributed a lot even though I had not spent much time studying.  Whenever someone said that someone was not paying attention, or that he had too many other things to do, or that the persoon was not trying his best, I would feel ashamed.

label: joy
text: This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money which was just like a miracle to me.

label: shame
text: Not having owned up to the responsibility an incident where family car received minor damage.

label: guilt
text: This situation happened when my friend me with a knife which I stole from him.

label: fear
text: When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult operation.

label: guilt
text: I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.

label: anger
text: During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.

label: sadness
text: Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very sad about this.

label: guilt
text: During class one day I walked out of the class.  The teacher noticed it and decided that he would take some action against me, when I realized this I approached him and told him that I was sorry for the incident and would not repeat it.

label: sadness
text: After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

label: fear
text: Every time I see a spider or a snake.

label: anger
text: Sometime ago I felt very angry when my mother wrote me telling me that my elder sister was messing up things at home by her internalised aggressive attitude towards parents and her husband.

label: anger
text: My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and saw the scene and became angry.

label: disgust
text: One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.

label: guilt
text: Our class had organized a picnic in November.  I was the class representative so I became the organizor.  However the picnic was postponed by one week and I had something else to do then. Initially I did not ponder on what to do and decided to go for the picnic.  When I had the time to think about it I thought that my decision was wrong.  My classmates thought that I would go as I had signed my name but I did not go.  I told another class representative that I was not going but he did not know the reason behind my not going.  After the picnic my classmates asked me why I had not gone to the picnic and everytime someone mentioned it I was apologetic.  I should have decided right in the begining that I would not go and then they would not see me as irresponsible i.e promising to go and changing my mind afterwards.

label: guilt
text: Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and bad but it was too late.

label: shame
text: When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few days later I was shown to be wrong.

label: shame
text: When I did not buy what I had promised to.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I heard that my sister had failed the Examinations which we hoped she was going to pass with distinctions.

label: joy
text: When my first child was born.

label: shame
text: Not being able to hand in homework in time.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to visit my girlfriend but for different reasons could not make it.  I rang up later to tell her that I could not come.

label: joy
text: When I made the winning goal during a very important football game.

label: joy
text: Getting back with my boyfriend after a year away - apart.

label: fear
text: That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted at 14.

label: sadness
text: I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present one with whom things are not much of a success.

label: shame
text: I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I couldn't answer.

label: disgust
text: When after a storm in the country, I left my shelter and saw a big, fat, slimy green toad by my side.

label: guilt
text: I had found out that I was pregnant. I talked it over with my boyfriend and he was unsupportive - yet encouraged an abortion - I did.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.

label: disgust
text: I cannot remember exactly such a situation. But I know that once I went to a very dirty lavatory and that disgusted me.

label: joy
text: At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed eachothers company, while slow dacing.

label: anger
text: I wanted to go to Bhopal for relief work (gas tragedy).  My boss simply refused to let me go, I was so angry that the only thought that came to my mind was to quit the job.

label: disgust
text: During the Chinese lessons a student often showed off. Moreover he misbehaved and dressed very badly.  So disgusting !

label: joy
text: Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second birthday.

label: anger
text: One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use against him, in the meanwhile people intervened.

label: fear
text: Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as rustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to no good.

label: sadness
text: I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason, they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could manage things.

label: shame
text: Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from sleep.

label: shame
text: When I tripped while getting on a bus.

label: anger
text: My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my anger.

label: sadness
text: A friend who was 22 years old died.

label: joy
text: The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.

label: anger
text: My boyfriend told me that I had very high demands towards him. In my opinion this was wrong.

label: anger
text: This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

label: guilt
text: That I didn't take the time to make an appointment with someone.

label: anger
text: I am separated from my husband.  The way he has behaved towards me makes me angry.

label: fear
text: At primary school I was accused by some boys of being in love with a certain girl in their class so they had to shout and beat the girl and the matter was reported to the headmaster.

label: guilt
text: Once when I complained I caused a great discussion between my parents.

label: shame
text: When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.

label: shame
text: I had been rude to my mother at a time when she needed comforting, not anger (death of my sister).

label: disgust
text: When I found my girl in bed with another man.

label: sadness
text: Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundings and into a situation of loneliness.

label: joy
text: When I finally managed to get a specific sound from my guitar, after baving tried for a long time.

label: guilt
text: After the death of a girl who I disliked.

label: fear
text: When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a madman.

label: guilt
text: When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father before they briefly separated.

label: guilt
text: When I discovered that the girl I was courting was a relative of mine.

label: shame
text: During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an ear-ring.

label: disgust
text: Political and military trnsgressions around the world, generally speaking. This cannot be described through this questionaire.

label: sadness
text: When I didn't get a certain job at Lillehammer which I wanted very much.

label: shame
text: I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I was eating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warned him often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I took out his chair I knocked down my own glass.

label: guilt
text: I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to pick me up from work.

label: sadness
text: Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, after discussing it with friends, family and the man involved.

label: joy
text: In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

label: anger
text: When the paramilitary was sent to the UNZA and it started using tear gas and started intimidating the students without any provocation.

label: guilt
text: Betraying someone's trust.

label: shame
text: My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had died recently.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a great effort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, they put the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those that blame me.

label: joy
text: When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant Training.

label: shame
text: Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.

label: sadness
text: When I saw the list of books to read for an acccouting course, I thought " Oh God how will I ever manaage it!"

label: disgust
text: When my husband told me about his pre-marital affairs.

label: joy
text: Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our relationship grew closer.

label: sadness
text: When I was at school.

label: guilt
text: My grandmother wanted me to help her. I was driving a tractor pulling a dead branch off a tree. I told her she didn't respect me.

label: joy
text: I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's difficulty.

label: joy
text: I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.

label: shame
text: During my Highschool time I was chairman of the student's comitee. In this function I once had to make a speech to a large audience and I was very nervous. After three sentences I forgot my text.

label: disgust
text: At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.  He was very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long time and had relieved himself in his trousers.

label: guilt
text: I went to go get a bike innertube fixed. I fixed it and I was supposed to pay previously but I didn't. I said I would after I fixed the tire. After fixing the tire, the salesperson who helped me was gone so I walked out of the store without paying. I felt guilty so I went inside and paid for the tire.

label: sadness
text: Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and nature.

label: fear
text: I feel fear when I only imagine I could lose confidence in my own abilities and powers. A similar feeling I feel sometimes before an exam.

label: joy
text: When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general one).

label: sadness
text: I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.

label: fear
text: I felt afraid when I smoked maryhuana for the first time in my life with a lot of friends in the middle of the street at day brake.

label: joy
text: I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his  departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.

label: sadness
text: I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with either of them, so I had to change my plans.

label: fear
text: I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came to report to my parents.

label: joy
text: When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and brought some flowers and cake with him.

label: sadness
text: Cooks refused to give me food.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girl when he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.

label: fear
text: Once while crossing a road I was overcome with fear.

label: anger
text: I live with my sister now and sometimes she angers me especially when she thinks I don't keep the apt. clean enough.

label: anger
text: Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.

label: sadness
text: The same as for SHAME and DISGUST. I was asked to resign my sorority which I did because I was ashamed.

label: fear
text: When I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was in Auckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.

label: disgust
text: I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and vomited.

label: sadness
text: When I was six years old, my favourite cat died.

label: fear
text: I could not do the questions on my math midterm.

label: sadness
text: When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died later.

label: anger
text: I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some money for a few major items (e.g a radio).  but when I arrived at the inter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolen from me.

label: guilt
text: On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the least, reason or better motive.

label: fear
text: When I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a possible failure.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's problems.

label: disgust
text: When I had to eat scraps from a dust-bin, because of a bet.

label: anger
text: I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.

label: guilt
text: Losing my temper with my spouse.

label: fear
text: I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter my room.

label: guilt
text: I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying - and it started crying again.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failed to answer a question in the classroom.

label: anger
text: I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected manner.

label: fear
text: I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.

label: anger
text: My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.

label: guilt
text: A girl dropped some stuff from her bag and when I tried to help her I realized that she had used me and I was made to look like a fool.

label: disgust
text: When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.

label: anger
text: We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see all my writing materials plus the identification card from the place where I left them.

label: anger
text: I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through the room.

label: sadness
text: My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then the older one died a week later.

label: joy
text: When I passed an exam.

label: fear
text: My parents were out and I was the eldest at home.  At midnight a male stranger phoned us and spoke to me in a rough language.  I hung up and heard someone walking outside our door.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and returned them.

label: sadness
text: Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend was changing his behavior there was something wrong, I felt sad, because it's desagreable when a relationship is ending.

label: sadness
text: I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.  I had gone camping        with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very  sudden to me.

label: guilt
text: I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.

label: fear
text: As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned for guilt.

label: anger
text: When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

label: anger
text: I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.

label: sadness
text: A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.

label: guilt
text: I was in a cafe with another person when, suddenly, several close friends of my partner appeared.  I did not know what to do and my partner felt uncomfortable.

label: guilt
text: I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest against a rude and immoral teacher.  I sneaked out and told the headmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.

label: disgust
text: A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their clothes and their way of doing.

label: joy
text: Reading a nice book and talking about it to my friend.

label: disgust
text: In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and behaved in keeping with his state.

label: joy
text: When I got through the first day here at the department.

label: disgust
text: I took a psych. experiment with a totally unappealing gay man as the experimentor, some homosexuals are funny or cute, but this guy was disgusting. Plus the experiment was about gays too.

label: guilt
text: The day I decided to get out of my house I saw in my brother's eyes that they blamed me for the situaiton.

label: joy
text: When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.

label: anger
text: Something was stolen.

label: guilt
text: It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a present together. However, now I had bought something together with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.

label: shame
text: I experienced shame when I failed to keep a promise to meet my friend at the bus depot. He later came and asked me why I had not turned up.

label: anger
text: My sister once stole my mother's money and made her very angry.  After this my mother would beat her up for unreasonable reasons.  One day my sister lent her book to a friend without telling my mother about it.  When my mother learnt this she beat her up and even threatened her with a pair of scissors.

label: joy
text: While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever  and amusing sketch.

label: guilt
text: When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on a trip, and I did not turn up.

label: fear
text: When I did not get the compound which is known.

label: disgust
text: Some people were unfairly treated, because of their nationality/colour.

label: disgust
text: This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday life in a city like Bombay.  One day I was travelling by bus, three men dragged two fellows out of the bus.  Once outside they were beaten into pulp.  These two fellows, who got beaten, were pick-pockets and they were being beaten by all and sundry.  I thought to myself -"what is life?".  It is one hell of a place where everyone is after someone else.  One waits to cut the throat of the other one just for a living, (money).  When I think about such things - the purpose of life, etc, I feel very disgusted and dejected.

label: sadness
text: When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for it.

label: shame
text: It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother passed away.

label: fear
text: As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the last offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person - fear came.

label: sadness
text: It made me very sad to hear that some construction company was going to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.

label: anger
text: When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should not have been punished for it.

label: sadness
text: I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dear friend called saying that his father had died in an accident.

label: fear
text: When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.

label: disgust
text: One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I saw the first list from the names of the people who entered at the University and my name wasn't there.

label: joy
text: I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.

label: sadness
text: At the end of my senior yr. in high school I found out that a friend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminally ill.

label: guilt
text: When I caused needless anxiety to a person close to me because of my lack of self-insight.

label: anger
text: I was neglected undeservedly.

label: joy
text: The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

label: sadness
text: When I couldn't go for a trip with my friends in a holiday.

label: sadness
text: I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.

label: sadness
text: My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident on their way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.

label: fear
text: When two of my children were critically ill with measles.

label: joy
text: The day when my son said for the first time "mummy".

label: shame
text: Following heavy stirring / ridiculing a close friend who was very vulnerable to such attack - inspiring fierce, defensive counter-attack.

label: joy
text: When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.

label: joy
text: The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leaving Certificate Examinations.

label: shame
text: A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.

label: anger
text: When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to tell me for several days after it happened.

label: fear
text: Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

label: fear
text: When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.

label: guilt
text: I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.

label: disgust
text: When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, had got herself involved with some very undesirable characters and was experimenting with drugs.

label: joy
text: I remember my religious experience.  During  a gospel camp, a few friends of mine decided to believe in God.  The joy that I felt at that time was more than words can express.  I blessed them and praised God in my heart.

label: joy
text: Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and wine.

label: fear
text: When I decided to separate from my husband.

label: shame
text: When I dropped a bottle in the state liquor store and everyboby started laughing.

label: disgust
text: During military service I heard the story of someone who tried to commit suicide and as a result of this got a week custody.

label: guilt
text: I was out with a friend in a place where it was very, very busy. When we wanted to go I bumped a person, who dropped his glass beer I offered a new one but he didn't accept it.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently qualified.

label: fear
text: When I entered the dissecting room for the anatomy class and saw several dead bodies lying on the benches.

label: joy
text: When my 6 month old son is happy and well.

label: guilt
text: I was driving my parents' car into a carpark in front of a shop we own, and scraped the corner of the front panel on the back corner of my father's utility. I didn't tell anyone, I lied about the bump (later I had to confess).

label: shame
text: Failing in an examn.

label: sadness
text: When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother who had passed away about a month ago.

label: disgust
text: Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend then over me.

label: shame
text: When I stole a book in class and the teacher caught me, the rest of the class laughed at my attempt.

label: fear
text: Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.

label: joy
text: I received a grade above average on a midterm (chemistry) and I expected onevery below average.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty at not having practised the piano.  I waste my teacher's time and guidance.

label: fear
text: When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in situations when an argument is on hand.

label: guilt
text: I broke off with my partner as I wanted him as a friend and not as a lover.  He reacted very violently and I felt guilty as I had made him so desperately unhappy.

label: shame
text: I had just masterbated with another boy.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our relationship by letter.

label: shame
text: Criticized by a teacher in public.

label: sadness
text: When I thought for an instant that a very good relationship with a person had finished.

label: anger
text: When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr÷m on the telephone.

label: fear
text: Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue duty as a soldier.

label: fear
text: A fear of lack of personal powers.

label: joy
text: Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from boarding school on accrediting leave.

label: shame
text: When I don't say the truth, when I don't do a certain thing thanks to my laziness.

label: anger
text: When my mother interfered in my life.

label: joy
text: When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.

label: guilt
text: When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

label: anger
text: At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.  My anger had nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .

label: disgust
text: When I lost the notes of the lecturer I had borrowed from my friend.

label: sadness
text: My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the  family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been different.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of people spitting everywhere.

label: fear
text: After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.

label: fear
text: A boy phoned me at night and wanted to talk to me for 30 minutes outside.  I thought that he would reveal what he felt and would question me on our relationship.  I treated him as a friend and did not want any misunderstandings.  Therefore I refused to meet him and told him that I would see him the coming day.  I was very unhappy as I feared having hurt him and got him into trouble.

label: anger
text: I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students can find an appartment.

label: fear
text: I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that he was going to cut me off from going to his house as well as playing it again.

label: disgust
text: My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.

label: joy
text: When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

label: disgust
text: When my roommate forgets to flush the toilet.

label: joy
text: When they told me that I had got a study grant.

label: fear
text: When I saw a horror film.

label: shame
text: A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.  I realized later that I had been inconsiderate, at a wrong moment and the wrong place.

label: fear
text: Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

label: sadness
text: After a meeting ended we started talking about when we would have the next discussion ( I had many tests the coming week and could not have a meeting in between, I thought that they would understand this as they had always done).  They did not understand my problem and thought that I should not have so many other activities.  Their reaction made me burst into tears.

label: sadness
text: When I read a lot and did not remember anything.

label: anger
text: My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.

label: fear
text: Walking through campus at night a squirrel jumped in front of me.

label: guilt
text: One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could not fish as a fisherman had already put his net there.  We pulled out the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away.  The net was large and may have cost $1000.  The fisherman used the net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.

label: guilt
text: I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.

label: shame
text: I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mine abroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, I have attempted, but have not actually gone through with corresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.

label: sadness
text: Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my home town.

label: fear
text: One day I was near home, kissing my boyfriend in a car when my mother appeared and asked me to go home, because she didn't know about the event.

label: shame
text: A girl in our class was nicknamed "fatsy". Later, I heard that she suffered from diabetes mellitus.

label: fear
text: When going for my driver's licence for the third time, because everything, it seemed, hinged on getting it. I was really nervous, and the testing Officer made me a little afraid as well. There were lots of things to worry about. I passed however.

label: guilt
text: When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our school who asked me what I was doing.

label: sadness
text: Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense of sadness.

label: joy
text: After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the whole of my studies.

label: shame
text: When I was young, about 6 or 7, I did not make it to the toilet on time.  I hid the dirty trousers in the cellar as I feared itbeing discovered by my parents.

label: disgust
text: On a camp - boys and girls in one cabin. One guy forced himself upon another girl and was having intercourse, while the girl in the bunk beneath was pretending to be asleep and not be ill.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust of my father when I knew he had a lover.

label: fear
text: Waking up from a bad dream in a dark night with noone else around.

label: anger
text: A father helping his kid to fight other kids.

label: disgust
text: My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me verbally.

label: fear
text: I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids were on the move.

label: shame
text: One day I felt dizzy during a lecture.  When the lecturer asked us as to who had heard the fairy tale - I was the only one who put up his hand and this surprised the whole class.

label: shame
text: Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.

label: guilt
text: After an exam I was in a very bad mood as I had done it very       badly.  At home, my mother took so long to ask me how things had  gone that I lost my temper.  I overreacted and made my mother cry. She still prepared lunch for me and did not scold me .  Suddenly, I thought that it was my fault and I started crying.

label: sadness
text: The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the moment of dying I was with her.

label: anger
text: Last semester when I dated a girl whom I've known for almost a year. However one night she said she wanted us to be "just friends". I confided this to a friend Jim I was really suffering. A month or two later he broke up with his old girlfriend and they started going out regularly. I have no girlfriend nor have I had a romantic relationship of any significance. I feel some anger but we are friends again.

label: shame
text: Some times I was ashamed of presenting seminaries or even to speak in class.

label: sadness
text: A child beaten up by his mother.

label: shame
text: People impolite with me because I did not get a good report.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend decided to finish our relation.

label: guilt
text: I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while in a position of trust.

label: shame
text: Once I had to visit a rather special person.

label: joy
text: Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband. Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.

label: anger
text: When our cat was killed in a car-accident I was very angry at the driver of the car because he didn't take enough care.

label: anger
text: They wanted something to happen but I didn't.

label: disgust
text: Viewing the results of senseless vandalism to a local primary school.

label: shame
text: When I stole a packet of cigarettes from a neighbour  and the next day I owned up and returned it.

label: anger
text: When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not have a raincoat on me.

label: sadness
text: Losing close people and animals. So far, I've felt most when losing our dog in a traffic accident.

label: guilt
text: My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was in hospital for an eye operation.

label: guilt
text: Not noticing my roommates quietness or a sign of discomfort.

label: sadness
text: Hearing of the death of a friend who had been skiing.

label: disgust
text: When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while  we were playing near his home.

label: fear
text: I was living with my brother and one day he went away on business and I was left alone to look after the house and the property. At night thieves came and wanted to break into the house.

label: joy
text: When I saw a good friend again after not having seen her for a long time.

label: sadness
text: When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.

label: fear
text: When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock.  I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the gallows.

label: anger
text: At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the trousers again.

label: guilt
text:
I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past.
disgust, Someone I know and respect sexually assulted a girl.
disgust, "When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, this acquaintance had helped her move in.

label: shame
text: I had a feeling of shame when I found myself unable to answer some questions from my tutor simply because of a lack of preparation.

label: fear
text: Almost had a bicycle accident.

label: shame
text: About Sweden's arms exports.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not believe it.

label: fear
text: This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

label: guilt
text: When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.

label: disgust
text: I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like normal people.

label: joy
text: In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got me a three day furlough.

label: shame
text: Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I found that a collection of pornographic literature had been removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was aware of the existence of this material.

label: sadness
text: My friend not allowed to go to the English lectures.

label: fear
text: When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.

label: fear
text: Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without leaving a trace. Usually he tells me when he wants to do something like that, therefore I was afraid that something had happened to him.

label: disgust
text: I saw a terrible accident in which the driver of a motor was thrown through the frontwindow of a car. His face was completely away.

label: sadness
text: This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second time.

label: guilt
text: A few days back my mother was not feeling too well and still did all the house work.  I felt guilty as I had not offered to help.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to bath.

label: disgust
text: The lift of Stockholm central station stank of vomit and urine.

label: guilt
text: Selling the appartment after my divorce.

label: anger
text: When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made me wonder if he was a really a good friend.

label: disgust
text: Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I mislead a person into thinking he was a close friend when that person was more of a casual acquaintance.

label: anger
text: I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves that I have fallen in love with him.

label: disgust
text: I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber in my cup.

label: fear
text: I was afraid to walk through the forest one day when I dropped off the bus around 6.30 pm.

label: joy
text: A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything turned out fine.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.

label: shame
text: Having had a very heated argument with my sister - I began hitting her about the head with a newspaper I was holding.

label: disgust
text: On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day, beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.

label: guilt
text: When I hurt my parents in one way or another.

label: disgust
text: Disgust of drunkers and of blood.

label: sadness
text: When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.

label: fear
text: When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my father and brother.   While my father was talking to some friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying after this.

label: fear
text: The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form four).

label: guilt
text: Calling lecturers nicknames when talking to housemen (They told ne you are even younger than they are so you should not be giving public lectures).

label: guilt
text: Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had done it.

label: fear
text: When my mother met with a serious accident and there was danger that she would not survive and if she did she would loose her memory.

label: fear
text: Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character - gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.

label: sadness
text: Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - friends who I love and respect.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.

label: disgust
text: When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who had been murdered by terrible methods.

label: anger
text: When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.

label: sadness
text: When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting and understood how little one's work was appreciated.

label: guilt
text: One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well, but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thought about the consequences that this could have brought if I had gone farther.

label: disgust
text: I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.

label: anger
text: A ex-boyfriend tried to prejudice me before my fiancT and his family saying things about me that let his family worried. We had to postpone our wedding and we were already using our wedding rings. To be honest I didn't feel just anger, I felt hate.

label: guilt
text: When I took the car of someone without saying it to him.

label: fear
text: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

label: fear
text: When I was about to be bitten by my friend's dog, later on it bit me.

label: guilt
text: It was when I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It made a cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.

label: fear
text: While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to creak loudly.

label: sadness
text: I knew a girl so lovely that everyone would like her.  But she refused to accept my Christmas present and I tried to forget her.

label: fear
text: When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited until somebody passed by.

label: fear
text: I was scared when I realized that I might miss the train which I was supposed to take.  I was 1500 Kilometres away from home and when  I heard the depart whistle I was still 150 feet away from the train.  I finally made it.

label: joy
text: I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year courses.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted to see a person vomitting and I was told to clean the place where the vomit was.

label: disgust
text: When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting me.

label: shame
text: One rainy day when the streets were wet, and as I was walking down a slope, I fell down out of my carelessness.  There were many people and they saw me, so I felt ashamesd.  Moreover I hurt my ankle and it was painful.

label: anger
text: My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the final examination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade they said nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have become very angry.

label: fear
text: When I was dreaming that I was being chased, in the upmost of horror the door of the closed felt down synchronicaly with the dream scare.

label: joy
text: Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other friends.

label: disgust
text: I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had not asked for but got it anyway.

label: fear
text: When I went home and there was nobody, I waited till 2 A.M and      still nobody.  I was suddenly scared and anxious as this had never happened before.  In addition my mother was very weak and I feared that she had met with an accident.  Therefore I was anxious  all night.

label: sadness
text: When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.

label: anger
text: My young brother took my wristwatch in my abscence and sold it to his friend at a cheaper price.

label: fear
text: A grenade blew out next to me.

label: anger
text: This was when my boyfriend told me that I was double-crossing him with a certain boy.

label: disgust
text: Outside a night club, a grown man was sitting on top of a younger woman, beating her up.

label: fear
text: When I lost a wallet while travelling, since it belonged to the group I was very afraid.

label: disgust
text: When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regard to close friends, even in situations that those friends need them.

label: guilt
text: When my father and I worked on the house just after he had recovered from illness, I was rather lazy.  This meant that he had to work hard and was not very well later.

label: anger
text: When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while I  was buying bathing soap.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend almost had a relationship with a close friend of mine.

label: disgust
text: I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was probably an imposter.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.

label: fear
text: As a child, one evening I had read a novel about ghosts and I had thus spent a sleepless night as I kept feeling that there were ghosts dancing around me.

label: sadness
text: When my aunt died.

label: shame
text: When I swindled money out of someone.

label: guilt
text: When I lost my study grant without having attended any exam in the career I had started, and it was too late to cancel my registration.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel for one year.

label: sadness
text: When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not even express my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.

label: joy
text: When I first passed a job interview.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed a piece of music of someone and I always forgot to give it back. That person wrote me a letter asking me to give it back. I did so and I told him an idle story why I kept it for so long.

label: guilt
text: I dated another boy several times, when I was still "going with" my former boyfriend. This made me feel a little bit guilty towards my friend.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of my aunt.

label: sadness
text: Power cut made me unable to listen to the songs sung by my favourite pop star.

label: joy
text: When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long separation.

label: guilt
text: I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship which we created ourselves.

label: disgust
text: When people around me did not understand me the right way.

label: shame
text: Lying to a friend about something that was trivial.

label: anger
text: The fact that I hadn't been informed about something and I had the greatest trust in this person.

label: sadness
text: I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was very sad because it became a real quarrel.

label: joy
text: When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

label: guilt
text: Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had given her no attention.

label: disgust
text: I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.

label: disgust
text: When my elder brother failed form five in 1968 when I was 5 years old.

label: sadness
text: Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).

label: sadness
text: I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by the irreversibility of the decision.

label: shame
text: When I went for the first time in my life to a nudist-beach.

label: shame
text: I was very angry at someone.

label: guilt
text: I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold for half an hour.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.

label: disgust
text: I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can happen in this world.

label: joy
text: When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me alone for a few years.

label: fear
text: I had a driver licence but I didn't drive for a long time, than I started to drive again, and had to get into hard transit and highways.

label: sadness
text: I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.

label: fear
text: A time when I was very afraid of something was when I broke my father's antique lamp.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

label: guilt
text: When I acted in a negative way at a certain moment by laziness to concede a moment of the time I thought to be my own.

label: fear
text: When I was 12 years old I frequently was pursued by others and got sound thrashes.

label: fear
text: A man was yelling outside my window at 3.00 am, yelling threats, though not to me.

label: shame
text: When I was given detention at secondary school.

label: fear
text: When I almost ran over a small boy who suddenly was in front of my car.

label: fear
text: My grandmother several times has been struck by cerebral hemorrhages. Until now she recovered well each time, but there is always the threat to loose her.

label: joy
text: When my brothers had passed all of their exams and were able to  graduate from their courses.

label: guilt
text: When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron  which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have thought that I had been stealing.

label: shame
text: In the classroom we discussed with the teacher. He told me things that affected directly in a negative way my job and my behavior in the classroom in front of the other pupils.

label: disgust
