text: Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate who had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the place.

label: shame
text: When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.

label: sadness
text: When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and  how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical book in English that I did not understand.

label: fear
text: When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost fallen.

label: guilt
text: I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helped me for everything.

label: anger
text: Brother continually interupting while I was talking on the telephone.

label: guilt
text: When I made love with a girl, which I don't really love. However I know that she loves me.

label: anger
text: When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the road.

label: sadness
text: Loss of close relative.

label: fear
text: One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard the roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.

label: joy
text: I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5 times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.

label: joy
text: I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. Because everything turned out different from my expectations. Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the beginning of September.

label: shame
text: I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.

label: anger
text: I feel it when I see that somebody is traying to made a stupid of me.

label: anger
text: I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me and he lost it.

label: fear
text: Diagnosis that I have a stomache ulcer.

label: shame
text: I was caught stealing food at my aunt's place.  I had tried to hide the food I had taken from the pantry while my aunt was in the kitchen, however she went to the pantry and discovered the stolen package.

label: disgust
text: When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.

label: guilt
text: The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary examination.

label: shame
text: When I was teasing a girl, who turned out to be my brother's dame.

label: fear
text: Left alone in the dark in a big building.

label: joy
text: It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift my astrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.

label: disgust
text: When I was accused of having impregnated someone's daughter, it was the girl's cousin who had done it.

label: joy
text: When my brother gave me a watch.

label: disgust
text: When I was young, one day in the car we fell sick and ended up vomitting on each other.

label: guilt
text: When I unjustly accused a person of my family of something she didn't really do.

label: guilt
text: Not being able to help my friend to do homework.

label: anger
text: Insulted by the class leader.

label: joy
text: I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour of a competition.

label: guilt
text: I am not good enough for your experiment I am doing.

label: fear
text: Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I might lose him.

label: disgust
text: On the road there was a dead animal with its entrails showing and its skull crushed.

label: joy
text: Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but expected only a moderate mark.

label: guilt
text: This feeling comes frequently when I go out at night and tell my mother that I shall come back early. But then I get home a 5 or 6 a.m.

label: guilt
text: When I offend somebody unfairly.

label: joy
text: I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

label: anger
text: My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not enough space to store them.

label: disgust
text: On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years) cigarettes.

label: anger
text: I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do, naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits that get me mad.

label: joy
text: After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5 examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter of acceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia telling me that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.

label: anger
text: After I said something that my boyfriend disagreed with, he walked away from me without discussing what bothered him. I became very angry with him for treating me this way. Yesterday, November 14.

label: joy
text: Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.

label: shame
text: I tried after months to begin talking to my boyfriend again. He ignored me. I felt I had lowered my pride and became his "doormat".

label: joy
text: When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

label: shame
text: When I got really drunk on Norvegian Indipendence Day, and was not allowed to participate in football (soccer) games for two weeks. That was very unpleasant.

label: fear
text: When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.

label: disgust
text: A nightmare.  I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried to shake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, they suck.  And there are a lot of them.  I panic.

label: anger
text: When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume      my studies in time at UNZA.

label: joy
text: I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition.  In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored  the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell down.

label: joy
text: I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running competition.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it was put against my breast.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good, it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.

label: fear
text: I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.

label: disgust
text: Some boys boasting about their ability to tell dirty jokes.

label: guilt
text: When my aunt took her own life, I felt guity for not understanding that she needed support.

label: guilt
text: Two timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).

label: shame
text: If I don't go to lectures, I often feel ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Gave the wrong meal tickets to other people (my classmate).

label: shame
text: My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I felt quite ashamed of myself.

label: joy
text: I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass.  I rejoyced at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies depended on it.

label: joy
text: Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course.

label: fear
text: Haven't been frightened for ages.

label: sadness
text: When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.

label: disgust
text: When I discovered my mother had been having an affair with my father's best friend, and then ran away with him without even speaking to me about what she was doing letting me come home from school simply to find her gone. I was filled with disgust and contempt.

label: shame
text: It was my birthday and all the members of the group made me a surprise in a public place at 10 p.m. giving me flowers and suvenirs.

label: anger
text: Not being alowed on a school camp with the class I'd been in for 11 years (I had stayed down due to illness)

label: anger
text: When my mother scolded me for coming home late, i.e after 7 P.M.

label: disgust
text: Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men committing various acts.

label: anger
text: When I failed the M.S.C exams.

label: guilt
text: When I had beaten my auntie.

label: anger
text: When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died.

label: fear
text: Staying alone in the dark.

label: shame
text: Talking to friends about how old you are and we cannot be as successful as you at your age.

label: disgust
text: I was really disgusted when I saw one of my friends soiling on his clothes. I thought he was mad.

label: anger
text: I had been having a heated argument with a lover - whose intention was that we should marry in the near future - and was rejected by her when I started to cry. When I stopped crying for a moment she said "There, have you got it all out now ?".

label: joy
text: Falling in love.

label: guilt
text: I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A few days later my mother noticed it and asked me about it, I told her that I had no idea.

label: disgust
text: Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.

label: fear
text: When I was watching a movie in which there was a pit full of dangers and there was only a small safe place on which a man was standing; he had to catch the lady who was thrown in or else ! The pit was 20 feet deep.

label: guilt
text: I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.  Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty about her sadness.

label: anger
text: My best friend betrayed me and told other people my secrets.

label: fear
text: When for the first time I rode on a motorcycle with my brother.  He was going so fast that I felt that I would fall off without my brother realizing it.

label: shame
text: I saw a bag on the street and just then a stranger passed by.  I picked up the bag immediately and gave it to the stranger as I thought that it belonged to him.  But it was not his bag and I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: During 7th grade our class mobbed a famale teacher so badly that she had a breackdown and was hospitalized.

label: fear
text: When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.

label: guilt
text: One day when I was working, I went out for dinner with friends without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.

label: sadness
text: Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the hunter who shot him.

label: guilt
text: My friend did not do well in the examn because I did not help him.

label: fear
text: Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.

label: joy
text: I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had not seen for two years.

label: disgust
text: A girl with whom I was staying having sex with a person for about 3 nights running, and then with his brother the following night, and back again.

label: guilt
text: Leaving University in 1982 following exclusion and lying to parents/friends about reasons for leaving, i.e. lying about the fact of having been excluded.

label: anger
text: I get angry when people disbelieve me or misunderstand me.

label: guilt
text: When I had lied, saying that I never take bread from the dinning hall and a friend of mine caught me doing it.  He thus proved to me that I did in fact take the bread.

label: disgust
text: I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and it was moving its limbs.

label: sadness
text: Death of grandmother.

label: fear
text: I was fearful when I realised that the relish was overcooked simply because I was not keen enough at checking whether there was still enough water in the relish or not, instead I was just playing with my friends.

label: guilt
text: When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more than that and I put down "very good" for fear of being scolded. Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for what I had done.

label: shame
text: I choked on a cold drink in front of girls who were strangers.

label: guilt
text: Getting a friend an open container ticket because I got caught speeding.

label: fear
text: We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very late.  We began to hear foot steps all around us, and we could not find our way out.

label: joy
text: When my application for studying the masters degree was accepted.

label: anger
text: My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was my sister who had done it.

label: guilt
text: Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against both girls.

label: anger
text: I was angry when I heard that my only girl was going about with another man. So I decided to drop her but later the story came to be untrue.

label: sadness
text: When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from what I was told about it.

label: guilt
text: The time that I had to put my dog to sleep.

label: fear
text: One night we were having a barbecue on the beach and I needed to go to my car, which was far away from the beach.  It was very dark as there were no street lamps.  I ran in the dark, very scared, I ran as fast as possible.

label: disgust
text: At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered; blood was dripping on the floor.

label: anger
text: Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.

label: shame
text: At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was prevented from participating in several activities.

label: fear
text: I found a problem in homework which would not get solved although I tried my best.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.

label: sadness
text: Two years ago my best friend died in an accident, just a day before my birthray.  We were very close to each other and I felt very sad at loosing a close friend.

label: disgust
text: The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.

label: anger
text: I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car. We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for me to go to Carinthia.

label: guilt
text: When I knew that my niece did a bad schoolar examination because I couldn't explain her the lesson.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of deep perturbation.

label: disgust
text: I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from the back of the lorries.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and    his skin came peeling off.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from his car.  It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.

label: fear
text: Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher - waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.

label: guilt
text: After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and felt guilty about having taken it.

label: shame
text: In the compartment of a public transport railway, I did not give my seat to an old man who was standing near me.  It was another teenager who did so.

label: shame
text: An out-patient asked me to read for him a certain prescription but I was unable to do so. The patient was dissappointed and lost hope in me.

label: fear
text: Had fear of losing husband.

label: anger
text: Misunderstood by a close friend for the wrong reason.

label: guilt
text: When my father had a serious fight with my sister, because of me.

label: disgust
text: A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat, then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the bench.

label: joy
text: For a few days I felt very miserable, distressed and listless, with crying fits. When this was over I felt very happy, although there was no special reason.

label: disgust
text: When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simply because it was far away from my house.

label: fear
text: When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

label: fear
text: The possibility of having failed the examination.

label: guilt
text: I had an argument with my boyfriend.  It was my fault but my pride would not let me admit it.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with drunk people.

label: anger
text: I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as much money as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brother was better off then me.

label: anger
text: My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by the teacher.

label: disgust
text: This person I know lied about how much income his parents made and received money through grants which he did not need. Another person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive enough money.

label: anger
text: When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since he no longer had the time to look after my garden and animals.

label: disgust
text: First anatomy lesson.

label: sadness
text: My child passed away after a short illness when he was just eleven months old. I was only told about his death without knowing that he had been ill.

label: anger
text: I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball offending her relatives.

label: fear
text: An inter-college basket-ball match.

label: shame
text: The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.

label: sadness
text: This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate woke me up.

label: disgust
text: When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.

label: anger
text: The surname of my brother was different from ours.  He often grinned at home and provoked others for the pleasure of it.  This made me angry.

label: guilt
text: I hated you for not letting me go and found out that it was not your decision.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel from our homes to the lectures here every day.  The way the whole thing was handled disgusted me.

label: sadness
text: Death of a close friend.

label: fear
text: I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my examination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I was dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with fear until it was my turn.

label: joy
text: When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.

label: shame
text: I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot about it.

label: disgust
text: Once when I had started to write a paper, there was a phone call for me.  I had to go downstairs to receive it and after the conversation I discovered that all the information had disappeared from my mind.

label: guilt
text: Describing to mother how a hole in the wall had appeared while I was babysitting.

label: fear
text: When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throw a chair on my brother.

label: shame
text: When I ate my sister's food and then she found out that it was me.  I felt very ashamed but still refused to admit that it was me.

label: sadness
text: My father won't be so pleased with me as if I was elected "Three Good".

label: disgust
text: Once I offended a friend, instead of her coming to me to ask and discuss the matter she was just telling other people about it and say all she could about me.

label: anger
text: I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who help each other in exams, to the professor.

label: anger
text: When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write Examinations in a few minutes.

label: shame
text: I entered the wrong room, and got into a bed where someone already was sleeping.

label: disgust
text: When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.

label: guilt
text: I crashed my father's car.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine felt bad because of something I had done to something that belonged to him.

label: disgust
text: During lunch with some classmates, a priest was also there.  He was eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plate away.  He did it with gluttony.  He wiped his hands on his suit several times and it was full of crumbs.

label: fear
text: It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

label: fear
text: Being alone at night.

label: fear
text: One camping night, I listened to the ghost stories told by my classmates.

label: shame
text: I was alone in the bus when I tripped and fell, and dropped all my papers.

label: anger
text: I felt much anger and perhaps I feel it till now, against my girlfriend's sister who incited her to betray me just when I needed her very much. She didn't think of anything, simply passed over everything.

label: anger
text: Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called "treatment" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that someone was in the house.

label: shame
text: Cannot remember such a situation.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend returned after a long absence.

label: anger
text: Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Union announced that the All Blacks' would accept the invitation of South Africa to play rugby in that country.

label: fear
text: When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened but he recovered later.

label: fear
text: While swimming, I hit my head at the bottom of the pool and required stitches. I later learned that the consequences could have been much more severe and that terrified me.

label: guilt
text: When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone to the girl's secondary school.

label: fear
text: When I had to talk with an important person about a job.

label: shame
text: After shouting at a friend.

label: shame
text: I had been telling lies and people discovered instantly that I was telling lies. I felt very shameful and I felt like disappearing from people.

label: joy
text: When I received a letter from the university telling me that my application had been accepted.

label: anger
text: My elder brother often criticizes my mother's cooking.  Once he did it very impolitely and lost his temper.  This made all of us very sad.  I was very angry and I scolded him.  He asked me not to interfere with what was his buisness.

label: anger
text: When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.

label: disgust
text: When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often with her.

label: sadness
text: I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't die, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be put down.

label: disgust
text: My mother was always fastidious about my room, bed time, etc.  She treated us strictly and punished us physically.   These things were intolerable.

label: guilt
text: Did not read reference when other people read them.

label: sadness
text: A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died within two years.  We had not finished our studies then and could not bear our responsibilities as her children.  My mother had tried her best to take care of us but she lived in pain these two years.  Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her as cancer is incurable.  I was very eager to replace her in suffernig , even die instead of her.

label: anger
text: When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.

label: guilt
text: My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame bacause with her it is a stress disease.

label: anger
text: Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel.  I had been slightly irritated earlier.  At night when I was trying to sleep they were having a party so I went and yelled at them.  I wanted to sleep as I had to get up early the next day.

label: fear
text: Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middle of the night in Italy.

label: guilt
text: Forgot to collect post for a friend.

label: sadness
text: The death of a close relative.

label: fear
text: I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.  I had brought along a lamp which was not working very well.  The door made strange sounds and I was sure that strange things were happening.  The most terrifying bit was that there were many wardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass of the wardrobe I felt that there were "objects" behind me.   The whole night was spent in fear and restlessness.

label: disgust
text: One day I went to see a rather disagreeable film (X).

label: fear
text: Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a pushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded by smouldering wood and flame.

label: anger
text: When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying Psychology because of its low status.

label: joy
text: Found my name on the list of attending the English lectures.

label: sadness
text: When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my form five exams with flying colours.

label: disgust
text: I saw a friend's husband with another woman.

label: fear
text: Falling off a cliff in the mountains.

label: fear
text: One time I was injured when I was playing football at School in Blantyre. I was brought to the hospital while my leg was totally swollen. The x-rays confirmed there was no fracture but collection of blood n the muscles. I feared when they started to incise the swollen part with surgical blade.

label: guilt
text: When I took drugs.

label: fear
text: When my son has a pain in his leg (for no apparent reason).

label: shame
text: While dining with some accquaintances I was asked something which I should have known but I did not know.

label: joy
text: When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to win the Cup of England.

label: joy
text: My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all very worried but it was successful.

label: guilt
text: When I hit my young sister without a valid reason.

label: anger
text: When my brother went out with my new shirt that I adored, and returned it dirty with grease.

label: sadness
text: When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation and they are together now).

label: disgust
text: I once saw an elderly lady who was not properly dressed.  She was wearing a transparent dress, such things are not sopposed to be seen in African society.

label: anger
text: I came across a girl at the school bus-stop, I had seen her several friends as she was a friend's friend.  However my friend had never introduced me to her and when she got off the bus I smiled at her but she did not respond pretending not to have seen me.  Her arrogant behaviour made me sick and angry.

label: disgust
text: At an anti-pornography meeting, when samples from films and magazines were shown.

label: anger
text: My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing and went out with him herself.

label: guilt
text: When I was fined for speeding.

label: disgust
text: Doing poorly on a midterm.

label: anger
text: Once I had an argument with my friends and I knew that I was right.  My friends went on arguing with me even though they did not know the right thing.

label: anger
text: A friend forgot his appointment with me.

label: fear
text: When I heard a rumour that the 1st year exam results were out. I had fear that I might be one of the failures.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt guilty.

label: fear
text: When I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in the forest.

label: guilt
text: Flirting with other girls while I already had a very good relationship. When there are problems in my relationship, the flirting increases as does the feeling of guilt.

label: anger
text: When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given me.

label: fear
text: That someone would discover whom I really love.

label: shame
text: I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended love and affection to be able to sleep with her.

label: fear
text: One night I and my friends went to the cemetery. We stopped the car in front of the wall and suddenly the grave digger appeared over the wall looking like a ghost. I was already afraid and almost died.

label: fear
text: I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my reason.

label: disgust
text: I felt very disgusted at a friend to whom I had given a Psychology book to read, and she did not care to give me back the book during the exams.

label: anger
text: Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing to cooperate after discussions to try and resolve an attitude problem.

label: fear
text: When I slept for the first time all alone in the house where I live now. A man phoned me at 2.00 am. He wanted something from me. I was afraid.

label: disgust
text: It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel disgusted.

label: anger
text: When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in it and threw it in the dust-bin.

label: joy
text: Having a good trip on a boat with good friends.

label: guilt
text: When I stared to much at a pastry that a woman was eating and at the same instant the pastry felt on the floor.

label: guilt
text: I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

label: shame
text: When I was still a child I was told off in face of other persons for having touched an object that didn't belong to me.

label: guilt
text: Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car, next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killed there when the car crashed.

label: sadness
text: When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

label: guilt
text: When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it was killed by the dogs.

label: fear
text: Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.

label: guilt
text: When I finished a test type of exam and did not dare to answer any question, I doubted whether I would pass the exam  or not.

label: fear
text: When I was bringing in the shopping and nearly stood on a snake.

label: shame
text: When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she was engaged to an another man.

label: sadness
text: I had been separated from my girlfriend for about a year.  On her birthday I put a present in her mailbox.  I had spent two days choosing a suitable present for her.  I waited for a few days and there was no reply from her; at last I received a thank-you card in my mailbox.  On the card there was only my name, the words thank-you  and her signature.  I was very sad then.

label: joy
text: For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.

label: sadness
text: I had a very short term romance during the summer vacations.  When we first met I felt excited but I wanted to avoid him after we had met a few times and so I proposed that we stay apart, I felt very sad then.

label: fear
text: While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of cows.

label: guilt
text: I read about the national and social spirit and self-discipline of the people of developed coutries like U.S.A, England, France, Germany etc.  Comparing this to the Indian people I felt guilty as they have no national spirit or self-discipline.

label: disgust
text: Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly she did not give up for a longer time.

label: disgust
text: In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while I was trying to concentrate on the program.

label: anger
text: There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw paw-paw in the face.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine came to visit and stayed with my roommate and me. My roommate and she became good friends. After she left, he didn't talk too highly of her.

label: sadness
text: After my little sister's Graduation from High School my grandmother became very sick. She passed away a few months later.

label: anger
text: When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in a questionnaire instead.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and        splinters of bone every where.

label: sadness
text: Some colleagues decided to go out on a Saturday not inviting me to decide either the place nor the time.

label: guilt
text: I have a two-month old baby.  When I came here, to the university, to attend lectures, I had to leave the baby with his father.  I felt guilty.

label: disgust
text: Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and masturbated.  Very disgusting.

label: fear
text: after getting a fail notice for a math class, I realized I was not doing very well in school in any subject. I began to fear failing a class or two.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.

label: fear
text: My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.  There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4 operated.  I was scared for my uncle's life.

label: fear
text: When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had guns.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that we cannot have good references because China is poor.

label: disgust
text: A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip of whimsy.

label: fear
text: On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me. He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I really did not like that.

label: guilt
text: I took french leave to do my homework.

label: guilt
text: A person misinterpreted what I had told her. I had told her that I had failed to insert a NasoGastric tube but she went and scolded the patient that she was being uncooperative.

label: anger
text: I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me and in the end I got really angry.

label: guilt
text: Not accepting hints of intimate relation from a girl.

label: guilt
text: I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt guilty.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after me and insisted on my apologizing.

label: fear
text: When my mother was seriously ill and had to be admitted to the hospital.

label: anger
text: When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and didn't want to talk to me any more.

label: joy
text: When India won the Prudential cup by beating West-Indies in the final match and became the world cricket champion.  West-Indies was the strongest of the eight countries which participated in the competition.

label: sadness
text: When my father passed away.

label: anger
text: I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend told me that she would go to travel next year with another good friend. We couldn't talk this out.

label: joy
text: When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.

label: joy
text: Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish title.

label: joy
text: When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.

label: shame
text: I had lunch in a restaurant with a friend and I paid the bill.  The change was that of a two dollar and a ten cent coin.  As I was talking with my friend I took the two dollar coin and forgot to leave a tip.

label: disgust
text: The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.  I did not like the man.

label: shame
text: I slept with a man purely because I found him physically attractive and was under the influence of alcohol.

label: joy
text: I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his mother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because it relates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn't lead a normal life and it just seems unfair.

label: joy
text: When my child was born.

label: anger
text: Being insulted on a bus.

label: sadness
text: It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).

label: shame
text: I was supposed to do something and didn't. The person was really dependiong on me.

label: guilt
text: When being illoyal (disloyal) to people close to me. Had such an episode with my sister, who should have received my support and attention.

label: joy
text: Having passed an exam.

label: disgust
text: Because of the examination I had to study night and day.

label: shame
text: When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.

label: fear
text: Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I hadn't wanted the lift, had refused 3 times, and then felt it'd be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.

label: shame
text: Finding out about Chinese money cannot buy foreign journals.

label: shame
text: Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.

label: fear
text: On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and very relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the man watching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ran away fast.

label: anger
text: When students in our working group showed no responsibility or interest in our work.

label: anger
text: I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when we (family) avoided a problem which could be solved readily.

label: anger
text: I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to thoughtlessness of some colleagues.

label: disgust
text: When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.

label: disgust
text: At the crowded conditions of living.  I always quarrel with my elder brother as he puts the T.V volume at a deafening level and I can not practise my piano lessons.  Thus I feel that my home is disgusting.

label: anger
text: On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the increasing threat of war with the USA.

label: joy
text: I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found him.

label: anger
text: When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language course and I could no longer catch up with the others.

label: sadness
text: Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along by would-be  in-laws.

label: sadness
text: When one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.

label: guilt
text: I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I felt guilty before her.

label: shame
text: I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant professor whom I highly respect.

label: sadness
text: I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.

label: anger
text: When I was teased by my friend for not scoring good marks in the exams.

label: joy
text: When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I like.

label: fear
text: I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark and windy.  I became rather panicky on the way to my house.

label: joy
text: Did very, very well on a Physics midterm.

label: joy
text: I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.

label: fear
text: Being chased in the dark by someone I did not know.

label: anger
text: When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, which my father also adheres.

label: joy
text: The joy came to me when I heard that I was going to start a Medical course at the Lilongwe School for Health Sciences.

label: guilt
text: When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an examination.

label: fear
text: When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls, because my car had broken down.

label: joy
text: After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good grade for an examination.

label: disgust
text: When my room-mate made a mess of the room after having drunk the whole night at a graduation party ceremony.

label: guilt
text: I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad for a long period.

label: disgust
text: When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath the air that smelled of her presence.

label: shame
text: I do not seem to feel emotion such as shame, guilt or fear - far out !

label: anger
text: I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they called me early morining to ask me "what are you going to do about the matter ?" (which had been discussed in the meeting).  Then I got angry.

label: guilt
text: Once while playing tennis with my classmate I lost a few tennis balls.  I found one near the tennis court and took it to be mine despite thinking that it might belong to the student in the next court.  I felt guilty.  Later someone came to me to claim the ball and I gave it back to him.

label: joy
text: Time had struck 8 o'clock when I heard from the radio that I had been selected to Robert Blake Secondary School for Form I. I was very happy for the selection. My parents and I were very happy and full of joy.

label: fear
text: Going to CAL not knowing anyone.

label: shame
text: I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shouting protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother screaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at another person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.

label: disgust
text: Over an argument.

label: disgust
text: When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on the grounds of coming home late.

label: disgust
text: My boyfriend and I did not have any contact with each other during  the Summer holidays.  I met him the day of the registration and looked  through him.  In the canteen he asked me if I wanted to have a drink and  I said no as I did not want him to do me a favour.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.

label: joy
text: When I bought my car.

label: disgust
text: Once while studying for my exam I found so many complicated words that it disgusted me.

label: shame
text: I lied to someone and some time later this person found out that I had not told him the truth.

label: guilt
text: In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I didn't have any more money.

label: guilt
text: When my pet dog,who was to us a family member, died.  He had been vomitting for the past three days and we had not found the time to call a vet, finally when the vet came it was already too late.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.

label: guilt
text: A parking fine.

label: shame
text: In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in the queue.  A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking me either to pay more attention or to leave.

label: joy
text: When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual emotion.

label: disgust
text: One of my good friends told people something I had told her in confidence about someone else.

label: fear
text: When I get into the tube or the train without paying for the ticket.

label: guilt
text: Having failed to help with the 5th of March arrangements (Women's Day), although I had previously promised to take part in the work.

label: fear
text: When the robbers broke in, at night.

label: joy
text: Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we found out that he succeded in entering at the University.

label: joy
text: When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only English classes)

label: joy
text: I got a good reaction from my tutor and tutorial group for a presentation I'd given that I was very worried about.

label: anger
text: Despite our good performance and excellent results the management refused to meet our demands.

label: fear
text: Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and prevent the accident.

label: disgust
text: I found out that someone that I knew had someone else taking tests for her.

label: fear
text: One night at three o'clock I was followed by a cardriver, who tried to molest me.

label: anger
text: Punished by a leader.

label: shame
text: After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

label: anger
text: I had left a student newspaper of the Chinese university on the table of the library.  It had disappeared when I came back.

label: anger
text: When someone threw a firecracker into my room at 7:00 am in the morning.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad and couldn't believe it (until today).

label: anger
text: When I was accused of something I had not done.

label: joy
text: Doing well in an examn.

label: sadness
text: Not being able to do well to be chosen for the English lecture.

label: sadness
text: A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.  Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.

label: fear
text: It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining bathroom switched on.

label: sadness
text: Failing an examination.

label: anger
text: When I learned that several people had died in the street due to  the cold weather.

label: shame
text: I forgot something I agreed upon with a good friend.

label: anger
text: One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.

label: anger
text: When I tried to explain to a plumber, face to face, that the toilet was broken and he did not believe it (it had been mended ten times).

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I went to one of the Central hospitals where my hope of getting good treatment was turned down by one of the doctors who said I was alright despite my feeling pain.

label: shame
text: When I was 10, I got busted for stealing a candy-bar.

label: anger
text: When my chief accused me of an error that I hadn't made.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty the other day because I took two pieces of bread instead of one in the Cafeteria and some of the girls were short of bread.

label: guilt
text: Not giving up something for Lent.

label: shame
text: My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him away, and they later contacted his parents.

label: shame
text: One day I went for a bath. I took off my clothes and as soon as I had finished my brother came in. I felt sad and I found no reason why he came in.

label: guilt
text: When I was a child I used to play with my cousin gushing wather to each other in front of the door of my house. One day we decided to gush with on a passing car. The driver stopped and went to discuss with my mother and my aunt that were there.

label: anger
text: Having agreed to share the taxi expenses, three people in the back of the car just ran off, leaving the person up front with the entire bill.

label: shame
text: I made a joke about the rat of a boy. I compared his rat with a sausage. I told the boy he had a delicious sausage.

label: shame
text: I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.

label: sadness
text: When I heard of the death of a friend who had just finished her training I felt very sad for she was young.

label: joy
text: After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one year in a foreign country.

label: anger
text: Friends who torture animals.

label: disgust
text: I read a story in the newspaper about butchers treating their animals very badly. They disgusted me.

label: fear
text: I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.

label: anger
text: When I got low marks in B.Sc final.

label: disgust
text: Encouter with a prostitute.

label: guilt
text: I was not able to help my sister to understand that her husband is a bad man before she was married to him.

label: shame
text: I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought.  I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed at myself as a lot of people I know were there.

label: disgust
text: When I was talking to a person who is a hypocrite, I felt disgusted at his reaction.

label: shame
text: I failed my Nutrition paper which was the paper ending the course.

label: anger
text: I had planned to study for my mid-term exams on a certain day and  my room-mate called me to ask me to go out for a stroll.  I tried to make an excuse so as not to go out but she refused to listen to me and insisted that I go out with her.  I find it unnecessary  to talk to her anymore.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed my friend's radio cassette and the plug cracked and some pieces broke off when the plug dropped off my hands.

label: guilt
text: When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a nonacademic degree.

label: anger
text: A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).

label: joy
text: I felt happy at the end of a 10 day student camp.  We had shared our hopes and aspirations and in the open situation so generated, we had made strong frienships and experienced our own worth as well.

label: fear
text: Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me as she was hundreds of kilometres away.

label: fear
text: I remember that my form 2 teacher was very fierce and dogmatic.  My feet would tremble whenever I saw her but I had to face the fact that I had to go for her class.

label: fear
text: Watching a horror movie with friends.

label: anger
text: One day I was really angry when all my food was eaten by a dog. My anger was against my mother because she was careless. She didn't keep the food in a hidden and proper place.

label: anger
text: I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because I was prevented from eating.

label: fear
text: I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre that was almost empty.

label: joy
text: A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I found that I was almost last in the exam.

label: shame
text: A theft committed by me.

label: fear
text: Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no one to help me and call First Aid.

label: shame
text: When I woke up after a night of drinking I couldn't remember and discovered several untoward things had occurred.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.

label: guilt
text: One day my mother went to visit her friends.  When she came back she scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so I decided not to talk to her.

label: fear
text: My car skidded on the wet street.

label: shame
text: When I talked maliciously about a colleague at work to someone else.  Immediately afterwards I felt ashamed.

label: fear
text: When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and it was split into several segments by something I could not see.  I suspected that it was witch-craft.

label: joy
text: Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).

label: joy
text: I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA was approved after it had been cancelled.

label: sadness
text: When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did not know what would happen.

label: fear
text: I am a "cantor" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I had to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As I did not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could not sing.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and trembled.

label: shame
text: Finding out that China does not have enough foreign currency to buy books.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.

label: fear
text: When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate on them.

label: anger
text: One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I was sure that I had done no such thing.

label: joy
text: A night spent with a group of friends.

label: guilt
text: I pointed a failure of a friend of mine.

label: anger
text: When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.

label: shame
text: Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.

label: fear
text: Disappointment over a friend.

label: sadness
text: There was a conflict of interest between me and a close friend of mine.  He only thought about his own interest and not about our friendship.  This behaviour hurt his friends.  Another incident is when a friend isolated himself without giving any reasons.

label: shame
text: I was talking with an aunt of mine that I adore and I found courage to say "I love you" and just after that came the shame.

label: sadness
text: The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in English.

label: guilt
text: I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. A few hours afterwards I found he was still free, went in and out of my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed my budgie - this happened to 3 budgies.

label: guilt
text: A situation where I stole a friends wife's wallet.

label: fear
text: When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snake   on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.

label: anger
text: My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear that I would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn't have seen this, but they blew and I did.

label: anger
text: A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who was also drunk.

label: shame
text: I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.

label: disgust
text: It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.

label: disgust
text: Someone told me he was chosen for the English lectures because he was a good friend of the class leader.

label: shame
text: When the class leader read out the names of those chosen for the English lecture and I was not on the list.

label: guilt
text: One day I took a packet of sweets from a certain Grocery at Nathenje. Then later on I started to feel guilty and realised that I had done a wrong thing to him.

label: anger
text: When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at secondary school.

label: joy
text: Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening around me which pleases me.

label: joy
text: When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant training course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself by dancing to music from the Radio cassette.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, when I was given my presents.

label: joy
text: When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.

label: shame
text: When my younger sister, who was then 16 years old, was pregnant.

label: disgust
text: One day, at an important place I met a group of girls and while we were waiting for a bus these girls started smoking and commanded me to smoke; I felt very disgusted.

label: joy
text: I met a friend I had not seen for a long time on the street.

label: sadness
text: A friend's mother died.

label: joy
text: An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in their accounts bureau.  They needed "clever people" and he had "immediately thought of me."

label: guilt
text: In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

label: anger
text: My mother in law slept in my bed.

label: joy
text: I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly, inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think "what others are thinking of me".  It was delightful to dance to one's heart content.

label: disgust
text: Hear people talking at my back.

label: disgust
text: Bisshop Ter Schure intoduced himself on TV to the Dutch Nation. He spoke as if he was God himself, and didn't discuss the way he had achieved this position.

label: shame
text: At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be rebuked in front of the other pupils.

label: fear
text: When I and the person mentioned above had a suspicion of pregnancy.

label: disgust
text: I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, I called my mother.

label: fear
text: When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports at the police station.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She was the last of my grand parents to pass away.

label: guilt
text: I once stole a shirt from the Department Store in which I work. I have been promoted to work in a very privileged section of the store. Their belief in my integrity makes me feel even guiltier.

label: sadness
text: I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and my best possessions got burnt in there.

label: guilt
text: I did badly in one of the vital exams, despite getting proper guidance from my parents.  I felt guilty of improper use of the chances provided to me.

label: shame
text: When I could not hold my bladder while making a telephone call and ended up wetting myself.

label: sadness
text: The dying of a close member of the family.

label: disgust
text: Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.  He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.

label: anger
text: In a situation whereby a friend's actions were deliberately against my wishes and (with) no regard to my feelings.

label: joy
text: The birth of my first child.

label: sadness
text: The day I left my first girlfriend.

label: sadness
text: When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.

label: shame
text: In our class we had a test on Nursing, so a friend from the Army was caught peeping, by using a paper which had already answers which was written by him. So all of us from the Army got ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends quarelled.

label: sadness
text: When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had failed.

label: anger
text: When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a man who hadn't the lower .... in a car exhibition. He was passing a handkerchief from inside to outside of his mouth.

label: disgust
text: No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her dancing instructor - he is a "user", i.e., takes advantage of her good nature.

label: anger
text: I was waiting to receive the participation on the profits and did not receive it.

label: sadness
text: I suddenly found that those whom I considerered to be my good friends did not care for me.  Although I could still be with them I felt unimportant.  I deeply thought about the reason behind this so as to see who was responsible for this.  Finally I made up my mind and decided not to expect too much from them.  I was sad when I decided that they were no longer my good friends.

label: disgust
text: I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted when we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some persons like this course.

label: anger
text: I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.  One of them studies in a private school and the other one is repeating his form five.  They do not know what they are doing.  They follow every word of their teachers, books and systems.  They always try to rationalize their bad acts by some game and they are satisfied with their awkward life.  I have tried to persuade them very often but have failed.  This time I had a fight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish the floor).

label: joy
text: When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last 3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for Council.

label: guilt
text: When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards my students.

label: disgust
text: It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I am familiar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequently occurring cause may be described as "the self-assured dullness".

label: joy
text: When I got a record as a gift from a friend.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather's funeral.

label: anger
text: I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.

label: anger
text: One day, I discussed a very important question with A.  A suddenly declared that he would not accept my position and thought that he himself was right.  Moreover, he attacked  strongly, not my opinion but me personally.

label: joy
text: First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved emotionally.

label: fear
text: Before important sports events.

label: fear
text: When I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for the rest of the day that the dream might come true e.g., being beaten (or eaten ?) by a snake.

label: joy
text: When  fell in love with my present girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: When my brother had to spend all evening repairing a gear-lever that I had broken.

label: joy
text: Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.

label: sadness
text: My father told me in the letter that my mother is ill.

label: disgust
text: Spit and vomit.

label: anger
text: When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friend who was sick, and owner of the restaurant refused to allow me a drink later in the evening (which is usually always available for workers), did not thank me, and was generally indifferent towards me - I felt I did not deserve this.

label: sadness
text: Relative's death.

label: disgust
text: While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes, mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequently went to his family. We had a very nice evening.

label: shame
text: When I have suffered a terrible fit of eating, that frequently occurs. Then I eat everything, I act like a glutton I eat big amounts of food, sometimes even half a loaf.

label: anger
text: A time when, as part of my work, I was sent out actually sort of volunteered to run an errand for someone who had no authority to send me out and the address was very far especially on foot and turned out to be incorrect too. The whole trip was a waste.

label: sadness
text: My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two days after.

label: shame
text: I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things wrong.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when I learnt that my father was seriously ill in hospital.

label: joy
text: When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became unimportant, I heard or saw the words "overcome egotism". The feeling of joy remained for month after that experience.

label: disgust
text: At a social event when none of the guests would help to serve food or clear tables. It was all beneath them.

label: shame
text: When I blamed my failure to the bias and favouritism in the        marking system, in fact I had not worked hard enough.

label: guilt
text: Friend's fiancT left her for me.

label: fear
text: When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were  not familiar.  We  heard strange noises outside the house and the  house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more frightening.

label: joy
text: Going to a concert.

label: anger
text: I was to meet a friend at the bus-stop (he was coming to visit us) and he did not turn up.  After having waited for him for some time     (about an hour) I called him up, to be told that he did not intend to come as he was feeling tired.

label: fear
text: I went to see a movie and I went with a friend, it was really frightening and it made me stop and think about the world around me and what it is really like out there. I was frightened all that night.

label: disgust
text: My roommate messing up our room.

label: anger
text: Overhear people talking about me and saying that I am stupid.

label: joy
text: I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I was completely healthy.

label: shame
text: One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken.  I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was not the servant but my daughter who had broken it.

label: sadness
text: My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.

label: sadness
text: When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time that someone so close to me had died.

label: anger
text: Being insulted in public for the wrong reason.

label: disgust
text: When I could not attend the college picnic due to some difficulties.

label: disgust
text: To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.

label: disgust
text: Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is something I just can not tolerate.

label: anger
text: I was not given a chance to explain to my close relatives as to why I could not go to visit them when they were ill.  When I did go, they thought that I had been selfish and irresponsible duringtheir illness.

label: joy
text: When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.

label: shame
text: My behaviour at a recent party.  I passed out early, luckily.

label: guilt
text: When I hurt my sisters for no reason at all.

label: anger
text: I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

label: joy
text: The birth of my daughter.

label: anger
text: While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal when I was thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.

label: anger
text: I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed his car on the place.

label: shame
text: I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night club.

label: joy
text: I received the message that I'd been accepted at the school where I really wanted to go.

label: guilt
text: I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it carelessly and it broke.

label: guilt
text: Not getting an airplane ticket fot my mother.

label: anger
text: When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.

label: disgust
text: Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke, that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his friends, but I was present.

label: sadness
text: Found out that my grandmother might have been misdiagnosed as a psychiatric patient because the doctor did not know about neurologism.

label: sadness
text: My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the sun rose.

label: joy
text: I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at first he had said that he would not do that.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I lost my three Kwacha at civo Stadium when Sam Mangwana was playing some Rumba records. That was not what I expected, I wanted some Disco records.

label: sadness
text: When my last relation broke up.

label: shame
text: China cannot let you give more lectures because you are needed in the specialist clinics. We are so backward in medicine.

label: sadness
text: This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car accident.

label: sadness
text: I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It limped. Some time later, when I thought that it had already run away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

label: joy
text: The time when my sister had her first baby I was so happy and joyous because she stayed for two days after marriage before she had a child.

label: guilt
text: It was about midnight and I wanted to go to the countryside (I was in town) to watch the stars in the sky.  My mother did not like this, in spite of it I went out for a while.  My mother got angry.

label: sadness
text: Did badly in an examn.

label: guilt
text: Being aggressive against members of my family.

label: anger
text: When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him that I had told them that I was pregnant.  My daddy  told my mother and she asked me if it was true.  I was very angry with my aunts.

label: shame
text: I was very ashamed when I was neglected by a certain friend whom I was thinking loved me very much.

label: anger
text: When my father failed to send me transport money after the closure of the school.

label: joy
text: When I won a tennis match.

label: joy
text: When I got a wedding ring of diamond from the boy I loved.

label: fear
text: When my mother's heart nearly stopped.

label: anger
text: When my sister took something that belonged to me without my permission.

label: shame
text: I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about our problems, I told her lies.

label: anger
text: A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December last year.

label: guilt
text: I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for my exams.

label: sadness
text: My close friend and I applied to TISS for admission last year, unfortunately he failed to get admission.  We had done our graduation together and are quite involved with each other, so we had wanted to do our Masters degree together.  However, it did not work out as we had expected it to and this saddened me.

label: fear
text: I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final year degree exams.

label: fear
text: When my brother had an epileptic attack and I was scared as to what would happen to him.

label: guilt
text: One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had a bad conscience and felt guilty.

label: disgust
text: When I failed the entrance exam of the medical school and was studying biochemistry which has no job prospects in Zambia.

label: shame
text: Once I answered my father rudely.

label: joy
text: When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at the first call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. It was the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.

label: guilt
text: I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that and I felt guilty.

label: anger
text: My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in recent broken relationship.

label: sadness
text: When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see her predicament from the window.  She was given a the cold shoulder.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned my sister out of my parents home.

label: disgust
text: When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about the killing of cows.

label: shame
text: Sometime back I was coming from the wards and lice were all over my uniform since patient's blankets have a lot of lice. It happened that my boyfriend picked some lice from my white uniform. I was so ashamed.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died of cancer.

label: anger
text: When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not know.

label: joy
text: An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long separation.

label: joy
text: When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

label: shame
text: Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted to say.  Thoughtlessness.

label: sadness
text: Saw a father beating up his small child.

label: joy
text: After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being selected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: joy
text: Today I did a lot better on my architecture project than I expected.

label: sadness
text: When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the events that were taking place there.

label: anger
text: I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.

label: guilt
text: I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's playground, when a toddler ran in front of me I knocked him over and he hit his head quite hard and began crying.

label: fear
text: Motorcycle accident with two people involved, running off the road. Broke an arm, only.

label: anger
text: Finding out that I was deceived by a friend.

label: guilt
text: Shouting at my parents because I was angry about something else.

label: anger
