text: When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person. His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.

label: guilt
text: When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.

label: joy
text: This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to start Form I in October 1980.

label: joy
text: Being elected as class leader.

label: guilt
text: I took my father's car to church one Sunday (I told them that's where I was going ) I decided instead to go for a drive to the beach - on the way I got a puncture.

label: anger
text: When I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.

label: joy
text: When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go there, if I wished, in Summer.

label: shame
text: In a Christian gathering's lucky draw I mistook a girl's name for mine (a boy's name).  I realized my mistake only when I went up to the stage for the prize.  I did not know what to do as everyone was looking at me.  I blushed and went back to my seat.

label: guilt
text: The first time I went away with my boyfriend and lied about where we were staying.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I was not present either to see the person or to try to share my emotions with other friends.

label: joy
text: Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.

label: joy
text: A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many friends were present and good music.

label: anger
text: This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally spoiled my New year's night.

label: shame
text: After making a joke about a friend's marriage that was too personal.

label: sadness
text: When I was not selected to go to the University of Malawi I felt very sad.

label: anger
text: I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we  started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started teasing me.

label: shame
text: I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not prepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.

label: disgust
text: My roommate boasting about her English lectures.

label: shame
text: When I didn't meet an appointment I had made. The person phoned me but I thought of something (I told I was ill) so that I didn't have to go.

label: joy
text: A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.

label: sadness
text: I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved who had to leave for her motherland.

label: sadness
text: Death of General Ye Jianying.

label: shame
text: A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomly assigned one person in each group to make a presentation.  The discussion in our group had been confused and the presentation was not very well prepared.  Unfortunately I was selected to present and I could not keep calm, was confused and result was very poor.  I really felt ashamed.

label: disgust
text: At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression on me.

label: sadness
text: When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I went to live in Sofia.

label: sadness
text: My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt very sorry for her.

label: fear
text: As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it might bite me.

label: joy
text: When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome them.

label: disgust
text: Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and the government decided to delay it for another year. When my father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.

label: sadness
text: When my father died.

label: shame
text: I felt this when I was copying homework for one of my classes.

label: disgust
text: Finding a hair in the soup.

label: disgust
text: When my friends and I were camping in a weekend, and with little food, we met a middle age couple from a small town that invited us to eat in their house. Their house was small, badly built with old and dirty forniture and utensils. The problem was with pans, and dishes, and even the food.

label: disgust
text: When I saw our computer teacher.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.

label: shame
text: I went to bed with a girl and the next day she thought it was the start of something serious and I just thought it was fun and I told her I wasn't interested in starting a serious relationship.

label: sadness
text: When an earlier friend was spreading negative rumours about me.

label: fear
text: Finding out in your lecture that a doctor can make misdiagnoses because of ignorance in neuropsychology.

label: anger
text: I was supposed to meet my girlfriend at a pre-arranged place but it took me an hour to find her.

label: anger
text: A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion over me. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.

label: joy
text: When I passed and qualified for the university.

label: fear
text: Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a disco.

label: disgust
text: I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.

label: disgust
text: When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...

label: fear
text: When I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: sadness
text: When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining engineering, after having prayed one week in the church I was not even selected.

label: joy
text: I realized the girl liked to be with me.

label: anger
text: When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not finished.

label: joy
text: When my uncle gave me my first year's results.  I opened the envelope and my eyes ran into two "B+" - in EC110 and M160, this meant that I had qualified for a major in economics.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

label: shame
text: One of my best friends'fiancT broke off the relationship because his feelings for me were stronger than for her. I felt the same for him, but did not really encourage him to leave her or stay with her - still felt shame.

label: guilt
text: When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a group.

label: fear
text: A friend's father had died, I was to come and see this friend although I did not know his family.

label: fear
text: There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on the eight floor.

label: joy
text: When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.

label: fear
text: I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approached me and yelled "I fuck you", then however he stopped and laughed at me.

label: disgust
text: When I went to visit a relative and saw how messy and dirty his place was, in the absence of his wife.

label: fear
text: After seeing a horror film - Omen.  I could not sleep at night  even though I closed my eyes.  The last scene of the film kept coming back to me, I seemed to hear the girls in the film shouting at the devil.  The devil did not have any expression on his face and I thought that he would choose me.

label: sadness
text: While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill for a long time, she was 17 yrs old.

label: guilt
text: Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having given her this additonal problem.

label: shame
text: One day I was the leader of the weekly meeting of the Church fellowship.  That day I had been preparing for the exams and did not estimate the time to travel to the church right and I was twenty minutes late.  As I had not prepared well I led the meeting badly.  I was ashamed of myself.

label: disgust
text: Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other people because of their social status, beliefs, color and outlook on life (perspective).

label: disgust
text: A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the class during a tough mathematics examination.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust of dirty.

label: anger
text: When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an hour for the next one.

label: disgust
text: Prolonged "niggling" of friend on a single theme which I considered of no consequence.

label: sadness
text: My mother left my father for his best friend, and he moved to Papua New Guinea. Despite the fact that I am closer to my father than to anyone else in my family, I had to move in with my mother, and say good-bye to my father, not knowing when I would see him again.

label: guilt
text: When I was 4-5 years old my mother gave me some parts of a chocolate bar and ordered me to bring it to my father working outside. On my way I could not resist the temptation and ate it myself.

label: guilt
text: There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my mother. So my mother always scolded her.

label: disgust
text: Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.

label: disgust
text: My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values) and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.

label: anger
text: When a person is privileged in account of situations that are unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.

label: shame
text: When I went to the library three weeks after it had opened and found that everyone was busy.

label: fear
text: We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My friend had to turn the car rapidly.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.

label: sadness
text: I had received bad news informing me that grandmother and grandfather had passed away. The first one to die was my grandmother and after two days grandfather died too.

label: joy
text: I went on a picnic to the country side park.  The beautiful scenary made me feel relaxed and every worry disappeared , thus the picnic was worthwhile.

label: shame
text: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

label: shame
text: When my sister became pregnant at UNZA last year.

label: anger
text: Discussion with my mother about the way to educate my children. I felt anger against my mother.

label: joy
text: I spoke with a friend on the phone who I haven't seen in many years. It was a joyful event to talk to him.

label: sadness
text: A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally graphic.

label: joy
text: Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.

label: fear
text: Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.

label: shame
text: Once in a public ladies room, I opened the door of a cubicle that was taken, although it was not locked.

label: shame
text: I lost my driver's licence because of speeding.

label: anger
text: I was informed by my flatmate that, when we'd moved into our flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to this, she had said nothing.

label: sadness
text: When the train taking me to my military service left the station, on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I had a hard year ahead.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that two of them perished.

label: sadness
text: When I received the S.Y.J.C results, the marks I obtained were not up to my expectations and I missed admission in engineering.

label: guilt
text: Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that China is still backward in science.

label: fear
text: I lost my way on a trip in the mountains.

label: shame
text: When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.

label: sadness
text: Saw the village I come from still pay money to buy wife.

label: joy
text: One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to have them as friends.

label: fear
text: Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the airport, then board the plane alone.

label: sadness
text: When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.

label: joy
text: Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through police.

label: disgust
text: In May somebody blamed me that I made him to be caught while peeping during the Nursing Test which made me feel disgusted.

label: guilt
text: When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

label: sadness
text: The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six years).

label: disgust
text: With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and urinated on the floor in front of everyone.

label: fear
text: As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinate manner afraid of the death of my father and mother.

label: joy
text: I was called and invited to have a talk about a job I wanted to have.

label: disgust
text: My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a peculiar manner.

label: sadness
text: Passing away of my father.

label: joy
text: When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now my girlfriend).

label: fear
text: I was teaching someone to drive and when we were about to crash I was scared.

label: fear
text: When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behaved incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from school.

label: shame
text: I think that I am rather shy and do not mix with people as I would have liked to, out of shyness.

label: fear
text: I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at 1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.

label: sadness
text: I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.

label: sadness
text: The day that the results of the college entrance examinations for the S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my name on the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and  the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, and not only sadness.

label: anger
text: A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married here, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays my parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.

label: joy
text: A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend. Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full speed.

label: shame
text: When I boxed my child's ears.

label: fear
text: A terrible fight that I provoked with my friend.

label: anger
text: When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  days earlier.

label: disgust
text: Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

label: disgust
text: I do not like one of our neighbours as they are very selfish.  Whenever they want something or need help they come to see us,  otherwise they do not even bother about people who live next to them.

label: anger
text: When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers wandering around, doing nothing.

label: anger
text: I was angry when my friends said that I should not receive Nursing Science books because there was a rumour that I was intending to leave the college.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a lot of rubbish and animal waste on the floor.

label: fear
text: My boat running into another boat.

label: fear
text: When I was 7-8 years old, I woke up one night and found myself alone at home.  My mother had gone out to buy cigarattes from a machine.

label: sadness
text: The passing away of my mum.

label: sadness
text: I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA demonstrations.

label: disgust
text: Saw a dirty street.

label: disgust
text: When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the power of money.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I was found to be the chief leader of making noise in class.

label: joy
text: When my daughter was born.

label: joy
text: When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.

label: anger
text: Having gone to school without learning anything, as usual.

label: disgust
text: While watching the movie called "Deer hunter" on TV, when it showed how prisoners were treated.

label: shame
text: When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men and women.

label: sadness
text: When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 and we were about to take the main exam.

label: shame
text: When I get an exam back with a grade that I did not desire. Then I get mad at myself and say that I could have done better.

label: disgust
text: To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.

label: anger
text: On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.

label: joy
text: As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more anxious.  My friend called me and said, " You have passed."  My heart was full of joy.

label: sadness
text: It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so that I could take my exams.

label: fear
text: When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.

label: joy
text: At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have such good friends.

label: joy
text: The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got engaged.

label: disgust
text: People not cueing in the college dining room.

label: joy
text: The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving Exams and I was selected to go to college.

label: disgust
text: I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this I felt a dead bird laying under my bed.

label: shame
text: I drink wine too often.

label: joy
text: When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology student.

label: sadness
text: At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an old flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my father had passed away.

label: joy
text: When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me too.

label: shame
text: When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander, was just as racially prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned.

label: anger
text: And she said absurd things, false things that filled my ears and inflated my head which seemed to be caught in a carcass where the heart wanted to explode and where the arm wanted to knock down the world.

label: anger
text: Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.

label: fear
text: In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn.  One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk (hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.

label: shame
text: My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she committed last night.

label: joy
text: When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians at ther wedding.

label: sadness
text: Finding out that China is poor, so we cannot have good reference books.

label: sadness
text: When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and was in hospital.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and I did not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it.  I was in there for several minutes.

label: fear
text: When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be heard.

label: shame
text: My father was a member of the public Alcohol and Drugs Board, when I was picked up by the police for being drunk in a public place.

label: joy
text: This is one feeling I never betray, but I must confess that the last time I slighty felt happy was when I passed my M.A with a high rank.  This was a few years ago when my friend told me about the result.

label: anger
text: Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).

label: disgust
text: I saw in an ice-cream kiosque a cockroach walking through a cornet.

label: guilt
text: When I didn't study for tests in High School. In particular  remember a physics test. I didn't study because my friends talked me out of it and we did something else boring. I felt so helpless just being there - then guilt set in because I was very close to getting an A in the class.

label: anger
text: I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go out together. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren't there. I became very angry because I thought they were gone without me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.

label: fear
text: I had a cousin whom I loved so much. Unfortunately she passed away suddenly and one time I had a dream in which I was talking to her yet she is dead.

label: guilt
text: Sleeping through crew practice one Monday morning.

label: guilt
text: Talking about someone behind their back.

label: anger
text: At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a small mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that, he did not listen to me but sent me away.

label: anger
text: A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.  I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

label: sadness
text: When I was in Bombay one of my good friends was getting married and he had not informed me about it, this made me sad.

label: anger
text: I work at a petrol station. When there is a foreigner who wants petrol my collegues treat him very impolite.

label: disgust
text: While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting helplessly.

label: anger
text: My flatmate was asking questions about my relationship with my boyfriend, whether I wasn't treating him as unfairly as I claimed he'd been treating me. As a result, I was angered, and became defensive.

label: guilt
text: At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My reaction was not as it should have been.

label: joy
text: When I pass exams, or when a close friend of mine recovered from an illness,etc.

label: shame
text: A much older man took advantage of me during my childhood (four to eight years of age).

label: sadness
text: When my mother died in August 1978.

label: disgust
text: When the committee, to which I belong, was accused of having squandered the money of the association.

label: fear
text: When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.  I ran and looked for her everywhere and could not find her.  (I finally found her, she had gone to bed to sleep)

label: guilt
text: I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was for her to do it.

label: guilt
text: Falling in love with a close friend.

label: disgust
text: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        operation.

label: joy
text: When Christmas holiday started, I felt very joyful when I finished my last exam.

label: anger
text: In the University we were convoked to a stroll like a freshman I was still innocent about the manipulation. On seeing the goal of the exaltation to poor character people, I felt anger on feeling myself mass of maneuver.

label: anger
text: Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.

label: anger
text: I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when a certain lady spoke words of sarcasm when I was trying to propose to her.

label: disgust
text: Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being deceitful, unfair, etc.

label: shame
text: When I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me "a three" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward.

label: shame
text: I promised a friend that I would return a book to it's owner for him , but I forgot to do it.

label: disgust
text: I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three day journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and tiring.

label: shame
text: At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had grown weary of it and said : "I would like to throw the book on the arse of Kuikka".  My classmate said : "Now, he is sitting there and waiting for the book" (Kuikka was one of the most quiet boys of the class).  I was ashamed of myself.

label: shame
text: When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and myself.

label: anger
text: A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an examination.

label: fear
text: When I heard a lion roar for the first time.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I was given a prize which belonged to someone else.

label: guilt
text: It was on January 1st 1985 when I accidentally broke a Fanta bottle in a certain bottle store in Zomba.

label: shame
text: Spots on the seat covers of my husband's car.

label: anger
text: My roommate was rude to me.

label: guilt
text: I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...

label: fear
text: When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial insecurity.

label: anger
text: I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouth persisted in trying to dominate the conversation.

label: joy
text: I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry examination.

label: anger
text: When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at the match.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement. This "sight" I watched from the bus.

label: sadness
text: After having been ill, when I was coming back to the hostel, I felt very sad leaving home.

label: joy
text: When I was offered a place in the university as a full time student.

label: guilt
text: I once torn the inner tube of a bike, that was not mine. Then I saw it was a brand new one. I felt very guilty then.

label: shame
text: When I wet my bed at boarding school.

label: guilt
text: Some of my friends had an argument.  I had earlier phoned one of them and that may have influenced him to argue.

label: shame
text: My mother told my uncle who is a Roman Catholic Priest (Redemptist Father) that I had been living in a de-facto relationship for three years. He was very, very angry at me.

label: guilt
text: After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were "inflated" enormously.

label: joy
text: When the results of the part I exams came out I felt tremendous joy in my heart.  The results came out after a long period of worry and anxiety, so it gave me endless relief and joy.

label: anger
text: When a person whom I had invited did not come on the appointed day and time.

label: sadness
text: When our dog died.

label: shame
text: About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was nothing wrong with me.

label: anger
text: When I left after the examination to enter the University, and even though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.

label: joy
text: When high level results were declared, I found my candidature number.  I was very happy as I had not expected it.  As I had been  injured before the examination and I had performed poorly.

label: sadness
text: Death of the family dog.

label: shame
text: When I went to a halloween party and had to walk through a shopping center dressed like a witch.

label: anger
text: When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very often misunderstood, especially when one is very frank.

label: fear
text: I was hunting, and was lost in the fog in the mountains.

label: shame
text: I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started looking at me and I had to move to their table.

label: fear
text: Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too much people in it. This gives me a fearful experience.

label: disgust
text: Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated physically me and my mother.

label: sadness
text: Leaving high school.

label: shame
text: Finding out that China is backward in science.

label: joy
text: My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of the life-saving dogs.

label: joy
text: I had a very pleasant conversation with one of my friends.

label: anger
text: At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and distrusted me.

label: joy
text: I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of them.

label: fear
text: I fear before each exam.

label: joy
text: I watched a football match with my old friend.  The performance of the team was very good and the team members were full of spirit.  The match was excellent and every time a goal was scored I felt excited.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed at being the only one to have got a C+ in ED120 assignment.

label: fear
text: When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

label: joy
text: On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a bird.(swans of the bay)

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.

label: guilt
text: When I slapped a nephew who did something that I considered wrong, and I was reprehended for this.

label: anger
text: I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding party.

label: anger
text: During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I asked my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good reason. I felt very angry with her.

label: disgust
text: People who discriminate other people disgust me.

label: joy
text: My best friend chosen for your English lectures.

label: disgust
text: When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.

label: fear
text: I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed one night by myself in the house.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who needed it immediately.

label: joy
text: I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in the children Assembly.

label: shame
text: When the teacher asked me a question, I did not know the answer and I just stood still for about a few minutes without saying a word.

label: anger
text: People hunting animals.

label: anger
text: It was when I discovered that my boyfriend had another girl. I discovered it through a letter he wrote to the girl when he was away. When I asked him he accepted it.

label: guilt
text: Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by some people because he was found raping the wife of the village headman.

label: disgust
text: A film were a woman was attacked and raped.  One did not see the worst but it had the desired effect - very strong.

label: guilt
text: There were old people in a crowded bus and I did not have the courage to give them my seat.  I closed my eyes to sleep and then opened my book to read.  In my heart I wanted to give them the seat.

label: disgust
text: A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger we had to comply. From that day I detested him.

label: sadness
text: I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.  Now when I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was intense.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I was directing the feelings of discontent with myself at my partner and this way was trying to put the blame on him instead of sorting out my own feeliings.

label: shame
text: Not doing well in the examn.

label: fear
text: Left alone in dark when young.

label: disgust
text: When I saw an insect going up my arm.

label: anger
text: When I encountered not only with my father's lack of understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be right are concerned.

label: sadness
text: My uncle died in the Vietnam War.

label: guilt
text: The only guilt I considered reasonable was my reproval at the end of the semester at the University.

label: sadness
text: I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never see eachother again and none of it mattered.

label: guilt
text: A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the smoke in that direction.

label: anger
text: When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration, simply because the child had been leaning against a window.

label: anger
text: I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was unfounded.  When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and slammed the door.

label: fear
text: When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather in the open sea.

label: anger
text: When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the floor.

label: fear
text: I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening and the night I frequently felt anxious.

label: sadness
text: I lost a close friend.

label: anger
text: Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

label: anger
text: I was really angry when the President general of UNZASU was arrested by policemen.

label: shame
text: On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend, I caused her to be physically harmed.

label: disgust
text: The emotion came to me when a certain girl who was not polite to her mother hit her sister severely.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted at my cousin, who is bad-mannered, does not know how to behave and talk to others, he does not respect elders and lies all the time.

label: shame
text: I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a wet lawn.

label: shame
text: When I got a bad result for one of my assignments.

label: joy
text: When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.

label: shame
text: In 1972 I failed my Examination because of my own crooky behaviour of dodging from Examinations.

label: sadness
text: A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays. Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I was overwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria.

label: joy
text: At my sister's wedding.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when I had not attended a class and the teacher asked me the reason for my absence.

label: anger
text: In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of view is completely disregarded.

label: sadness
text: When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few days later he died.

label: joy
text: When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried about getting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I found that I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately, could jump for joy.

label: disgust
text: Can't remember any episode of disgust.

label: sadness
text: One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my friendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sad because I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded her as being very faithful.

label: joy
text: When I was complimented and called "delightful".

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our relationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we shared everything and all this was finished.

label: sadness
text: When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at last that she would not turn up.

label: sadness
text: After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

label: shame
text: Close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at having done it and knowing that they knew.

label: disgust
text: Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. "Tried" because it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not competent and cultured.

label: disgust
text: One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriend and out of jealousy he started calling me names.

label: fear
text: I was bitten by a dog.

label: joy
text: When I saw that I had passed an exam.  It was the last chance and there was a lot at stake.

label: disgust
text: A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.

label: disgust
text: When I was told that the brother who was staying with me would not go to the training school that year but only the year after.

label: joy
text: Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of Nijmegen) for a while.

label: anger
text: A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, and taking 3 University exams part time).

label: guilt
text: When I was fighting with my elder brother I unintentionally hurt   him in the eye with a wooden bar.  I felt guilty and feared that he would be blind, fortunately he recovered after 15 days.

label: sadness
text: I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short illness.

label: fear
text: When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous for me and the people close to me.

label: fear
text: Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.

label: shame
text: When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.

label: anger
text: When playing a football match, there was one player who made mean tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do with football.

label: guilt
text: I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of my superiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.

label: guilt
text: After days or weekends where I did not accomplish the amount of sudying that I wanted to because of more pleasant activities which come up.

label: shame
text: When ditched - divorced by husband.

label: joy
text: When I read the newspaper that morning I found my candidature number on the admission list of the Chinese university.  I was satisfied and happy and the cumulative anxiety disappeared.  I only wanted to cry out that I had succeeded.

label: fear
text: One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car, but I was too frightened to go and see.

label: guilt
text: When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.

label: disgust
text: Saw people spitting in public.

label: disgust
text: When walking along the beach with my boyfriend, we saw 2 people having sex on the sand dunes in full view of everyone. It was the fact that they chose that area in which to have sex, that disgusted me.

label: shame
text: In class I had to say something aloud and people reacted  by laughing.

label: fear
text: I had fear of my father (parents) when I first became pregnant. I was afraid of delivery itself and whether I would give birth to a stiiborn or a baby.

label: shame
text: When a friend told me a story and I stayed dumb because I had no story to tell.

label: shame
text: When I was in the canteen of the United college I mistook a stranger for a classmate as I was not wearing my glasses.  I realized that I had made this mistake when I saw him again carefully.

label: shame
text: I had misbehaved at a party and did not wish to meet the person in question later.

label: fear
text: When a good friend of mine behaved in a very cool manner to me for a very long time.

label: anger
text: I was accused of a misdemeanour, unjustly.

label: joy
text: I had a picnic with old classmates, we chatted and played games.

label: anger
text: A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I felt very bad about it later.

label: sadness
text: My friend has to go on field trips, he just told me.

label: anger
text: I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger on her as she did not obey me.

label: sadness
text: I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said they carried diseases.

label: joy
text: Being chosen to do this experiment.

label: anger
text: Found out that someone I knew well has been misunderstanding me for 2 years.

label: shame
text: When I lied to my best friend about a boy she really liked but he didn't like her. I told her he did and she bugged him for a long time embarrassing herself.

label: joy
text: My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and had not had time alone together for almost a month until one afternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showered and ate together.

label: guilt
text: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to find out and I had to tell her I had lied.

label: anger
text: Whenever my father smokes the smell makes me feel very uncomfortable.  He never listens to my complaints and I curse him furiously in my mind.  I cannot solve this problem by violence because of traditional moral values.

label: guilt
text: When I broke off with my boyfriend after three years.  It was quite unexpected for him and there was no particular reason for the break up, such as someone else.

label: disgust
text: We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribal group which believes in Goddess Kali.  As it was a festival day they had to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a hen right in front of my eyes.  I felt disgusted and evenb gave up eating meat after this incident.

label: shame
text: We were at a party, this guy I liked and me.  I really loved him and gathered enough courage to ask him to kiss me.  He did not do it but instead asked me what I would like for my birthday.  I told him that I would like a kiss more than anything else but he excused himself and said that it was impossible.  I really felt embarassed.

label: joy
text: I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck and it was a real adventure.

label: guilt
text: One day, I was alone on duty when a patient choked while eating.  I ran to her and tried to make her breath, but it was too late.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't jailed.

label: sadness
text: I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They try to repress it.

label: shame
text: When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her feel hurt.

label: shame
text: When I went to see the doctor and had to take my clothes off so that he could examine me.

label: fear
text: I'm afraid of driving on the special seat of a mororcycle, mainly with certain colleagues who by exces of self-confidence drive beyond limits or measure in the traffic and the main victim is always the person who sits behind the driver.

label: shame
text: Haven't felt shame for ages.

label: sadness
text: Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial "explanation".

label: disgust
text: My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state and her actions.

label: sadness
text: When my brother died.

label: joy
text: When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.

label: anger
text: I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into the wrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me very denigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.

label: shame
text: Not being able to have a party at home with friends.

label: guilt
text: While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him permanent injury.

label: guilt
text: I'm allergic to most foods - eating something that I'm allergic to caused guilt.

label: shame
text: I had something wrong, saying wrong things and being impolite to someone, and this had embarrassed the this person.  And I still meet the person.

label: joy
text: Always when I am well succeded.

label: guilt
text: When I promised to visit my boyfriend and I didn't fulfil the promise.

label: joy
text: After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg and got a good write up in the paper.

label: joy
text: When I heard the examination results and when I recovered after having been sick for a week.

label: disgust
text: When I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film "Twentieth Century".

label: fear
text: Someone frightened me in the dark.

label: disgust
text: When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers and sisters badly.

label: disgust
text: I saw a magazine with photographs of dead and maimed people whose limbs were separated from their body like a head on one side and the leg on the other.

label: fear
text: When my B.A results had not come.

label: sadness
text: I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

label: sadness
text: The day my teacher of Latin and French died.

label: joy
text: When last year in college I received the award "Best Student of the Year",   I felt very happy as I got what I had wanted and my wish had been fulfilled.

label: anger
text: I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been drinking.

label: anger
text: I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away. At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week (including rent).

label: shame
text: After having failed my driving test.

label: disgust
text: A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. He tries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunk too much.

label: fear
text: Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.

label: joy
text: When I passsed the M.S.C board exams with first class, which I had not expected.

label: joy
text: When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus Christ as his saviour and Lord.

label: shame
text: In the last day of carnaval I met a boy and began to flirt with him. I was in love with him. When he introduced me to his friends I died of shame because I was with them before, I met my boyfriend in carnaval.

label: shame
text: When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed at having to see my parents later.

label: shame
text: When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we realized that he had been listening.

label: joy
text: When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.

label: fear
text: When abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.

label: anger
text: In the student's union there was someone who took the photocopies of two large volumes.  I asked him to let me take a few, he refused it for an acceptable reason.

label: sadness
text: My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with the driver.

label: disgust
text: The same as in SHAME.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to send something to a friend and it completely slipped my mind.  I felt guilty for having forgotten.

label: shame
text: My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quite young and pretty naive and he was pretty crude and real, sort of, macho. It was dark, at night during the summer and we were talking.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.

label: fear
text: I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock someone knocked violently on the door.

label: fear
text: I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which I should not have made.

label: disgust
text: I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the white population.

label: joy
text: China winning the Asian Olympic games (TV).

label: shame
text: My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him nowadays.

label: sadness
text: The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).

label: disgust
text: Finding out my grades at the end of my Sophomore year.

label: anger
text: At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paper at a reduced price.  After queuing with screaming children; it turned out that I had taken two 8 roll packets instead of the one 16 roll packet to which the rebate applied.  The assistant said "You will have to get it another time."

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when my appointment to meet the E.N.T. specialist had been turned down. The specialist came from U.K. and went the same day and we do not have one.

label: shame
text: When I arrived late at the job and met the most troublesome boss.

label: sadness
text: Last year, when I took the college entrance examinations I failed the FUVEST. It was for me the most frustrating situation because I had studied all year long, and only thought about this.

label: sadness
text: When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST, and I wasn't approved in the second fase.

label: disgust
text: Can't describe any disgust situation.

label: joy
text: When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got "very good" high school graduation marks.

label: shame
text: During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed and angry.

label: shame
text: During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.

label: guilt
text: In September 1984 I got two girls pregnant and the families of both the girls confronted me .  The fact was that my parents were around and I felt guilty answering some of the questions.

label: joy
text: I got to know that I had been accepted at university.

label: anger
text: Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.

label: anger
text: I went out dancing and found my boyfriend kissing another girl.

label: shame
text: The mother of a small child found me shaking the child in exasperation, because I couldn't get it to sleep.

label: anger
text: When I was mistreated by my step-mother.

label: shame
text: When my mother found out that I smoke maryhuana.

label: disgust
text: When I dined with my new friends, one of them kept reminding us that he was superior.

label: shame
text: I was walking outside the union refec after rain when I tripped and fell.

label: sadness
text: My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad and lonely.

label: fear
text: I was looking after my father's sheen in the forest. One day while playing with friends from neighbouring villages the flock escaped me and went into a far place. It became dark and I was afraid of father. I went home and hid myself.

label: disgust
text: Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted by a friend.

label: shame
text: Not collecting homeworks in time to give the teacher.

label: joy
text: I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a science class here.

label: sadness
text: At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

label: sadness
text: I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that there had grown a certain distance between us.

label: shame
text: Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said and done on the night before.

label: joy
text: China winning the Asian Olympic.

label: guilt
text: I forgot to lock the outside door at my Land Lady's place.

label: fear
text: Vertigo - standing on a ladder and painting the house.

label: anger
text: At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had to learn all on my own.

label: fear
text: When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.

label: joy
text: When I got a stereo walkman from my father when he had finacial difficulties. I thought that although he promised to give me that present, he was not obliged to do so.

label: shame
text: When unjustified hurting other people.

label: fear
text: I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.

label: joy
text: Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.

label: disgust
text: A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father. I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and the stepfather disgusted me.

label: sadness
text: When a friend left me and went back home for good.

label: joy
text: Finding out that the person I love understands me.

label: disgust
text: Girls dressed like foreigners in the university.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.

label: disgust
text: When junior doctors returned to work after bunking them.

label: joy
text: When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.

label: joy
text: Talking to a close friend.

label: anger
text: While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

label: joy
text: When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a fortnight.

label: joy
text: The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there, everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a wonderful time all day long.

label: anger
text: When, late at night, I discovered that they had stolen my bike.

label: disgust
text: My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick him up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.

label: anger
text: I gave tutorial to a student and I found that he was lazy, he did not pay attention to what I taught.  He did some easy questions wrong deliberately.

label: fear
text: I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.

label: shame
text: As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.

label: guilt
text: I did not deliver a message on time.

label: sadness
text: When my team lost a championship.

label: guilt
text: I had parked in a corner, and when I was going out I didn't watch if another car was coming and went out. The car that was coming was obliged to stop suddenly. It didn't crash but for a little.

label: shame
text: Telling friends about how my parents had been treating my brothers and sisters unfairly.

label: sadness
text: When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.

label: anger
text: Being told that I am a stupid person.

label: sadness
text: The death of Jaya Prakash Narayan caused a great deal of sadness as I believed that he was the only true democrat and a ray of hope on the Indian horizon.

label: guilt
text: Yesterday my boyfriend and I wanted to play billiards. However there were boys playing (5 times). My boyfriend then is fed up and chagrined. In such case I think it is my fault.

label: anger
text: When our government decided to withdraw student allowances as it was one of the conditions imposed by the IMF.

label: anger
text: Somebody wanted to beat my brother at a wedding ceremony and I was trying to protect my brother but the other man was calling names to both of us.

label: anger
text: Once a friend had pushed me and I had fallen on to a window which then broke.  I was taken to tthe principal's office and he accused me of having broken the window.

label: joy
text: After intercourse.

label: disgust
text: Can't remember having had this feeling.

label: disgust
text: While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling false stories about herself and praising herself.

label: disgust
text: When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.

label: shame
text: Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluation of these circumstances.

label: disgust
text: Each time I am confronted with reports about repression and torture.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and I felt totally helpless.

label: guilt
text: When I do or say something inappropriate which hurts people close to me.

label: shame
text: One day in the TYBA class the teacher asked me a very simple question which I could not answer.  Finally the teacher himself gave us the answer and my friends started laughing at me as I had not been able to answer a simple question.  I knew the answer but feared that my response may be wrong.  All this made me feel ashamed of myself.

label: fear
text: If a close relative's life is in danger.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the army was really mean.  I detested this.

label: shame
text: When I blurted out an answer in class without having been asked to do so.  The teacher told me that it was bad manners to do so.

label: shame
text: I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it worse than ever. I felt ashamed.

label: sadness
text: I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not have the money to do it.

label: disgust
text: When I went to the clinic for a medical check-up and saw the way the lecturer was conducting the lecture and the kind of responses he got from the patients.

label: shame
text: Once a female classmate told me that the clothes I wore seemed to be a child's clothes.  On hearing this I felt a little ashamed and I criticized her clothes though there was nothing wrong with them.

label: anger
text: When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while under the influence of alcool.

label: guilt
text: I did not do my homework and went to see a film.

label: fear
text: My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was expected, he came back several hours later than expected.

label: guilt
text: A good friend of mine who is at the moment in a foreign country. I didn't write her for several months and now I feel guilty.

label: sadness
text: When my beloved uncle was shot dead by relatives.

label: shame
text: In a play (secret friend) during the time of the high school I had to give a present to a boy and I was very ridiculous because of this.

label: disgust
text: When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not encouraged and was rejected.

label: anger
text: When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because I stole some sweets from my father's grocery. When he asked me who stole the sweets I told him it was my brother who stole the sweets and he was scolded.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted at my teams poor perfomance prior to league play.

label: guilt
text: I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very self-centered.

label: shame
text: Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for - money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.

label: fear
text: When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.  The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel us.

label: joy
text: When I was selected at TISS X.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed to be Brazilian and to live under a military dictatorship that despoiled the people, when during my military service.

label: guilt
text: While having an argument with my daughter, I got angry and over-excited and said angry words.

label: disgust
text: Saw my class leader acting like a God when he chose people to go to your English lectures.

label: sadness
text: The death of my twin sister - suicide.

label: anger
text: Some classmates said I did not do enough social work. Therefore I was not elected as a "Tree Good" student.

label: disgust
text: When my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.

label: shame
text: At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle  of a lesson.

label: sadness
text: My brother wanted me to buy a flute with him but I didn't accept afterwards I regretted it because he became sad.

label: joy
text: When my brother was born.

label: anger
text: My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.

label: sadness
text: When I deeply felt that I could lose the person I love best because of my foolishness.

label: anger
text: When I was concentrating on my work, my friend disturbed me continously.  I asked him to stop but in vain.

label: guilt
text: I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a moment when nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.

label: shame
text: When I realized that my bathing suit was spotted, I had became menstruated.

label: sadness
text: When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth place.

label: fear
text: Fear of thief.

label: shame
text: In a fight with my girlfriend in a luncheonette where everybody stared at me in such a way that I had to leave it.

label: anger
text: After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.

label: disgust
text: The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the driver made the same excuse every day.

label: anger
text: Two years back someone invited me to be the tutor of her grand-daughter.  The grand-daughter asked me some questions in mathematics so I taught her.  However she did not listen to me and this made me feel unhappy.  The second year it was the same.  When I entered university the girl's parents suggested that I be employed as their daghters tutor.  They told me that at university  there was no homework and I would have a lot of time so they made a time-table  for me which required me to be the tutor five days a week.  They did not respect me and anyway I had another child to teach.

label: fear
text: Was nearly knocked down by a car.

label: shame
text: I had written a "love-letter" to a class-mate of mine, this was meant to be a joke.  Unfortunately it fell in the wrong hands  and I had to face the consequences.

label: joy
text: One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I most wished, around me.

label: sadness
text: My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now her brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walk and she can hardly talk.

label: disgust
text: When a girl I knew aborted and threw the seven month foetus in a man-hole.

label: fear
text: No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow beside me.

label: guilt
text: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

label: joy
text: I received a letter from a friend whom I was missing

label: shame
text: A day I was with my boyfriend and a couple of friends in a bar, and he said something that I didn't like (I don't remember what). Without thinking I slept him in his back, getting ashamed and sorry just after.

label: fear
text: Finding out that a boy I do not like is in love with me.

label: shame
text: I was wearing a short skirt one day and someone told me my underwear was showing.

label: disgust
text: My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another close friend of mine.

label: anger
text: Someone told me that I was chosen for English lectures because the class leader is going out with me (not true).

label: joy
text: I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.

label: fear
text: I do not recall being scared in the near past.

label: anger
text: Physically fighting with my girlfriend because she just walked out of a room of my friends and had pushed and cursed at me when I went to find her.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after having  gone to a disco without permission.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test after three failures.

label: joy
text: When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.

label: joy
text: After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.

label: disgust
text: I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there I found that the bed had been wet the previous night.

label: guilt
text: I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting I forgot to take the minutes.

label: anger
text: I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to watch another film on the same channel. My friend switched over to the other cannel without asking me what I wanted.

label: guilt
text: I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on the same day).

label: fear
text: When I was treated improperly by someone.

label: fear
text: When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.

label: sadness
text: When my mother died.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied that he loved that girl more than he loved me.

label: joy
text: When I drove partially across the country with my father. We stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I got was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of the country.

label: fear
text: When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.

label: guilt
text: I entered the hostel this year.  My mother was ill and could not move and needed people to look after her.  Every week I left home to go back to school, I felt guilty.

label: disgust
text: We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started coughing and spitting into his plate.

label: fear
text: Finding out the great difference between China and the West in science.

label: fear
text: Once, when I was ten, I could not remember why my mother was so angry.  She fainted suddenly and I was very scared as I did not know what to do .

label: sadness
text: I had a girlfriend who lived several kilometers away from my home. One day she wrote me that she'd visit me. On her way she had a car accident and was badly injured. I was very sorry to see her lying in a bed in the hospital.

label: disgust
text: Not applicable.

label: joy
text: When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.

label: guilt
text: I knew I had to take an exam very soon but yet I couldn't start studying. I also knew it was very imprtant to succeed the exam this time.

label: guilt
text: While playing basketball I broke a team member's spectacles.  His face was injured by the  pieces of glass.  It was not serious but I felt guilty and blamed myself for being too careless and vigorous in my game.

label: sadness
text: It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons. Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.

label: fear
text: Not included on questionnaire.

label: fear
text: I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was very quiet. Then a man approached me and said "Hello".

label: anger
text: I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so well.

label: fear
text: I was physically assaulted and sexually abused about a year ago. Just the feeling that I might not get away intact, or even alive, produced fear.

label: guilt
text: When I secretly tried smoking for the first time, being 12 years old.

label: anger
text: My mother was ill and asked me to prpare our lunch. I went to do it, and while I was working, she stayed behind me telling what I had, or not to do. I asked her to stop meddling, and to go to bed. When I went to ask for help to my sister, my mother said that I was proud, that I asked for help only when I wanted and that I wasn't able to cook by myself.

label: shame
text: Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but through my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirits of a good driver.

label: guilt
text: I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense of guilt.

label: disgust
text: I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and next day he told me that he had chat up with another girl.

label: shame
text: When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.

label: joy
text: A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I got an attractive Summer job.

label: anger
text: Brother provoked anger. It was when mother and father were away and we had to look after ourselves. He accused me of being selfish and a snob.

label: fear
text: After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I was able to get to sleep again.

label: disgust
text: Helping older people on the toilet.

label: fear
text: Whenever I think of enrolling in Organic Chemistry.

label: fear
text: When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.

label: sadness
text: Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas, sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.

label: disgust
text: When, for example, someone is calumnating.

label: anger
text: Insulted by other people in the shop.

label: joy
text: I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did not study nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficult test.

label: shame
text: My mother had just been teaching me how to crochet, which is thought highly improper for a boy in a town.  Just when we finished, a neighbour walked in.

label: guilt
text: I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3 p.m.

label: disgust
text: This happened when I could not get into the school I had initially wanted, and ended up doing something I had never thought I would do.

label: joy
text: Talking with someone I admire a lot.

label: anger
text: When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and my mother took the teacher's point of view.

label: guilt
text: Beating my brother up.

label: joy
text: It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).  It was during the first term Summer vacations.  We met each other while handing in our homework.  He invited me have a trip with him and we were together till 8 P.M.

label: shame
text: As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a neighbour.

label: anger
text: Without the employer's knowledge and even without any communication their bank accounts were changed and their personal accounts closed.

label: fear
text: When at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him in the head. The blow caused a flesh wound and I was afraid of what would happen to me when the teacher found out the circumstances.

label: anger
text: My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be done by me.

label: fear
text: I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.

label: shame
text: Lying to my cousin about the form five examination fees.

label: anger
text: People not resprcting my opinion.

label: shame
text: I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.

label: disgust
text: When an employer of my younger sister (17 yrs) made a "pass" at her.

label: anger
text: When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.

label: guilt
text: That evening when I opened the songbook while I was singing the song "Those were the days" that guilt feeling became stronger.  The lyrics described well - I was really wrong.  The wish that I had made was really bad. If she were with me I would really be happy and we would play happily together like the days in secondary school and she would not be disappointed and gloomy because of me.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.

label: fear
