text: My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when I started to tease  him and in this joke I hurt him without knowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave it back to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing that it was my fault.

label: joy
text: When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of separation.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust when hearing or seeing other people being treated inhumanely. For example torturing in chili.

label: shame
text: On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been aggressive though he could have been.

label: guilt
text: I forgot to convey an important announcement.

label: disgust
text: People talking in an important lecture.

label: sadness
text: I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a long time.

label: anger
text: When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite undeservedly.

label: sadness
text: When one of my closest friends failed to make it to the third year of university.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something had irrevocably gone away from me.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my nephew had passed away.

label: guilt
text: Mentioning a book to the person who borrowed it.

label: joy
text: A close married friend has just had his first child.

label: shame
text: When I did not do well in the PG310 test I, I got only 4 marks above the pass marks despite my effort.  I felt bad because quite a number of friends did better.

label: joy
text: A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the time for an informal "greeting" in the church service. She said a few words.

label: disgust
text: A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and would like me to be close only to her.

label: joy
text: Relatives visiting me.

label: guilt
text: Unable to help my mother to cook.

label: disgust
text: I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the attacked person bleeded to much.

label: anger
text: A female classmate was always late for meetings which were for the homework and not social gatherings.  We were very busy and the deadline was close but we had to waste half an hour or an hour waiting for her as we could do nothing else then.

label: shame
text: It was my father's birthday party when I was asked to bring a tray of tea and other drinks.

label: sadness
text: When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.

label: guilt
text: I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that it was also my fault.

label: disgust
text: I work part-time as a shop-assistant and a customer spoke to me very loudly about an Indian man & white woman with children - how horrible that was and would I want to have little dark children.

label: disgust
text: Waiting for a bus not coming for a long time, and the bus drivers were having a long lunch.

label: guilt
text: My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too old for me.

label: shame
text: One day mother slaughtered a chicken for a brother who had come back for holiday. In everybody's absence I opened the foodstore and ate all internal organs of the chicken. When mother discovered, we were all called and I was found with hands stained with soup. I was ashamed being the eldest of all in the family.

label: fear
text: When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was filled with fear.

label: sadness
text: Marriage crises.  Boredom.

label: guilt
text: When I triffled with other people.

label: sadness
text: The news of the natural calamity, an earthquake in which hundreds  of Mexican people died.

label: guilt
text:
I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said "I am not a radiator".
fear,"My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool). Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we tried hard, we could not find out the cause.

label: guilt
text: Remembering (at the time I did not feel guilt) in recent yrs. how angry I would get when I was babysitting my new brother and he would not stop crying. I did not do anything harmful or shocking. But I feel guilty for treating him the way I did especially since I adore him now. That's why I spoil him now.

label: fear
text: When I sit for examinations.

label: guilt
text: Peeping.

label: guilt
text: At times I have been attracted to conducts which are socially degraded due to their ill consequences, and then I feel guilty.

label: shame
text: When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.

label: anger
text: Being subject to unfair treatment in a working group, someone "bending the rules" was protected by the boss. This resulted in more work for the others.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died thirteen years ago.

label: guilt
text: Not collecting letters for my friend al I promised.

label: joy
text: On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long time.

label: anger
text: The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called  the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.  I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining school to cool off.

label: sadness
text: It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate had an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutor caught him. During this time I was turning my question paper and it made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matter for him to be caught.

label: joy
text: I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

label: disgust
text: Given duty by the leaders which I do not like to do.

label: sadness
text: The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my grade six.

label: disgust
text: When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things about me when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friends with my boyfriend's other girl.

label: guilt
text: When I took away my best friend's boyfriend.

label: shame
text: When I gave my boyfriend a brush-off.

label: sadness
text: When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of Zambia.

label: anger
text: I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook (almanach).

label: joy
text: When I got my first unknown compound while doing my M.Sc research, I was very happy.  This is because my research was based on this type of reactions and compounds.

label: fear
text: When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver, after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely.

label: joy
text: When I passed the university entrance exam.

label: joy
text: The more than satisfactory result of a recently-completed university subject was communicated to me by phone.

label: guilt
text: I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I was with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.

label: anger
text: My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in my relationship with my girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a movie.

label: disgust
text: During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown  was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.

label: disgust
text: When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very hungry.

label: shame
text: I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough, and was told that my work was not up to standard.

label: fear
text: Thinking about death when walking alone at night.

label: joy
text: I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in an exam.  She told me that I had passed.

label: shame
text: When I noticed that a person I found attractive had seen me picking my nose.

label: guilt
text: One night, I went out with some friends for dinner and I did not tell my parents that I would come back late.  I thought of phoning but in the end I did not.  When I arrived home, my parents were very worried.

label: anger
text: My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heard this my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own good friend could do such a thing, so I got angry.

label: disgust
text: The first day I visited the hospital I was disgusted because I experienced offensive smell which I never expected. I nearly ran away from the course.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who had failed.  I wished that I had helped him.

label: shame
text: We had arranged a beach party with 20 people. There my father got drunk I felt very ashamed.

label: fear
text: I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I had to go the outside toilet on my own.

label: fear
text: I was walking home one night (after getting a bus to my town) when I was confronted by a group of males (about 6), they would not let me pass - they made comments etc. - I crossed the road and hurried home.

label: guilt
text: When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had been selected for the university.

label: joy
text: I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher Institute.

label: fear
text: At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.

label: fear
text: A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certain behaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid when I saw him.

label: disgust
text: I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if nothing had happened.

label: anger
text: I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter. However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too late.

label: guilt
text: For example, when I have promised something but I haven't fulfilled it.

label: fear
text: One summer when I was camping with friends they devised and elaborate plan to scare me by having our camp attecked by a wild animal (one of them) and then convincing the campground was the home of a satanic organization.

label: anger
text: As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

label: disgust
text: When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.

label: disgust
text: When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening to stories about torturing people or animals.

label: fear
text: I received a letter from my college telling me that I would not be allowed to sit for the exams because of my low attendance in class and the bad experience in the terminal exams.

label: joy
text: After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me extremely happy.

label: sadness
text: Recent break-up with my girlfriend. We had been together for over a year. I was overseas and discovered over the phone (while I was at work).

label: guilt
text: I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.

label: sadness
text: My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious and gained consciousness after some time. That time I was at school; this news reached me through someone.

label: shame
text: I had to meet a girlfriend to go out for a drink and she arrived with her aunt, to whom I was introduced.  Then the aunt left.

label: joy
text: One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was spontaneous and lots of fun.

label: disgust
text: I was shopping in Utrecht with friends, we also ate some chips and snacks in a snackbar, then we saw a shabby fellow. He took a cold half eaten croquette (a snack) from a rubbish bin and eat it.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.

label: sadness
text: My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years. His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

label: shame
text: For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and staring at us.

label: anger
text: When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the yard.

label: fear
text: When the car I was driving skidded on an icy road and landed in   a ditch with one side against a rock.

label: disgust
text: When I watched a film about the problems of abandoned children (PIXOTE).

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I entered at the University.

label: fear
text: When I nearly collided with another car.

label: joy
text: Finding out I am chosen to collect norms for Chinese aphasia (I will contribute to China's catching up with the West in neuropsychology).

label: guilt
text: I had gone to see one of our professors about a book, and I did not  attend the class she took a few minutes later.

label: fear
text: When I was travelling at night.

label: guilt
text: Once, I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lost it.

label: sadness
text: Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad experience which was changing his whole way of looking at life etc.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girl some time back and she is no longer mine that she said she was still mine.

label: guilt
text: I once stole my father's money and denied having done it. Instead father threatened my young brother and he was beaten. He was innocent and I felt guilty.

label: anger
text: When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any water for two days.

label: fear
text: The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast reports many traffic accidents and my boyfriend is driving home and still has 60 kilometers to go.

label: guilt
text: Not handing in homeworks in time.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she told me.

label: sadness
text: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well as her family etc.

label: guilt
text: After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearing something he had given me when I was with another guy. I was unaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the fact that he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respected his opinions of me.

label: disgust
text: When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.

label: joy
text: I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know that I almost had full marks.

label: fear
text: Just arrived in the university, not knowing anybody.

label: anger
text: My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old he was (79).

label: fear
text: When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I and my friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.

label: shame
text: It was during a school holiday - I was found necking a girl in my room by my father.

label: disgust
text: I was sitting in school, waiting for my sister to go home. Suddenly a boy put fire in a paper and threw it were I was sitting. The paper didn't get me, but I felt terribly disgusted at this cowardliness and irresponsibility that caused a great discussion. We went to the director and he, drunk as always, said that I was ... attention in school. I felt disgust of this situation, and of the persons implicated in it.

label: shame
text: When I was in grade one, one day I felt like going to the toilet during class but I was very scared of the teacher so I urinated in the class.

label: anger
text: A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town. Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment to be able to see her.

label: fear
text: After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.

label: joy
text: A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.

label: disgust
text: I discovered some pornographic literature in a workmates drawers. The literature featured pictures of naked women defecating on one another.

label: disgust
text: I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double dealers.

label: sadness
text: When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk of her being pregnant.

label: anger
text: I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.

label: sadness
text: My good friend misunderstood me.

label: guilt
text: I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital  for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.

label: guilt
text: When I feigned sick leave from work.

label: sadness
text: When I watched the T.V programme called "The living planet" and saw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man.

label: guilt
text: Not speaking to my sister-in-law due to lack of interest in a relationship on my side.

label: shame
text: When I arrived too late at a meeting of mentor (the night before the introduction of novices on the University start).

label: guilt
text: When someone is accused or punished instead of me.

label: anger
text: When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of my clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigations it was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boys in our hostel.

label: fear
text: I was nearly knocked down while I was cycling.

label: sadness
text: My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.  I felt sad about the coming several years.

label: joy
text: My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at the station.

label: sadness
text: When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing our relationship.

label: disgust
text: On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt on, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to see her. Later she saw me and said hi.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my father was sick.

label: shame
text: Being rude to somebody who was impolite to me.

label: sadness
text: I had taken the responsibility to do something and I had prepared for it.  However I failed because of my timidity.  After three attempts I still could not adapt to the atmosphere and failed as before.  I felt imcompetent and felt that the others would think that I had not prepared for it.

label: shame
text: During a party I overheard a conversation about china. When I wanted to give my opinion one of the people came out to be Chinese and his opinion was right of course.

label: fear
text: When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and respiration).

label: joy
text: I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I had been admitted to the university.

label: guilt
text: I am not very affectionate and I feel guilty as I do not give as much affection as I receive.

label: joy
text: First public speaking.

label: anger
text: A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about something.

label: guilt
text: I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front.  I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this neighbour's house.

label: anger
text: When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary mistakes concerning things I know and understand.

label: guilt
text: This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from the pot.

label: shame
text: I had lied to a person because I had thought that I could not tell him the truth. When he found out he was not angry but understanding. We talked the whole thing over.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine shot himself through the head after having told me and others that he would do so.

label: anger
text: In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions as negative. We however only posed several questions which she couldn't answer.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I saw on T.V the last slaughter of negroes in South Africa.

label: joy
text: I finished my homework; an important task.

label: anger
text: When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the world, and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worst and most hateful day of my life.

label: sadness
text: I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjects and I found that I had failed it.

label: guilt
text: A few days back a friend of mine had asked me to call on him on Sunday.  I had accepted it but later did not go for no specific   reason.  I just slept in my room.  The next day this friend called  me up and told me that he had been expecting me the day before and his wife had prepared a very good lunch for me, which had gone waste.  I felt very bad about this incident and it has been growing in my heart ever since.

label: sadness
text: My friend who was in the Bago was kicked out of the sorority.

label: fear
text: One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like that.

label: guilt
text: Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.

label: joy
text: I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well. I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her giving her a neck massage.

label: sadness
text: I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling for my boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years being together, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrow that I can call sadness.

label: guilt
text: The same event described under "shame".

label: joy
text: Article published in the college newspaper.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I belonged to a country which is amongst the poorest in the world and that inspite of having the resources we do not utilize them.  I was ashamed at myself and my country, shame at the lack of parity between the lifestyles of the citizens.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I didn't study enough for my exams and as a result I failed. I then invented idle stories to talk it good for myself and the others.

label: sadness
text: So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially my family - forever.

label: joy
text: Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me and cared for me.

label: guilt
text: I was at a boarding school during my primary school days. I was broken so I pretended I was very sick. My father came and he picked me up. He spent a lot of money on medical expenses which all proved to be negative.

label: guilt
text: When my ex-husband left our house, and the children cried because he was not coming back.

label: disgust
text: My classmate at TISS has the habit of biting his nails and ever since my childhood I have never liked this habit.  This person is near me in class, dining hall and the campus so I suggested that he should stop biting his nails.  However he found it difficult and my disgust feelings have not changed.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the money last term.

label: sadness
text: Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

label: joy
text: I had not studied very much for my final examination at school, so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I heard that I had passed it.

label: fear
text: I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.

label: fear
text: When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I fear that something will happen to the baby.

label: joy
text: Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that she loves me.

label: fear
text: I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow light.

label: joy
text: Thought had discovered true love.

label: sadness
text: When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he did nothing to relieve the situation.

label: disgust
text: When one individual takes advantage of and/or injures another relatively defenseless individual, consciously. I feel disgust mingled with anger. A person on my dorm floor verbally assaulted another person for having a certain religious belief.

label: guilt
text: I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.

label: anger
text: When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.

label: fear
text: When going out I am threatened regularly by two punk-girls.

label: shame
text: I was making very strong statements about infidelity in couples. Then I discovered that one of my best friends, who had just been through a very sad case of mutual infidelity, was listening.

label: disgust
text: I saw in the street a man spitting.

label: fear
text: When I went up the stairs in a high, dark house full of shadows, passed a door and had the feeling that someone or something was behind me, although I knew I was alone.

label: guilt
text: I spread abroad an intimate secret.

label: disgust
text: Four weeks ago I felt very much touched to find an asciatic patient who had asked the very morning to be tapped of the fluid, dying in the evening. I was really disgusted because this was the Medical staff's negligence. Had the Clinical officers done something that very morning he might have been alive today.

label: fear
text: When going out in the weekend I have to bike 5 kilometers through lonely and dark polders, then I always have terrifying fantasies.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I read an advertisement for a job as a chemist in the newspaper and when my friend asked me if I had applied for that job, I told him that I had not even seen the paper of that day.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I was young and left in my big house all alone.

label: guilt
text: I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the place.

label: shame
text: I was very ashamed when I failed a test in Standard 7. The teacher told the other students to shout and laugh at me.

label: disgust
text: I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, lied to me.

label: disgust
text: When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from my desk and put it on.

label: fear
text: Earlier, I was afraid of speaking in front of a crowd of people.

label: guilt
text: At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.  It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but when much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn, I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.

label: disgust
text: A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my own flat.

label: guilt
text: Forgetting a close friend's birthday.

label: joy
text: I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was working now.

label: sadness
text: I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.

label: shame
text: I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a disagreeable classmate watching the scene.

label: disgust
text: When my fellow classmates were involved in a quarrel.

label: joy
text: Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had thought possible.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by myself.

label: shame
text: I answered a certain question from Dr. Maqgda wrongly. She asked something about Femur and my answer was saying something concerning the brain. So I was very ashamed amongst my friends.

label: disgust
text: A teacher giving a test was called by a student by his first name. He (the teacher) said that he didn't give him this liberty.

label: fear
text: I was riding with a friend in his car. At a speed of 120 km/h on the snow-covered motorway I would have liked to get out.

label: anger
text: When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.

label: guilt
text: I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My friend relied on them.

label: fear
text: Waiting for the results of the High level examination.  I was afraid of not being accepted.

label: guilt
text: Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to do it due to transport troubles.

label: anger
text: In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory which he himself had never known. His information was from fortuitous sources.

label: guilt
text: Did not pick up a water mellon skin, someone slipped on it.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed of feeling sorry about myself when I passed through the situation of being betrayed by my girlfriend.

label: joy
text: I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.

label: sadness
text: When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He would have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination, even though his case was relatively mild.

label: shame
text: Last Summer I went camping with some C.U students.  As I was working then, I had to leave the second night (some of them had joined us the first night).  Next morning, 6 o'clock, a female classmate knocked on our door and tried to wake us up.  I was not fully conscious and I said something which I should not have.  I realized the trouble I had made and wanted to hide.  Later I said sorry to her and the matter came to an end.

label: fear
text: When I received the higher level exam results, I mistook the grade E in mathematics for a grade F and I was shocked.

label: disgust
text: An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

label: joy
text: When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the study for speech therapy.

label: fear
text: Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping from under my feet.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt while he was playing.

label: shame
text: Was accused of having hidden intentions in a situation when I believed I was acting honestly and fairly.

label: anger
text: Being insulted by my roommate.

label: shame
text: When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real bad about it.

label: anger
text: My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her chatting with another guy.

label: anger
text: I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.

label: guilt
text: I beat my young sister because she refused to wash plates. She started crying and I felt sorry and guilty for what I did.

label: guilt
text: Adolescent guilt growing up feeling "bad, immoral" sexual desires, some 10yrs ago.

label: guilt
text: When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.  The store then contacted my parents.

label: anger
text: Physical violence. A friend wouldn't listen to me I repeatedly tried to warn him, to no avail. Result: eight people were "pissed off".

label: fear
text: At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the next day they promised to take revenge on me.

label: sadness
text: The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very disgusting, especially because I was eating.

label: disgust
text: Foreign students playing loud music in the night before the biology examn.

label: anger
text: One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him for over an hour.

label: anger
text: Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?

label: fear
text: When I missed crashing, by a hair's breadth, into a man who came out 20 metres ahead of me when I was driving at 110km/h.

label: anger
text: At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve when on a class trip overseas.

label: shame
text: Yesterday while playing volley ball, there was one person extra    and somebody had to out.  A mess worker and I were the  last ones to arrive and we had arrived at the same time.  Rightfully one of us had to opt out of the game, as I was delaying leaving the mess worker opted out saying that I should play.  I felt ashamed of myself.

label: disgust
text: When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.

label: joy
text: When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.

label: joy
text: When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very good and we were very satisfied.

label: disgust
text: As a child, when I saw an "unesthetic" sight.

label: anger
text: Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.

label: guilt
text: When I was reproved eighth grade of high school.

label: guilt
text: Could not buy a reference book because I got up too late to cue.

label: shame
text: I thought I had taken a decision but I hesitated.

label: joy
text: The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. I can say those were the happiest months in my life.

label: guilt
text: I was with a girl one night and then did not call her again, although she had asked me to do so.

label: disgust
text: I went to a restaurant with my boyfriend for dinner. There we saw a couple. the man of the couple was a negro and he hadn't manners for eat.

label: sadness
text: Not getting a job.

label: guilt
text: My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of mine.

label: fear
text: I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into the woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escaped from the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I was afraid.

label: joy
text: When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.

label: joy
text: When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of 3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded pass).

label: sadness
text: When my brother's visa for the U.S.A got cancelled.

label: shame
text: I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill, while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he asked me if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.

label: fear
text: A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" -  I was so nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I got only blankness.

label: joy
text: I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade eight.

label: fear
text: One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground floor, I was often afraid of burglers.

label: anger
text: When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking out of the glass.

label: fear
text: I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous and overstrained.

label: disgust
text: During the week-end at home, my mother fries greasy and unhealthy meat dishes which make me feel sick.

label: fear
text: Lost my purse, the money in the purse belonged to my parents.

label: disgust
text: In Ward 1A was an epileptic patient who was burnt the whole body and was stinking very much such that the whole ward was affected. Few people could come near him.

label: anger
text: Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - when I returned several friends had had a party there, leaving the mess.

label: disgust
text: I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her pregnancy.

label: disgust
text: When I saw the film "Memorie of Prison" I saw a scene of masturbation of a man in the hold of a ship apart form fact that the film wasn't pleasant I had a leg of coconut candies in my hands.

label: disgust
text: Saw someone acting in a false manner in public.

label: anger
text: I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me, played cards with other people.

label: sadness
text: I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when a friend, I had always respected, insulted me in public.  He was drunk.

label: sadness
text: I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend the afternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled), watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances - pressures of examinations in particular.

label: guilt
text: A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.

label: disgust
text: I had been forced to get together with strange and disgusting classmates.  The things they talked about disgusted me and made me feel ill at ease.  I knew that I would feel unhappy if I stayed there but I was defeated by the social norms.

label: fear
text: When I did not get admission in M.Sc after my B.Sc, I felt really bad.  When I started my journey to Bombay, after having accepted my uncle's offer to come to Bombay, I was afraid, wondering if I  would succeed or not.

label: guilt
text: When I was a little girl about eight years old I broke the bey from a closed. Mother asked who did it. I said that it wasn't me, as I almost never lied, and my brother did it more frequently in spite my brother denieing it my mother gave him a few slaps.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a student like me.

label: joy
text: When in an economic crisis I got an unexpected sum of money.

label: anger
text: I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to tease me.

label: anger
text: A girl whom I trusted and with whom I had shared personal, confidential matters twisted the facts and told it to a common friend of ours.  When this common friend told me the version my friend had told her, I was angry.

label: fear
text: Fighting with class mates in Highschool.

label: disgust
text: I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.

label: disgust
text: When someone makes advances that one does not want.

label: anger
text: I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.

label: disgust
text: My husband falls ill and does not follow the doctor's advice on the treatment or the diet control.

label: shame
text: Being caught in changing the truth (lying).

label: anger
text: I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress my mind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerate at all.

label: guilt
text: When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt guilty.

label: sadness
text: Discovering that Lillehammer provided no musical environment that suits my taste, even though I had been told so.

label: joy
text: When, after a long time of searching I got my first job.

label: sadness
text: My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening, when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support me and I began to weep convulsively.

label: disgust
text: When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing going on in the world.

label: joy
text: I took a math midterm and I knew I did really well and it was Friday so I felt great joy because the week was over and I did well on a test.

label: guilt
text: Telling friends about your nickname.

label: anger
text: When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a chair.

label: fear
text: When I come home late at night.

label: sadness
text: It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my third year of my Secondary School.

label: disgust
text: When my parents insisted that I take up a teaching career.

label: sadness
text: The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.

label: shame
text: Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact with a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast to Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt shamed when I finally confronted her again.

label: joy
text: When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman games when I was eleven.

label: shame
text: I was swimming in the sea and a wave took the top part of my bikini away.

label: joy
text: Article published.

label: disgust
text: Yesterday, I was just about to cross the road when a country guy who was ahead of me spat out a mouthful of betel juice on the road.  It was very windy and had I not checked my speed I would have had a very good shower of his saliva.  Though I was not angry, I felt that these people were very indecent.

label: anger
text: When a little brother of mine damaged a cassette.

label: anger
text: When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money was found later.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a T.V programme on animals in the film world (mistreated and used).

label: fear
text: Going home alone through the forest after a girl guide (scout ?) meeting.

label: joy
text: I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on my birthday.

label: fear
text: When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good and had a bad smell.

label: anger
text: I worked with several classmates on a project.  I was very anxious about the project while my partners showed no concern  and when we had meetings on the project my classmates  did not pay any attention.  Some of them read books while the others argued on irrelevant questions.  The meeting would go on for two hours without the main theme being discussed.  We wasted time and could not reach a compromise.  My classmates avoided doing the work and the responsibilities, they seemed to value other projects more than this one.

label: disgust
text: When an uncle of mine who is very ill started to cough wich sounded very dirty. (He can't help it of course).

label: sadness
text: I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because of different commitments concerning life and career.  I loved her as a person but could not agree with the life the future would demand.  Parting from her was very sad.

label: anger
text: I was angry this morning when I missed the train to university.

label: guilt
text: One saturday night I did some meaningless work and went to bed very late.  Next morning I had was very sleepy so I continued sleeping even though I had work to do and I missed the Sunday service.

label: fear
text: I feel afraid of the way a great friend looks at me, and also a little afraid of the directions that it's going.

label: sadness
text: When my family heard that my Mother's cousin who lives in England wrote us to tell that he had cancer of the lymph glands.

label: sadness
text: A friend told me that he had suffered in love and in academics.  I shared his sadness.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the elementary human norms.

label: sadness
text: When someone in my family died.

label: sadness
text: When I was not chosen to go to your English lectures.

label: sadness
text: Leaving home to move closer to University. As an oldest child, this experience was traumatic for both my parents and myself.

label: disgust
text: During a recent meeting, Mr. A showed his excitement and overindulged in the notes delivered.  Though his curiosity could not be blamed, his way of accquiring knowledge was an extreme behaviour e.g he always tried to know what I was reading and gained everything he could.

label: fear
text: Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an expected miscarriage.

label: sadness
text: My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school weakened.

label: joy
text: When I realized that I loved someone of the opposite sex.

label: anger
text: When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning the South African boycott.

label: anger
text: We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  by hitting one of them.

label: disgust
text: When I found a maggot in my food at the dinning hall, all the food had gone bad.

label: joy
text: When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my registration at UNZA.

label: joy
text: While dancing in a restaurant last week.

label: anger
text: When our religion teacher presented shocking sectarian thoughts and doom's day as official teaching.

label: sadness
text: When I went to see the dead body of my uncle.  This was a very dramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered a mortuary.

label: anger
text: When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something would not occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenly I saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence, and irresponsibility of that person.

label: sadness
text: Last night I did not do very well in one of the subjects.  Before the result was announced I feared that I would fail.  Finally I got a D and as the results of the other subjects were not all      good I felt a little sad.

label: disgust
text: In a public swimming hall I saw a very aggressive man who practically attacked the children who got in his way when he was swimming.

label: fear
text: Getting back my Psych 140 midterm.

label: sadness
text: For not having succeded in getting the job as a translator that I wanted.

label: joy
text: The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.

label: fear
text: We were driving on a very dusty road at night and the driver tried to overtake a very big truck only to find another big truck parked right in front.

label: sadness
text: When one of my best friends commited siucide during these holidays.

label: sadness
text: It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.

label: disgust
text: When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ate up the contents of another patient's spitoon.

label: disgust
text: I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.

label: joy
text: When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.

label: joy
text: After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.

label: fear
text: I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.

label: disgust
text: In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for his family and himself.

label: shame
text: I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time she genuinely took notice of it. I felt shame that I was almost taking the part of a husband, or at least an equal which I should not.

label: sadness
text: Death in the close family.

label: anger
text: My parents did not approve my choice of a boyfriend (now an ex-boyfriend).  He happened to be 13 years older than me and he was considered completely unsuitable for me.  IDIOT.

label: shame
text: Being unable to stop urinating on the bus.

label: shame
text: Since I've been here I haven't written to any of my relatives. I got a letter from my mom telling me how upset my grandparents are from not hearing from me.

label: guilt
text: Not beeing able to stay with my mother for the National Day holiday.

label: sadness
text: My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems.

label: guilt
text: I slammed my little brother into a wall because he was bothering me.

label: shame
text: Whenever I am late, I feel ashamed of myself even though no one tells me anything.

label: fear
text: Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny noises. I was terribly frightened.

label: fear
text: After having watched a crime show on the TV, I was about to take the dog for a walk. Then, suddenly, there was a man on the porch... (We live some distance away from other people).

label: shame
text: I always feel ashamed when I do not succeed in accomplishing something in which I had put in all my efforts.

label: guilt
text: Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage that occurred at the building site I had designed.

label: joy
text: Getting a part-time job.

label: joy
text: When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And most important she also liked me.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a murder).

label: guilt
text: My mother always evokes feelings of guilt in me. For instance when I miss the last bus I know she will be concerned for me and stay awake till I arrive.

label: disgust
text: Saw a man dressed as a woman.

label: disgust
text: Saw my father with that woman he is married to now.

label: joy
text: When I learnt that I was selected for form I.

label: guilt
text: I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until several weeks later.

label: disgust
text: In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.

label: shame
text: I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was my friend.

label: disgust
text: An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to me.

label: guilt
text: Some students have been calling lecturers nicknames and I was not able to find out who they were to stop them.

label: shame
text: I felt this feeling during the exam in higher mathematics.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

label: sadness
text: When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

label: disgust
text: When we complained about the uncleanliness of the work place, the authorities agreed to have the place cleaned.  Even after 2-3 days nothing had been done.  I felt disgusted at the whole situation.

label: shame
text: I insulted a couple of good friends of mine and even tried to hit them when I was drunk.  The next day, I was ashamed of course.

label: sadness
text: This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.

label: fear
text: One evening when my sisters, brothers and I were watching T.V my kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french windows.  I thought that these lights that we could see were coming from torches annd that it meant that there were thieves outside.

label: fear
text: Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back and molested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration did not occur as the driver of the car stopped that.

label: sadness
text: At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred during university examinations and therefore I was unable to attend her funeral.

label: shame
text: Swearing in public.

label: shame
text: I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not have fitted in and there was something in that.

label: anger
text: One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was serious.

label: shame
text: When I had my first sexual relation and it didn't work.

label: shame
text: When I let my girlfriend use my essay to help her to write hers and the tutor found them alike.

label: guilt
text: When I got very drunk and really misbehaved at Christmas.

label: sadness
text: When I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I would not be coming back home for a long time.

label: joy
text: When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

label: guilt
text: Did not do what I promised to do for a friend.

label: disgust
text: The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in a black rubbish bag.

label: joy
text: Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink made with milk and usually drunk warm) with my friend at College. We get on really well, don't withold any feelings about each other's friends and are pretty good at cheering each other up when we are homesick.

label: anger
text: A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the same day.

label: joy
text: When planning to marry.

label: guilt
text: By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.

label: anger
text: It was when my friend had stolen my money (K10) and had disappeared.

label: anger
text: I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers dropped out.

label: joy
text: I felt a great joy when I knew that my father was going to sell the apartment from GUARUSA, because in some way we were helded by it, that means that we didn't go to any other place, because we had the apartment.

label: anger
text: In September 1984, I was forced to live with someone I did not like.  The first week we were at loggerheads and our conversation was like a debate.  The atmosphere was very bad.  When he learnt that I had got 95 marks in a test he told me " A failure, You lost 5 marks."   I was very angry, not because my marks were lower than his, but because I could not tolerate his pride.  I did not show my discontentment and carried on doing my work.

label: anger
text: Receiving personal criticisms early in the morning.

label: disgust
text: The price I was charged for work on my car.

label: anger
text: I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend inadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long time. And at times still get angry at him.

label: sadness
text: There is a boy who I love very much. I asked him to have dinner with me, but he refused I don't know why he didn't go with me, but I felt very lonely.

label: disgust
text: Some people whom I do not like at all, and one of the reasons is their physical appearance.

label: joy
text: When I first came to the campus.

label: anger
text: Some boys deliberately played tricks on me in the experiments.

label: guilt
text: When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.

label: fear
text: Sometime back I used to stay with my mum alone then time came when dad joined the family from his working place I found myself having fear for him for no cause at all.

label: fear
text: I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that the dogs may be outside.

label: fear
text: Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night.  It was very dark and I could not even see my nose.  I did not know that it was the birds till my mother told me so.

label: fear
text: I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we   saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have any legs.

label: fear
text: One of my fellow students had bunked field work and in my attempt to cover up for him I myself was exposed, though not directly.  We were to meet our field work suprevisor and we were afraid of the consequences.

label: joy
text: After my final examination at school I was glad that the examination was over and that I had passed it.

label: joy
text: When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.

label: sadness
text: After receiving the grade on the paper mentioned in FEAR.

label: guilt
text: At secondary school, one of my classmates lost her locker key.  During a class I saw two other classmates holding a key and talking secretly.  I do not know why I suspected them, also another classmate supported me.  He remembers that these people had only one key in the key-ring, this had seemed strange to him.  Besides another classmate said that he had seen them selling books at a book-shop and they should not have had such books.  I told the teacher and the person was caught.  He had sold the books and was forced to quit school.  I found that I had not helped him as he stole later on also.  I felt guilty

label: guilt
text: I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him anything.

label: fear
text: Heard some ghost-like noise at night.

label: sadness
text: The death of my grandfather.

label: anger
text: The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.

label: shame
text: My father was very angry with another man in the presence of my friends.

label: disgust
text: Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something funny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl's face.

label: anger
text: When my neighbours accused my brother of stealing their rose-bush, I was very angry as he had not touched it at all.

label: fear
text: I was in Sierra Nevada, climbing a peak over 3,000 metres high, without any light and with many other problems.  I was afraid for my life.

label: joy
text: I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at the Chinese university of H.K.  It was 7 o'clock in the morning.  Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea with them very joyfully.

label: fear
text: After mischieviously ringing on the chemist's trade-entrance doorbell and getting caught by him.

label: shame
text: When the cast general election resulted in Norway getting a conservative government.

label: fear
text: Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in doing his duty.

label: shame
text: Cheating to get the best grade on a test in 7th grade.

label: disgust
text: A boyfriend with whom I split up with came over to a friend's house where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontation in another room he tried to find out if I was aroused by my friend by feeling my parts.

label: anger
text: Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth. They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelve weeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said I needed psychiatric treatment and give me no support.

label: anger
text: Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.

label: shame
text: When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make the coffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and I thus arrived half an hour late to the class.  On top of this the coffee was undrinkable.

label: joy
text: I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationship grew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I found out how he felt about me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died, with whom I had a very close relationship.

label: fear
text: Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.

label: fear
text: My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked on mucus secretions.

label: joy
text: When the Cambridge results came out and I obtained a first division.  I had been thinking that I had not done very well.

label: fear
text: When I walked to church with my roommate, a bum told us to call the police and he started following us.

label: disgust
text: I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.

label: guilt
text: I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school (with success).

label: disgust
text: I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.

label: joy
text: When I learnt that I could do further studies at the Chinese university.

label: sadness
text: One night a very dear person said: "I hate you". Of course it was an impulse and this person didn't feel that about me. The person expressed regret, and everything was settled, but I can't forget.

label: guilt
text: Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.

label: anger
text: In a tram, the ticket seller was commanding, taking the role of a leader, trying to emphasize her non-existent authority with undue strictness towards a good-humoured drunk who could not find his ticket at once.

label: fear
text: Fear of doing well on a midterm.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.

label: anger
text: (1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year after my father died and this angered me more as I thought he should be dead and not my father.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

label: anger
text: I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics. Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and started to cry. I grew angry.

label: shame
text: Falling over.

label: shame
text: After a party in which I made love with a boy in public. Later on I heard that others were talking about me and called me a slut.

label: anger
text: I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I was the quietest girl in class.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.

label: guilt
text: When a friend of mine was beaten for what was my fault.

label: disgust
text: I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that was stinking.

label: anger
text: When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.

label: anger
text: When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.

label: guilt
text: I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardly studied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that I hadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.

label: joy
text: After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we are able to pay for.

label: sadness
text: A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange manner.

label: joy
text: When I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selected to go to a Boarding secondary school.

label: disgust
text: It was when my father beat my mother while she was ill for three weeks and now she was recovering.

label: joy
text: When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature National Olympiad.

label: anger
text: When people without my permission pry in my belongings and take things out of it.

label: sadness
text: Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now I remember about it quite often.

label: fear
text: When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and ordered me to give them money or face death.

label: disgust
text: When the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.

label: shame
text: When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had told him that my father had retired.

label: fear
text: When I was going to bring back my girlfriend to LA to meet my parents.

label: sadness
text: I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I cried for several days because I was so sad.

label: guilt
text: A boy who shot dead a squirrel.

label: disgust
text: When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had changed.

label: joy
text: My class winning against another class in a football match.

label: sadness
text: In May 18th, 1984 my boyfriend went to the U.S.A. In December I was told he passed away. He had cancer of the Oesophagus.

label: anger
text: Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned" relations.

label: disgust
text: I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her awfully.

label: fear
text: Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked in me many negative emotions.

label: disgust
text: I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war. After the film I felt disgust.

label: joy
text: I was in hospital, and then was visited by someone quite unexpected.

label: shame
text: When I got very low marks in one of the assignments.

label: disgust
text: A man sexually aggressed a small girl in the bus but the girl did not dare to speak out.

label: disgust
text: When my friend got very low marks in field work even though he had worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.

label: guilt
text: Criticizing my mother when she refused to drive with the radio on. I told her that I thought she wasn't intelligent enough to cope with the radio.

label: disgust
text: A sister broke a cup and when mother asked I was reported to have been responsible.

label: fear
text: Passing (by car) over a bridge where only one car could pass. There was a precipice on both sides, no protection grilles, and the bridge was completely muddled.

label: anger
text: I was with my girlfriend when some guys that I don't like made fuss at my girl.

label: fear
text: Once I was very frightened at night as I had a very fearful and terrifying dream, I could not go back to sleep for a long time.

label: guilt
text: One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lump of soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. I thought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately he did not and he put it in his mouth.

label: fear
text: When I was 8 years old, I would usually come home from school with my mother in a car.  For the first time I had to take the school bus, and I mistook the bus stop and found myself two kilometres away from where I lived.  I was very scared, wondering how I would get back home.

label: shame
text: I think that the only time I really felt shame was when I was very young and I had to defecate on the street.  I was very worried in case someone should see me.

label: sadness
text: Being sexually assulted and told my friends about it (we cried together).

label: disgust
text: When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that disgusted me.

label: fear
text: I was not prepared for the exam but I wanted to sleep the night before the exam.

label: fear
text: Alone in the house (late 8pm) I heard noises. Sounded like someone was trying to get in our back door.

label: fear
text: When I forgot the lines of the play during an orientation camp.

label: anger
text: Boyfriend "chatting up" another girl.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than to my mother.

label: anger
text: When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.

label: guilt
text: I was travelling in a bus from school going home for holiday. In the bus unfortunately I stepped on a bag in which there were delicate things.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a documentary film about World War II (about Hitler and his adepts).

label: anger
text: We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.  Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

label: joy
text: When I was in the sauna bath.

label: disgust
text: Saw someone licking his dining bowl.

label: anger
text: Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.

label: guilt
text: The time I was at secondary school during the holiday I appeared to my father while heavily drunk and I talked nonsense like in some sort of carefree.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in the scouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and at times just plain rude behavior.

label: disgust
text: Heard someone boasting his fortune telling and I knew he was lying.

label: shame
text: When a professor caught me absent-minded and not paying attention to what he was saying.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months pregnant and that I was responsible for the "damages".  This made me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine.

label: joy
text: I won a sport contest.

label: anger
text: When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for not having the time to write a good essay.

label: anger
text: When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He embarassed me in front of a crowd.

label: guilt
text: When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous day.

label: disgust
text: I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had left me.

label: shame
text: After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

label: shame
text: I kicked the dog outside on a cold night because he was annoying me. The next day he came down with the flu and we thought he was going to die.

label: anger
text: A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let me go to your English lecture.

label: guilt
text: My mother wants to talk very often about her life. I dislike this because she always talks negatively about the same people whatever I do it doesn't help.

label: fear
text: I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

label: fear
text: I was scared in the dark when I was a little boy.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was selected to start Nursing.

label: sadness
text: When I found out that I had failed to pass my exams during the term by one point.  The fact that exactly the same thing had happened last term did not help.

label: sadness
text: After a disagreement between my parents, when I was alone with my father and my sister, the aggression continued, when my father tried to put me and my sister against my mother revealing facts that had happened in the past like a talk between my father and his mother in law where she told him that my mother was not quite save.

label: guilt
text: One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.

label: fear
text: Before one of my final exams of the third year - natural sciences.

label: disgust
text: A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I was able to break loose.

label: shame
text: Had a very good friend. We grew apart I found myself running her down to other friends.
